loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 31-year-old married woman. She has a business of buying and selling cattle with the support of her husband.  She also sells milk to generate extra income. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.  She, along with her husband, has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. She crops different vegetables and fruits and then sells them in the local market. Her husband also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Abida applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Jessibel

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Jessibel lives in Matag-ob, Leyte. She is 36 years old with three children, ages 8-12. Jessibel supports them by raising hogs for an income. This business started last year and allows her to earn an income of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy another piglet and feed and pay for barn repair. She hopes that the loan will be a start for a more reliable livelihood someday.

In the future, she hopes that her children will be successful in their education.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and feed and pay for barn repair

loans.name: Senema

texts.en:
Senema is a merchant from Carles, Iloilo. A 51-year-old mother of two grown children, Senema runs her sari-sari (or variety) store  selling various goods and items to the people in her community. Senema has been in business for several years now. This is her main source of income.

Senema is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, sugar, soda and beverages, bread and snack foods. Senema believes that this loan could help her improve her store as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, sugar, soda and beverages, bread and snack foods

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 45-year-old married mother of three children. She is very hard working woman. 

Ten years ago, Shamim started her business selling goats with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. At present, she has two goats. In order to expand her earnings, Shamim has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to buy more baby goats for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats.

loans.name: Qaim

texts.en:
Qaim is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business selling animals. She has been doing it for many years to contribute in the family income. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; she has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. This will help her to increase her sales and profits. 

Qaim dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Sonia is a married woman who has two children. She has been in the work of hand embroidery for supporting her husband financially. She is an expert in making beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

She is in her eighth loan cycle with good credit history. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, pearls and glittering material for its embellishment. It will allow her to meet the demand of her customers on time. She dreams for her children’s bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, pearls and glittering material

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has dealt in the business of selling cloth for the period of about 10 years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She can manage her household activities though her business. 

She requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloth for the summer season

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is a vigorous, 47-year-old lady; she has been running her tailoring business from last 10 years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to increase her revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
This is Edmond, a married father of a 5-month-old child who wants to rent 50 dynyms (12 acres) of agricultural land from his neighbors. 

Edmond plans to plant wheat and corn in larger quantities; he sees this as a good opportunity to make it a business. He already has 13 dynyms of agricultural land; on 8 dynyms he has planted wheat, and corn in the 5 dynyms and he has a goat and chickens and sells eggs and raw milk to the local market. In addition to the agricultural activity, he works for a pay of $250 per month as a night guard and he owns a tractor and works for other villagers as well.

loans.use: to rent about 50 dynyms of agricultural land to plant wheat and corn in large quantities.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 58-year-old woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with support of her son at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and many other things to keep up with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, and many other things

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en: Pathani is a 34-year-old married woman running a business buying and selling cattle with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of 5 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate more revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Tayyaiba

texts.en:
Tayyaiba is a 36-year-old married woman who has 5 children. 

She is a vigorous lady, and for the past 2 years she has been running a cloth purchase-and-sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings and she plans to spend a part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Qnar

texts.en:
Qnar lives in Mkhchyan village of Ararat region. She is an experienced agronomist and lives with her husband, son, daughter and parents-in-law. With the help of her family members, Qnar is engaged in breeding livestock such as cows and calves, as well as the cultivation of some forage for the livestock. Qnar also owns two greenhouses where different flowers are grown.

The family sells these agricultural products in their local market. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. As autumn is progressing, Qnar needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to develop in a sustainable way. She needs a loan of USD $3,000 to purchase forage for her livestock and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. Qnar and her family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be very thankful for the help in sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and from the community of Matag-ob in Leyte. She is married with four children. Her eldest child is 26 and the youngest is 18. For five years now, she has been raising hogs for a living. This usually earns her 9,000 PHP per month. 

Susana is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed to expand her business to earn a better profit. She is optimistic that she can do more if she has additional capital. She hopes to continue working hard and improving her business so she can save and help provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen has successfully built her beauty parlor business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she has attained a good number of customers and now makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. 

Now she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more packs of beauty and skin care products along with packs of hair rollers and combs. This will enable her to cater to more people at her salon, which will ultimately help to generate more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of beauty and skin care products, and packs of hair rollers and combs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for manual labor to attend to her crops.

loans.name: Wendnasikribo Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAIDOU est le représentant du groupe WENDNASIKRIBO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 07 enfants, le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 18 mois. 01 va à l’école. Il a 02 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est agriculteur depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants du marché de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 1sacs d’engrais et d’insecticide.
Mr SAIDOU veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer  son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr Saidou is the representative of the Wendnasikribo group. He is doing very well. He is married and the father of seven children, the eldest of whom is 13 years old and the youngest 18 months. One goes to school. He has two other persons under his care.

He has been a farmer for five years. He gets his supplies at markets in the surrounding area. His customers are merchants at his neighborhood market. He wants to buy one bag each of fertilizer and insecticide.

Mr Saidou wants to use his profits to bolster his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy one bag each of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 45-year-old married woman with 5 children. 

Her husband is a laborer, and it was very tough for Zarina to manage her household needs with her husband's small income, so she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her cloth trading business. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

She is in her 7th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of embroidered and fancy cloth in different colors for her business. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of embroidered and fancy cloth in different colors

loans.name: Raghdah

texts.en:
Raghdah is a 23-year-old single young lady from a village called Beit Our near Ramallah city. She lives with her family in a small house. 

Raghdah graduated recently from a local university where she studied Accounting. She works in a local company now to help her family with their expenses. 

However, Raghdah still has some debt owing to the university which she would like to pay off in order to receive her certificate. She has therefore taken out a USD loan from FATEN which will help her to pay off these university expenses.

Raghdah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay off her debt on university expenses

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a married woman who has been running a business manufacturing carpets for the past two years. She is very famous in her circle for providing various designs of carpets. She is in charge of providing her family with their bread and butter. 

She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Because of her trust in this institution, she has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, polypropylene fibers, etc. With these materials her business will be able to flourish more and will enable her to earn enough to support her family well.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, polypropylene fibers, etc.

loans.name: Sayada

texts.en:
Sayada is a 49-year-old married woman. 

For the past 6 years she has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town, where she has a strong customer base. 

She is in her 7th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 47-year-old married mother of four children who has been working for the past twenty-two years tailoring clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Nada's children's expenses are increasing as they grow up, especially their education expenses; she works hard with her husband to make sure that her children get the best education for a better future. Thus, Nada is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay the increasing school tuition fees of her children.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future to provide better living conditions for her beloved kids.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Berdik village of Ararat region with her parents. She is a seller at a local food store. Besides her work in the store, Armine is involved in agriculture. She keeps cows and hens and sells milk and meat. 

Armine works hard in order to insure the family's livelihood and secure her family's living. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase two oxen and some forage for feeding the livestock. The profits from this purchase will help Armine cover daily costs and expand the number of livestock even further in the future.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and some forage for feeding her livestock.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 22-year-old single lady. She works hard with her sister and brother to support their beloved family which consists of two other additional members.  Their father has a critical medical situation and can’t work at all.  That’s why, in February 2014, Mariam started working in a clothing shop to cover her needs and living expenses, in addition to her family’s too.

Mariam’s limited salary didn’t affect her willing to continue her education, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university fees.

This loan is very important to Mariam for she will be able to continue her studies, graduate, and work in her major domain (Law) and thus improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is 28 years of age. Her great skill is in machine embroidery and six years of experience in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over time, the demand for her embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for her daily expenses. Sumera is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behaviour. She has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.  She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le, pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez la continua  dedicándose a la crianza de animales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos para sus animales.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernadina continues working in farming, she has had her business for quite some time and it's going well due to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She is also still working in animal husbandry, as this is the way that she gets her family through.

She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her animals.

She is grateful for the loan and commits to paying the installments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La socia Bacilia se dedica al negocio de venta de pasto, la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pasto.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bacilia sells fodder for a living and works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She has been in business for five years and it is going well for her.  Her dream is to have a grocery store one day.

The loan she is requesting is to buy fodder.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fodder.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
El Sr. Anastasio, sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y ganaderia, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio  valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos para sus animales
texts.en:
Anastasio belongs to the Communal Bank “San Martin de Zurite” which is located in the village of Zurite in Anta Province, Department of Cusco. He continues to engage in agriculture and livestock breeding. He values and is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it back on time, since this is how he supports his family.

The loan he is requesting is to buy feed for his animals.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a freezer to replace the one she has now which is damaged.

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: Sekanabo est commerçante, trésorière de la banque  villageoise Aksante Mungu, cliente de l’IMF Hekima,  divorcée, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 3 enfants et tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari, quand ils etaient encore ensemble. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires au marché dans un dépôt depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter 30 sacs de farine de manioc. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sekanabo is a merchant, who is 34 years old and divorced. She is the mother of three children who go to school. She is also a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima and the treasurer of the banque villageois Aksante Mungu.

She started her business with funds she received from her husband, when they were still together. She has been selling food products at a market in a depot for ten years.

She is going to buy 30 sacs of cassava flour [with her loan]. 

Sekanabo wishes to increase her credit limit, and educate, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacs of cassava flour

loans.name: Assade

texts.fr: Assade se sent heureux en utilisant son prêt Kiva pour la premiere fois pour acheter des produits EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp. Assade vit à Port-au-Prince et il est célibataire. Assade possède déjà un Business la-dedans il vend des parfums, des valises. Avec le prêt Kiva, Assade fera des achats des produits d'Energies renouvelables. Assade veut augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Assade is glad to use his first Kiva loan to buy one of the EarthSpark Enèji Pwòp products. He lives in Port-au-Prince and is single. 

Assade already owns one business where he sells perfumes and suitcases. With this Kiva loan, he is going to buy renewable energy products.

Assade wants to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy renewable energy products

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: Agnes est commerçante, femme eleveur, membre de la banque communautaire Mufariji, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 6 enfants, 4 vont a l’école et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu dans son élevage. Elle est vendeuse des friperies depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperies. Son conjoint est un cultivateur. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, améliorer les conditions de vie, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Agnes is a merchant, a female stockbreeder, a member of the banque communautaire Mufariji, and a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is married, 30 years old, and a mother of six children, of whom four go to school while the other two are already grown. Her husband is a farmer.

Agnes started her business from funds she received from her stockbreeding. She has now been selling used clothing for eight years. [With her loan,] she is going to buy one bale of used clothing. 

Agnes wishes to increase her line of credit. She would also like to educate and feed her children and improve their quality of living. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fans

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur MAMADOU est né vers 1968 à SIKASSO, marié, père de 8 enfants résidant avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur MAMADOU après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est initié dans le domaine d’aviculture. Il dispose d’une  ferme il y a des nombreuses de tête d’oiseau (poulet, pintade, oie, dindon, pigeon, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses volailles qui sont de bonnes qualités et bien suivis par des vétérinaires qualifiés. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de joindre l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso, il est à son cinquième  prêt individuel. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce cinquième prêt, il compte acheter 50 poulets, 12 pintades, 10 paires de dindons, 4 paires de canards, 20 paires de oie, et des médicaments et nourritures de sa basse-cour. Il achète ses volailles dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les prêts et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mamadou was born around 1968 in Sikasso. He is now married and a father of eight children. He lives with his spouse and children in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou 1, one of the popular neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

After having tried various jobs without success, Mamadou started his own business in poultry farming. He manages a farm with a number of various types of birds: chicken, guinea fowl, geese, turkey, pigeon, etc. He is highly sought after by his customers for the quality of his poultry, who are well looked after by qualified veterinarians. 

To satisfy his customers who are growing in number, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his fifth individual loan. His previous loans have been repaid correctly. 

With this fifth loan, he plans to buy 50 chickens, 12 guinea fowls, 10 pairs of turkeys, four pairs of ducks, 20 pairs of geese, along with medicine and food.

Mamadou buys his poultry from the surrounding villages and in the town of Sikasso.

WIth this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which he will use to pay back his loan and its interest and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the raw materials for dyeing

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province, Chea is 46 years old. She is married with four children who depend on her for support. To make a living, she raises pigs and supplements her income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Chea's seventh cycle with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so they can be sold for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 52-year-old woman from the province of Leyte. She is married with one grown daughter. For the last 10 years, Flora has been engaged in farming eggplant and buying and selling of vegetables. This allow her to generate an average income of 6,000 PHP every month. She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables from local farmers that she can resell for a profit.

It is her hope that she can improve her farm and expand her buy and sell business for a better chance of saving and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables from farmers to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 44-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo) for the past 12 years. She has one buffalo and one cow in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.

She has five children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through their support. Now she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in her sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Erhan

texts.en:
This is Erhan, a member of the Egyptian Albanian community. He is a single man and lives in the district of Lezha not far from the beaches.  Erhan does fishing and sells fish to the nearby restaurants. He also plants and sells agricultural fresh or dried produce such as cabbage, kale, beans and potatoes and seasonal veggies. He also has chickens and turkeys and sells eggs and hens.  “I like being busy and doing many things at once. Living in a village, someone has lots of opportunities to earn an income and this is what I have been doing and I just love it. I’ve goals and want to achieve them,” said Erhan smiling.
  
Erhan is requesting this loan to buy fishing nets and a used boat and other necessary items for fishing.

loans.use: to buy nets, a boat and other neccessary tools/items for his fishing activity.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur YACOUBA est né en Avril 1977 à Sikasso, il est marié, père de 5 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à BOUGOULA-HAMEAU un quartier populaire de la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Il mène des activités d’achat et de vente des marchandises de boutique ( sucre, bonbon, thé,huile,lait plus divers marchandises de la boutique), il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso.
 Il est à son neuvième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 3 sacs de 50 kg de sucre, 10 cartons du thé, 20 sachets de 12 paquets de bonbon, 3 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 10 cartons de lait en poudre  et plus divers marchandises de la boutique. Sa vente se fait dans sa boutique à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 84 000 francs CFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba was born in April 1977 in Sikasso. He is married with five children and he lives in his home with his wife in a traditional family in Bougoula-Hameau, a popular district of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the republic of Mali.
He buys and sells groceries (sugar, sweets, tea, oil, milk, and various other products). He buys his supplies at the big market in Sikasso.
This is his ninth individual loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution that he has contracted hoping to satisfy his growing clientele.
The previous loans were repaid correctly.
This loan will enable him to buy three sacks of 50 kilos of sugar, 10 boxes of tea, 20 sachets of 12 packets of sweets, three cans of 20 litres of oil, 10 cartons of powdered milk, and various other products for his shop. He sells his goods in his shop to a mixed clientele for cash and for credit.
He plans to make an average monthly profit of 84'000 francs CFA. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and the interest and reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Lezyl

texts.en: Lezyl is a married woman and a mother of three children from Carles, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. Lezyl is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat and new fishing nets. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lezyl hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and new fishing nets

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en: Hranush is a farmer from Gay village in the Armavir region. She is a divorced woman who lives with her mother and four-year-old twin daughters. To be able to take care of themselves, Hranush and her mother are engaged in the cultivation of cucumbers, tomatoes, cabbage and peppers. Hranush's mother sells the agricultural products in the local market. Farming is the only source of income for the family. As the autumn is progressing, Hranush needs to renovate the greenhouse, and purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, tomato seeds and fertilizer. To reach that goal, she needs a loan of USD 3,000. Hranush and her mother greatly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and they will be very thankful to the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, tomato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  MANCOURANI I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme CHATA debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes DANAYA, fait la vente des mèches. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  7 cartons de 12 unités de mèches de qualités différentes au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché ou elle dispose une luxe beauté à une clientèle composée des femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Danaya group are married women who on average are 44 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Mancourani 1, a popular district of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their 17th solidarity loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to satisfy their clientele.
Mrs. Chata, who is standing first on the left in the photo of this group of women of the Danaya group, sells strands of hair.
With her loan she plans to buy seven boxes of 12 units of different quality strands at the big market where she is much in demand due to the quality of her merchandise. She will sell them retail at the market where she has a luxury beauty stall, to a female clientele for cash and for credit. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 48 000 francs CFA, part of which she will use to repay the loan and the interest and part of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy strands of hair for women.

loans.name: Arjan

texts.en:
Arjan is 39 years old. He is married and has two children who are six and four years old.
 
Arjan does agriculture to earn a living. He plants and sells dried beans and onions in large quantities and has grapevines. The loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek that he is requesting from Kiva lenders will be used to buy seeds for planting and for renting agricultural land from other villagers who don’t use the land at the moment. 

A bit about his village: it’s a hilly village known mainly for the large quantities of chestnut where residents mainly plant beans, onions, potatoes and corn and they have cows, goats, sheep, grapevines, apple trees and plum trees.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land from other villagers and buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Charmae Ann

texts.en:
Charmae Ann is only 26 years old, but she is a hardworking married woman with three children. Her children are aged 3, 5, and 7. Charmae Ann has multiple businesses to her name as well. She raises hogs, has a vulcanizing business, sells gasoline, and sells food. She usually cooks barbecue for additional income. She is asking for a loan to be used as additional capital to buy feed, piglets, gasoline, vulcanizing shop equipment and ingredients for barbecue like pork, soy sauce, and spices.

Charmae Ann knows that it entails perseverance and patience to make her business a success. In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger so she can support her children better.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, gasoline, vulcanizing shop equipment and ingredients for barbecue like pork, soy sauce, and spices

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
La socia  Jacoba se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jacoba works with traditional crafts and she sells different textiles, blankets, sweaters, and looms. She has been working in this area for 10 years and she does very well for herself. Her dream is to expand the part of her business that sells textiles and looms. She is asking for a loan in order to buy textiles, sweaters and looms. 

Jacoba is very happy at the prospect of this loan and she promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy textiles, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is a married lady living with her husband in Zarqa, Jordan. Besides the fact that living costs in Jordan have increased given the demand driven by Syrian refugees, it was hard for Feryal to find a job. She started her business which is selling blankets and electric machines one year ago to help her husband in paying their household costs, and her business is profitable. 

Feryal is aiming to expand her business. To do so, she needs to raise her profits and to expand her shop, and she is now requesting a loan to buy more blankets and electric machines.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and electric machines for her business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Aratashen village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and son. To be able to meet the costs of her family, Julieta is engaged in cultivation of haricots, cucumber and tomatoes. Farming is an important source of income for the family. 

In order to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Julieta needs a loan of 1,500 USD to pay for pump for the greenhouse, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. The family highly relies on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for helping them to collect the needed amount of loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a pump for the greenhouse, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Dromo and are five women who are all merchants and live in the same neighborhood. They sell underwear, porridge, fruits and groceries. 

Mary, age 30, is the group's representative. She's single and the mother of two children. She's a merchant with more than 6 years of experience in the field.

She displays her products at the market and sells quality products, which is her strength. With this loan, she intends to buy more pawpaw, pineapple, orange, banana and water melon to sell to customers. Her profits enable her to save money with ID-Ghana, pay her children's school fees, and also take care of her household expenses.

Together all the members need a total amount of GHS 4,800 for their fourth loan cycle and in order to expand their business. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more pawpaw, pineapple, orange, banana and water melon to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Jeremiah who is a practicing dairy farmer in Siongiroi area of Kenya. Agriculture is his family occupation and also the primary source of income for his family. He owns half an acre of land in the village and cultivates vegetables and maize. He has always been proud to call himself a farmer and now, he is even more proud to call himself a dairy farmer. He is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge he has on farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart and every day he wakes up to milk his cow and that makes him very proud. 

Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a proper dairy unit and he is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan he will have an easier time milking his cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Jeremiah believes that through this loan his living conditions will change because he is going to have an increase in milk production. He will save money that he used to spend on treating his cows because he lacked a good dairy unit. Jeremiah waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
La socia Paulina tiene 52 años de edad es casada y tiene 6 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al negocio de venta de maíz y habas,la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar maíz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”. This bank is in the town of Zurite, province of Anta and department of Cusco.

The member Paulina is 52 years old, is married and has 6 children. The member combines her daily activities with the business of selling maize and beans. The partner sells her merchandise to her customers who request it. She wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy maize, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: to buy maize, among other things

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Because Wafaa is a conservative woman, she asked her mother to take her place in the photo. Wafaa is a 32-year-old separated woman whom has been trying her best to depend on herself. She has been running her mini-market for two years, and it has been a good source of income for her. 

Wafaa is seeking to expand her mini-market to raise her profits. To do so, she needs to add variety to her products and respond to some of her customers’ requests. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more personal products for her business .

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que es locutora de radio desde el año 2005, a la vez que trabaja está estudiando la carrera de psicología.
Sueña con poder trabajar en algo acorde a su carrera y profesión, es por ello que se está esforzando mucho. Quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios,  y luchando por poder cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Doris is from the City of Coronel Oviedo. She comments that she has been a radio announcer since 2005. At the same time that she works, she is studying the career of psychology.

She dreams of being able to work in something according to her career and profession. Therefore she is pushing herself a lot. She wants to be able to help other people. She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the payment of her university fees, to be able to continue with her studies, and fighting to fulfill her goal.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Salvador Humberto

texts.es: Salvador  vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su compañera de vida, el es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la mecánica de obra de banco (elaboración de estructuras metálicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos) desde hace varios años, Salvador solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para comprar más materiales como hierro, laminas, metal, electrodos, etc. ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar.
texts.en: Salvador lives in his own house with his three children and his life partner. He is a very responsible and hardworking man. For the past 5 years, he has been working as a work bench mechanic (creation of metallic structures: doors, balconies, large doors, roofs) for several years. Salvador is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more materials like iron, corrugated sheeting, metal, electrodes, etc. He has a lot of demand because he does good work. With the profits he gains, he’s achieved getting his family ahead and meeting the expenses that come up in the home.

loans.use: to buy more materials like iron, corrugated sheeting, metal, electrodes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, water, gravel, bricks and iron to construct a water trough with a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es: Doris de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace 12 años, elabora las hamacas en su casa asi como muestra la fotografía, para luego salir a las diferentes colonias a comercializarlas, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos y nailon de colores para seguir con la elaboración de las mismas y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doris, 44, lives in her own house with her husband, whom she helps with the expenses of the house and of their two children. She has been working making and selling hammocks for the past 12 years. She makes the hammocks in her house like in the photo, to later go out to different neighborhoods to sell them. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of colored thread and nylon to continue making them and therefore be able to obtain better income to have a better quality of life along with her family.

loans.use: To buy colored thread and nylon.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor de 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 20, 17 y 4 años de edad los dos mayores estudian actualmente, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 15 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, flor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: golosinas, huevos, detergentes, refrescos, granos básicos, sopas, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Flor, 38 years old, lives with her husband and their three children, 20, 17 and 4 years old. The two eldest currently study. She has had a small store located in her home for the past 15 years. She has a lot of customers because of the variety of products and the good prices: Flor is applying for a loan for the purchase of more merchandise like: snacks, eggs, detergents, sodas, basic grains, soups, etc. Thus she will be able to obtain more income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy snacks, eggs, detergents, sodas, basic grains, soups, etc.

loans.name: Dirla Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Dirla de 48  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa,  vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas, Hojaldras, etc.
Doña Dirla es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, queso, manteca, leña, etc. que son la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar su producto, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Dirla su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Dirla, 48, lives with her husband and their children in her house. She lives in the village of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has been working selling breads, quesadillas, pastries, etc. for the past 20 years.

Dirla is an enterprising woman with desires to get ahead. She fights every day to improve her quality of life. She’s applying for a loan to buy products like of corn, cheese, lard, firewood, etc., which are prime materials that she uses to make her product. With the support of this loan, she intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a new client with wishes to work with Prisma. Dirla’s dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and ad the same time improve her and her family’s future.

loans.use: For the purchase of corn, cheese, lard, firewood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
Juan Alejandro tiene 66 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Juan Alejandro se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería-fumigación, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, solicita préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, él cuenta con gran influencia en el negocio; y piensa mejorar su productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Juan Alejandro is 66, married, without children. He lives with his family in a rural zone of Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Juan Alejandro makes a living offering day labor services - fumigation. Having his own tools, with more than 20 years’ experience in the business, he is applying for a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies and for equipment and tools maintenance. Said investment will serve him for having his equipment and tools in better condition. He has a great influence in the business, and he’s thinking of improving his productivity of his services and therefore be able to tend to the 
diverse needs of the clients of the region.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to maintain equipment and tools.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 18 años con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Lima junto a su familia. El motor de su vida es su familia, por ellos lucha constantemente para poder brindarles mejores oportunidades. Trabaja como taxista desde hace algún tiempo y cree que le está yendo bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador, siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus pasajeros y respeta las señales de tránsito.
Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá arreglar y realizar el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo, de esta manera busca brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos. Más adelante Jorge quiere adquirir otro vehículo para poder apoyar a su familia en todo lo que esté dentro de sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young man of 18 with much desire to get ahead. He is single and lives in Lima with his family. The engine of his life is his family; for them he fights constantly to be able to provide them with better opportunities. He’s worked as a taxi driver for some time and believes that it’s going well for him because he is very responsible, hardworking, he always looks after the wellbeing of his passengers and respects the traffic signals.

Jorge is thankful for the Kiva lenders because, with the support the have provided him, he will be able to arrange and carry out the maintenance of his work tool. In this manner, he seeks to provide better comfort to his customers and therefore obtain better income. Later, Jorge wants to acquire another vehicle to be able to support his family with everything that’s within his possibilities.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle for a better service.

loans.name: Grupo De Garcia 1 Group

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos ya tienen familias diferentes, el tercero vive con ella e estudia primero básico en un colegio de su comunidad y todos ellos viven en Suchitepéquez. (Dolores es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda y tiene puesta una blusa de color rojo en la fotografía)

La actividad principal que realizan es la venta de tortillas ya que es una buena actividad para tener un ingreso económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la segunda actividad que realiza Dolores es la venta de frutas en su comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas  que habitan por el lugar.

Los fines con que ella desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la ampliación de la venta de tortillas que ella tiene para así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

En conjunto con un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras  que desean salir adelante decidieron formar parte del grupo de Dolores para tener un futuro mejor y de sus familias.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que su hijo se convierta en un profesional en su comunidad y que tenga una vida mejor y un futuro de éxito.
texts.en:
Dolores is 52, single, and has three children. Two of them already have different families, the third lives with her and studies basic primary school in a school of her community. They all live in Suchitepéquez. (Dolores is the one found first from right to left and has a red blouse on in the photo). 

The main activity that they carry out is the sale of tortillas, since it’s a good activity for having economic income to satisfy the necessities of the people that inhabit the area. She wishes to take out a loan for these reasons: grow the sale of tortillas that she has in order to be able to have more economic income to be able to satisfy the needs of her family.

Along with a group of female entrepreneurs who desire to get ahead, they decided to form part of Dolores’s group to have a better future and for their families. One of her greatest aspirations is to see her son turn into a professional in her community and that he has a better life and a successful future.

loans.use: to grow her tortilla sales.

loans.name: Luis Abraham

texts.es:
Luis Abraham tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos dependientes, vive con su familia (esposa e hijo) en el sector Palo Blanco, vive en una comunidad dedica a la agrícultura, ganedería y comercio; la misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Luis Abraham se dedica a brindar el servicio de limpieza de motos, desde hace 8 meses en el sector Palo Blanco. Él necesita del crédito para invertir en su negocio, pues Luis Abraham desea comprar un equipo(bomba) que le ayude a brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, para dejarlos aún más satisfechos y seguir captando a nuevos clientes. Con la inversion podrá realizar con mayor comodidad su trabajo y podrá realizar mejoras en sus servicios, generando de esta manera mejores ingresos, mayores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Abraham is 30, he is partnered, he has 3 dependent children. He lives with his family (wife and son) in the Palo Blanco sector. He lives in a community which makes its living in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade. It’s located in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru.

Luis Abraham has worked providing a motorcycle cleaning service for the last 8 months in the sector of Palo Blanco. He needs the loan to invest it in his business. Luis Abraham wants to buy a machine (water pump) that will help him provide better service to his clients, to leave them even more satisfied and to continue acquiring new clients. With the investment, he will be able to carry out his work with more comfort and will be able to make improvements in his services, generating, in this manner, better income, profits and, therefore an improvement in his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a machine (water pump) that helps him provide a better service to his customers.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; La socia continua dedicándose  a la ganadería y agricultura, La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a sus actividades los cuales le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Martin de Zurite communal bank. The bank is in the district of Zurite, which belongs to the Anta province in the Cusco department.

Jesusa is the member, and she continues to make a living from livestock and agriculture. She is happy about the loan and committed to making her scheduled payments. 

She's been devoted to her activities for a good while now and she is doing well, thanks to her daily efforts. She supports her family in this way.

Jesusa is requesting the loan to buy compost among other items.

loans.use: to buy compost among other items.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is an experienced farmer from the village of Goghovit, in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and 4 children (two sons and two daughters). Lusine's husband works in the private sector. His salary, however, is not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. 

To be able to meet the family's needs, Lusine is engaged in breeding goats, calves and cultivating wheat and grass. Farming is an important source of income for the family. Lusine's children help her greatly in her everyday farming activities. Her husband is also very helpful; he sells the agricultural products in the local market. As the family’s needs are increasing day by day, Lusine wants to get more forage for feeding her livestock and be able to meet the needs of her family more effectively. A loan of 2000 USD will help her greatly, enabling her to purchase forage. 

Her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed amount of money for the loan and helping the family sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding livestock.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is an experienced farmer from Kamo village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and son. Her elder son serves in the army. All the family works hard to be able to cover their everyday basic needs. 

Anna is engaged in breeding cows, goats, hens and pigs and in the cultivation of wheat and grass. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. As their needs are growing day by day, Anna needs to expand the agribusiness a little bit to meet the costs of the family. She needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and fuel for land cultivation. 

Anna and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed amount of money and for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a Ugandan man, aged 26 years and married to Jovia. They have one child aged three years.

He is a produce dealer as his main business but also does farming. He resides in Kyarushesha.

He has applied for a loan of three million UGX to buy produce, since it is now the season when he expects to pay back after making some profits.

His dreams for the future are to acquire more land and expand his business. He appreciates the financial support granted to him.

loans.use: to buy millet and maize.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, potatoes and bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile land and her primary customers are large scale. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her farming. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nhóm 05, Thiện Na, Vạn Hòa Group

texts.en:
Én works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Én is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05, Thiện Na, Vạn Hòa solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2014, Én joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Én has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Én hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA I un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme KADIA fait la vente des ustensiles de cuisine dans ce groupe de femmes Sabaly, Elle est debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  3 colis d’ustensiles de cuisine au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits, sa revente se fait en détail sur place à une clientèle composée principalement des femmes de ménage au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabaly group are married women who on average are 37 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma 1, a popular district of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their 14th solidarity loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele.
Mrs. Kadia sells kitchen utensils. She is standing second from the right in the photo of this group of women of the Sabaly group.
With her loan, she plans to buy three boxes of kitchen utensils at the big market where she is much in demand due to the quality of her merchandise. She sells her goods retail at the market to her clientele mainly composed of cleaning ladies for cash and for credit. She aims to make an average monthly profit of 26'000 francs CFA, part of which she will use to repay the loan and the interest and part of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Vergjinush

texts.en:
Vergjinush is photographed next to her husband, Xhemal. She is seeking this loan to pay for his medical visit to a health specialist. He has been having problems with his vision during the last few years and a surgery has been scheduled for him as soon as next month. They live in the far district of Korca, yet the surgery will take place in the capital city.
 
Vergjinush is 46 years old and does agriculture (tobacco, beans and grapevines) to make a living. She has only one child who is 24 years old. She also works in an olive oil plant for pay.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's visit to an eye specialist and his eye surgery as well.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps cows that produce milk to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a fertile land and his primary customers are large-scale. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of finances. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will do large-scale farming. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Antoneta

texts.en:
Antoneta has requested a loan in an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek to pay for her children’s schooling items such as books and materials and also clothing. They are about to start school soon.

Antoneta has been photographed with her husband, Ilia, and their oldest children who are 15 and 12. The youngest one is 9. 

Antoneta does agriculture to earn a living. She plants in large quantities fodder for the animals and also works as a seamstress in a clothing manufacturer.
 
Their family lives in the city of Korca that is known mainly for serenades, for making pickles out of almost every veggie and for cooking meatballs or "kernacka" in the local language and delicious pies called "lakror." These are baked on embers; the dish is been placed on embers and covered with a lid with embers on top of it.

loans.use: to pay for schooling books and materials and also clothing for her children.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel es un agricultor de 63 años de edad, su nivel académico llego hasta 6° grado de educación básica, tiene dos hijos, uno aún vive con él y el otro está acompañado, su esposa es ama de casa.

Él tiene alrededor de  10 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado , ya que este negocio le ha resultado muy  rentable,  lo realiza de la siguiente manera todos los días sale en busca de compra de ganado para venderlo una vez a la semana en el tiangue en el cantón donde él vive,  compra el ganado a la gente que vive cerca de la comunidad y lo saca a vender al tiangue todos los martes y la ganancia que le queda es lo que le sirve para el diario vivir.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar material de construcción para la elaboración  de un corral para tener más seguras la reces que compra para luego revenderlas.

Manuel tiene un gran sueño en la vida desde hace varios años y es poder construirle a su esposa una vivienda digna en donde puedan vivir tranquilos, ya que la vivienda que tienen es de lámina y madera y no es tan segura,  él sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito
texts.en:
Manuel is a 63-year-old farmer. His academic education was up to the 6th grade of primary school. He has two sons, one still lives with him and the other has a partner. His wife is a housewife.

For about 10 years, he has worked buying and selling livestock as he has found this business to be very profitable. He does it in the following way: every day he goes in search of cattle to buy and then he sells them once a week at the small market in the canton where he lives.  He buys livestock from people living near the community and takes them out to sell at the market every Tuesday. The resultant profit is what he uses for everyday living.

The loan he is requesting is to buy building materials to construct a corral to keep safe the livestock which he buys for later resale.

Manuel has had a big dream in his life for several years and it is to build a decent home for his wife, where they can live in peace, since the house which they have is made of laminate and wood and is not very secure. He knows that he can achieve this with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials to construct a corral to keep safe the livestock which he buys for later resale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Sabina; la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de verduras, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como azucar entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina continues working in her business - a grocery store and selling vegetables. She sells to all the customers that come to her, and is a responsible and diligent person.

She feels grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the repayments. She is applying for the loan to buy goods such as sugar, among other things.

loans.use: to buy goods such as sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, salt, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are small-scale. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile location and her primary customers are small-scale and large-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as poor climatic conditions. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale farm. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 40-year-old married woman living in Irbid, Jordan, with her husband. Her husband works as a driver. 

Besides the fact that living costs in Jordan have increased, given the demand driven by Syrian refugees, it was hard for Raeda to find a job. Raeda has been selling clothes for one year in order to help her husband in covering their children's needs. This business was profitable to her and became their second source of income. 

Raeda is aiming to expand her business until she opens her own clothes shop in the future. To do so, she needs to raise her profit and to expand her merchandise. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy different products for her mini market.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a farm where he grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic location and his primary customers are large scale. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is married and has four children. His previous loan helped him to increase his sales.

He is a produce dealer and sells maize, coffee and ground nuts as his main source of income. He has been doing this since 2008.

He has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy produce and he has promised to repay the loan after selling his produce.

His dream for the future is to buy a vehicle to help him transport his produce to market centres, but his challenges are price fluctuations and seasonality of the business.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for trade.

loans.name: Hedaya

texts.en:
Hedaya was born in 1972. She lives with her husband in Marka-Jordan. She has been running her own business selling dresses and renting them for three years. 

Hedaya is planning to expand her business in the future to raise her profit by having a huge collection of dresses to sell. This will help in attracting a good number of customers. Now Hedaya is seeking a loan to buy a new collection of dresses that her customers requested.

loans.use: to buy more dresses to sell.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a male Kiva borrower who describes himself as focused. 

He operates a retail business where he repairs shoes, and has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy shoe repair materials. His business goal is to own a shoe shop within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will financially independent. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance bank.

loans.use: buy shoe repair materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has three children. 

He operates a retail business where he repairs motor vehicles and sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are both private and commercial. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham is a 42 year old, separated woman living in Wehdat-Jordan with her two sons and only daughter. She has been trying her best to support her children. 

Elham has been selling general products, depending on the season, such as blankets, clothes, electric machines and homemade olive oil for seven months. This business was profitable to her and she is aiming to expand it. Now she needs to purchase blankets and electric machines that her customers requested, and because she doesn’t have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and electric machines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine, to pay for medical consultations, and to have medical exams.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a female Kiva borrower with 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Mercy operates a car wash where she washes motor vehicles. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are vehicle owners. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store water for washing vehicles. Her business goal is to open more car wash branches within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will own a public service vehicle. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crops in the new season.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Abdul. He is married and has two children, age 7 and 3 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him as a sales assistant.  

In 2011, Abdul established his business: telephone credit card along with selling of mobile phone accessories and American movies on CD, DVD plates. He began his business because he wanted to help himself and his family by becoming self-employed. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are the general public, men and women. 

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 950,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more credit voucher cards for resale. Abdul planned to open another shop to be managed by his wife to get more profit. He is now having another shop that is being managed by his wife, so Abdul’s dreams have come true by the help of the loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more credit cards and movies and to open another outlet.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
