This is 49-year-old Alhassan. He is married, and has two children, age 16 and 11 years. 

In 2000, Alhassan established his transportation business. He began his business because he wanted to become self-employed and get means to provide support for his family. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL in order to add to the amount he has to purchase another van. In the future, Alhassan plans to become a vehicle dealer and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase another van.

loans.name: Pati Ibed

texts.es:
La socia Pati Ibed  continua dedicándose  a la ganadería, La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la compra y venta de maíz, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
Pati Ibed continues working in ranching. She is grateful for the loan received and promises to comply with the repayments. At the same time, she also continues working buying and selling corn to the customers that come to her. She hopes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a diving licence to be issued to her father.

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Eugenia ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de animales, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is Sra. Eugenia, who is a 36-year-old single mother to one son. She works in her restaurant business, preparing various dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups and meat stir-fries. She works from 10 a.m until 7 p.m. She already has 7 years experience in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand the restaurant business. She is applying for the loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

The other members work in animal businesses, cattle sales, grocery store business and animal sales.

The member is grateful to the people forming part of this dream through this medium, and promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewellery for ladies.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is an experienced agronomist from the village Goghovit of Shirak region. 

She lives with her two sons and to help them in earning a living, Sona is engaged in livestock breeding and land cultivation. She keeps cows, sheep, hens, some calves and also cultivates wheat. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is an important source of income for the family. 

To be able to continue the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Sona currently needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase forage for the livestock. The loan will help the family a lot in maintaining and improving their agribusiness as well as their living conditions. 

Sona and her sons will be very grateful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a conservative lady, so she asked her husband to appear in the picture instead. Rasha lives with her family in Madaba, Jordan. Her husband owns an electrical machine store, which is their only source of income. He started his business four months ago and his business has been profitable for his family.

Rasha is aiming to help her husband expand his business by purchasing more electrical machines. To do so, he needs to raise his profits and to expand his shop, and Rasha is now requesting a loan to help him.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase more electrical machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two, fully-equipped carts, which will allow him to grow his business and hire someone to distribute his goods.

loans.name: Caesar

texts.en:
Caesar is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be social and vigilant.

He operates a farm where he grows maize, beans, bananas and also keeps animals. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy animal feeds, seeds and fertilizer. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be social and vigilant.

She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and other crops, and also keeps animals. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy animal feeds, seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lengths of Réal-brand African print cloth

loans.name: Flor De Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ESTRELLAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra de golosinas, tejido a macramé, costura de deportivos, tienda de barrio, venta de batidos, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de papas fritas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años contando con el apoyo de su tía y con un pequeño capital decide emprender su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Estrellas” community bank is beginning its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Villa Adela regional office. It is made up of eight members and directed by a board chaired by señora Julia. The members have a variety of businesses, including a sweet-buying business, weaving macramé, making sports clothing, a local store, a business selling milkshakes, and weaving blankets.

They loan they get will benefit small microentrepreneurs including señora Julia. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer three years ago, after being invited to join by a friend who is one of the institution's clients. She currently has a business making and selling chips, which she decided to set up a number of years ago with the support of her aunt and a small amount of capital.
 
The loan she will now receive is to increase her capital (to buy wholesale potatoes), which she will source from the markets of El Alto, and then sell to customers. This way of working allows her to earn a living so that she can support her family, because she in single and has seven children.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the healthcare services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem was born in 1986. She lives with her husband and two children in Marka, Jordan.

Reem has been running her own business selling clothes for three years. She is planning to expand her business in the future to raise her profit by having a bigger collection of clothes to sell, and this will help in attracting a good number of customers.

Now Reem is seeking a loan to buy a new collection of clothes that will fit the upcoming season so that she will attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes that will fit the upcoming season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes in addition to cosmetics and accessories to sell

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à KABOILA  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur trente-sixième prêt  solidaire à travers le groupe qui évolue avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame ALIMATA fait le commerce  des pagnes wax réal dans ce groupe de femmes JIGUISSEME. Elle est assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 pièces de pagnes wax réal pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of this Jiguisseme group are married women with an average age of 43 who have on average five children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Kaboila, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their thirty-sixth solidarity loan through this group that has developed together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. 

Madame Alimata sells lengths of Réal-brand African print cloth in this Jiguisseme women's group. She is the first woman seated from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 lengths of 'pagne' to sell retail at the market to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA of which part will be used to repay the loan and its interest with the rest going towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy lengths of Réal-brand African print cloth

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  KOSSOMINE  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à  KABOILA  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire dans ce groupe qui évolue avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame  ANCHATA  fait la vente de grain de haricot  dans ce groupe de femmes KOSSOMINE. Elle est assise à la troisième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 10 sacs de grains de haricot pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group called Kossomine  are married women with an average age of 49, having on average five children. They mostly live in traditional families in Kaboila, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their twelfth solidarity loan with this group that has been working together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. 

Among this group of women called Kossomine, Mme Anchata sells haricot beans.  She is the third woman seated from right to left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 sacks of haricot beans to resell retail at the market to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA of which part will be used to repay the loan and its interest and the rest for her savings.

loans.use: to buy dried haricot beans

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is a farmer from Yenoqavan village. She lives together with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and granddaughter. Her husband and son work in local companies and work hard to sustain the family's living. Narine and her daughter-in-law take care of the household and run a farm. They own a plot of land where potatoes, haricots and cucumbers are cultivated. Narine also keeps livestock of cows, pigs, piglets and hens. Narine's husband sells the gathered harvest to local wholesalers from her house. 

The income from the agribusiness is important for the family's living, so Narine has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. Narine hopes that lenders will support her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ladrillos, tejido de mantas, venta de salchipapas, venta de comida, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años por iniciativa propia comenzando con un capital básico.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Estrellitas" (Little Stars) will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela regional center. It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Bertha is the president. The businesses that the members of the association run are varied. Among them are: selling bricks, weaving blankets, selling salchipapas (a typical street food made from sausages and potatoes), selling food, and selling clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Bertha is one. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Por Mujer, entering at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At this time she has a business of making and selling alpaca blankets. She lets it be known that she began this business a number of years ago on her own initiative, beginning with some basic capital.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital and will be used to buy alpaca wool wholesale. She will acquire it in the fairs of the city of El Alto, and later, she will sell the blankets at the request of the customer. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family, since she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool wholesale

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is 45 years old and separated. She has been trying her best to depend on herself. Besides the fact that living costs in Jordan have increased given the demand driven by Syrian refugees, it was hard for Khawla to find a job. She has been selling clothes for one year, and it has been a good source of income for her. 

Khawla is seeking to expand her business to raise her profit. To do so, she needs to expand her clothes collection, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of five members from the same neighborhood who maintain good social and professional relations. The group has been in existence since April 26, 2011. They sell general goods, fish, grocery, pork and tailoring.

Mary, the group's leader, is 54 years old, married, and a mother and grand-mother. She works as a vendor selling matches, dry cells, blades, mosquito spray and coils etc.

With her new loan, she will buy some matches, dry cells, blades, mosquito spray and coils etc, to sell to customers in her neighborhood. She has plenty of experience in this line of work and provides for her family's food needs thanks to her revenues. She also will buy cement for finishing construction work on her house.

This is the seventh loan with ID-Ghana and they will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy some matches, dry cells, blades, mosquito spray and coils etc, to sell to customers in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Las Nuevas Kantutas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS NUEVAS KANTUTAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Karla es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de colchones, venta de comida, comercio de cosméticos, venta de tejido, tejido a máquina, servicio técnicos de equipos, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Karla es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos electrónicos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia conjuntamente su pareja aprendiendo la dinámica de sus suegros quienes trabajan con los mismos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de electrodomésticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The "NEW KANTUTAS" communal bank is about to start the fifth Pro Mujer cycle as part of the Panamericana Regional Hub. The group consists of eight members led by a Chairwoman, Señora Karla. The members run various businesses such as making mattresses, food sales, cosmetics sales, textile sales, machine-made textiles, appliance repair, and furniture sales. The group will obtain a loan to help their small businesses, including Señora Karla's.   
 
Señora Karla joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who was a Pro Mujer client. Señora Karla currently runs a business selling electronic appliances; she started the business with her partner, whose family also sold appliances and taught Karla the business. This business has allowed Señora Karla to support herself, her partner, and their two children.  Señora Karla will take out a loan to increase business capital that she'll use for the purchase of wholesale electronic appliances in El Alto. She'll then sell these products in her store. 

Señora Karla observes that she's pleased that Pro Mujer offers training and enjoys the camaraderie that she has with the other group members.

loans.use: to purchase electronic home appliances

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shop goods  to resell.

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai and her family live in Sumedang, a city located about 190 km from Jakarta. Sumedang is known as a tofu city in Indonesia. Contributing to family income, Ai runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits to her community. She joined Ruma about three months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income and expand her network. 

Ai feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business continues, she hopes to provide more transactions for her community on the weekends.. Ai thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in her community

loans.name: Husnia

texts.en:
Husnia is a 29 year old, married lady living with her family. She has been running her own business selling clothes and cosmetics for one year. She is planning to expand her business in the future to raise her profit by purchasing a larger number of products. 

Now Husnia is seeking a youth loan to buy a new collection of clothes in addition to cosmetics in order to attract more customers and raise her profit because she doesn’t have enough money to do so.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes in addition to cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 29 year old married lady living with her husband in Dairalla-Jordan. She has been running her own business selling blankets for one year so that she can help her husband in improving their living conditions. 

Raeda is planning to expand her business in the future to raise her profit. Now she is seeking a youth loan to buy a new collection of blankets that her customers requested for the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of blankets for the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Kirman

texts.en:
Kirman lives with his wife and two other family member in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Kirman runs a small business in his own house; he makes bread with his wife and sells it to other small stall owners who mostly sell snacks and drinks. He was introduced to Ruma by one of his neighbors and he quickly became interested to join about 5 months ago. Kirman realized that he has to increase his income to support his family’s living. 

As that business continues to grow, Kirman hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to help him run a mobile airtime business and process more airtime sales on the weekends.  Consequently, this will help provide access to mobile services for his community.  

In the photo, Kirman is standing in the place where he produces his bread. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for home improvements such as painting and reinforcing the walls.

loans.name: Pauziah

texts.en:
Meet Pauziah. Pauziah is married and she lives with her husband and child, and two other family member in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. To support her family living, she manages a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits.

Pauziah was introduced to Ruma by one of her friends. She quickly became interested in joining Ruma about 1 to 2 years ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide bill payment and mobile services for her community on the weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Lilia is 65 years old, married and a mother of six. Only one of her children still lives with her, although he is married. She attends to her business, a convenience store, with the help of her husband and together they like to pay the credits they've acquired on time.

A big advantage for her business is that it is located in her house, so she saves on rent for a space. She offers snacks, sodas, candies and dairy products. Since the store has been open for more than 40 years now, she has a solid client base, and additionally, since it's located near a main street, customers are always coming in.

Lilia asks for this loan to stock the store to offer a broader variety of products to her clients, and to increase sales and her income.

loans.use: to stock up her convenience store and increase her sales.

loans.name: Dora Elsy

texts.es:
Ella es Dora, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 6 años con un pequeño carro de comidas con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en muchos restaurantes en meses pasados y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.
Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para realizar mantenimiento a su carro de comidas, comprar utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta y comprar insumos para sus preparaciones, de esta forma podría capitalizar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Dora, a woman of character and good will, who has the desire to get ahead with her husband and her four children. She decided to start her own business of preparing and selling fast food and drinks about 6 years ago with a small food cart and lots of desire and determination. She learned this business working in many restaurants in the past and this gave her lots of experience.

Today she wants to give a small boost to her business. So she needs a loan to undertake maintenance on her food cart, buy cooking utensils that she doesn't have and buy supplies to prepare her meals. Doing this she will capitalize her business and improve the quality of living for her family. She is a woman who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her food cart, buy cooking utensils and buy supplies for her meals.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a resident of San Felipe Village and is a new member of the Maya Mountain Cacao Farmers’ Network. He is a father of one child and is excited about starting his new cacao farm. He plans on purchasing and planting 1,000 seedlings to start up, and later on, continuing to expand it. He sees doing this wonderful initiative as beneficial because there is an existing market for him to sell his product. He is requesting this Kiva loan in order to purchase his cacao seedlings. He envisions future success for his family from his cacao farming.

loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en: Lucio is a new cacao farmer from the beautiful village of San Jose. He is excited to be joining the Maya Mountain Cacao Farmers’ Network and enrolling in a KIVA loan. He is a father of three children, who are all of school age. He is taking the initiative to cultivate a piece of land and transforming it into a beautiful and successful cacao farm. This Kiva loan will assist him in purchasing and planting cacao seedlings. Lucio envisions a future with his business plan of planting his three acres of cacao, and this will allow him to educate his youngest daughter and make plans to retire form the farm.

loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Chikhulupiliro Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 26 years old and married to Kaumphani 31 years old. Together they have 3 children who go to school. She sells doughnuts and is applying this loan to purchase flour, cooking oil, and sugar. 

Ruth started her business to alleviate poverty levels in her family and to be able to pay school fees for her children. Before she started her market stall she was a farmer and has been involved in business for two years.

Ruth has plans to use any capital generated to satisfy her family's basic needs and to purchase dairy cattle so that she can sell milk. She believes that the training she received on ‘Savings Culture’ will help her to achieve what she wants from her business. As a woman, she is independent and she has managed to buy kitchen equipment.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is 58 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her five children. She plants and buys additional stocks of vegetables that she sells in the local community. 

Due to hard living conditions, she would like to improve the business and make it profitable to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks of beans, cabbages, squash, tomatoes, eggplants and leafy vegetables to resell. 

Through her patience and hard work, she believes that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bean, cabbages, squash, tomatoes, eggplants and leafy vegetables to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 47 years old, married and blessed with eight children. They currently live in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Florida runs a small retail store within their village to have an additional source of income. She aims to strengthen this business and generate sufficient income to help her husband provide their necessities and finance the education of their children. Having inadequate capital, she would like to request additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy grocery items, rice, fruits and vegetables to resell. Being a kind and hardworking mother, she believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, rice, fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Veronica is 32 years old and single. She lives in her parent's house and has been in the work force since she was very young.  Her hobbies include playing soccer and painting, and she considers herself a calm and happy person.

Veronica works in a candle factory and is one of the most trusted employees there; they create all types of candles from festive to religious ones. She has worked there for a long time since the factory is around the corner from her house and a cousin invited her over to work there.

She asks for this loan to rebuild the fence that around her house in order to keep her home protected; the one she has currently is very deteriorated.

loans.use: to rebuild the fence that surrounds her house

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva and her family live in Garut, a town in the West Java province of Indonesia that is the capital of the Garut Regency, also known as the ‘Swiss van Java’ in the colonial era. As a single parent, Eva runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits to support her family. She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income, expand her network, and learn how to run her small stall more effectively. 

Eva feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business continues, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more transactions for her community on the weekends. Eva thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Sartono

texts.en:
Sartono, his wife, and their two children live together in North Bogor, a suburban area located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Sartono runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime for his customers. He joined Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to expand his network and learn how to run his small stall more effectively. 

Sartono feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business continues, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile phone services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. Sartono thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile phone services in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grafted cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy is a 46-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children from Carles, Iloilo. Levy operates a sari-sari store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. She has also been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 23 years now. 

Levy is now asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, including canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and fishing gear like nets, hooks and lead weights. Through this, Levy will be able to increase her stock, as well as their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, including canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and fishing gear like nets, hooks and lead weights.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:
Sergio is 59 years old, married to his wife Alejandra (for 38 years now) and is the father of 3 sons, none of which depend economically of them anymore. Together they sell tamales, various breakfast foods, sodas and tortas to make a living.

Sergio's business is located beside an entry to a market in his neighborhood, and a public transport unit base. This offers them the opportunity to sell tamales, coffee and atole from 4am to 10am, and then tamales and refreshments in the afternoon.

Sergio asks for this loan to stock up his business, increase his sales and thus his income. His biggest goal has been to be able to raise his sons despite not having any education, and he would like to offer them this opportunity that he didn’t have.

loans.use: to stock up his tamales and tortas business to increase his sales

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

Gerardo is 52 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with his partner Margarita (for 18 years now) and is the father of 3 sons. He has two sources of income in order to make a living: he drives a taxi and additionally sells toys. 

Gerardo started selling toys 4 years ago and with the income he generated he was able to buy a taxi; which he has now been operating for 2 years. He asks for this loan to invest it in both of his businesses; his taxi unit needs some mechanical repairs and the toy selling business needs to be stocked up.

loans.use: to repair his taxi unit and stock up his toy selling business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman and a mother of two children from Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than 10 years now. Her husband has a supplemental income from his motorcycle transport business. 

Wilma works hard to help her husband in providing for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

Right now, Wilma needs a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With a loan, she will be able to improve her farm thus allowing her to have a good harvest after several weeks. 

Wilma dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
To earn a living, Ronalyn and her husband work together to generate income and cover the necessities of their family. They aim to improve their standard of living and educate their four children. Her husband works in their farm while Ronalyn engages in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables in their community. 

Ronalyn aims to make her business more profitable but she has  limited capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of PHP12,000 to buy more tomatoes, bok choy, squash, eggplant, beans and bitter melon to resell. Having this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, bok choy, squash, eggplant, beans and bitter melon to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mery Joy

texts.en:
Mery Joy is 31 years old and married. She engages in buying and reselling ukay-ukay (used clothing) within her community to help her husband in gaining income. 

She and her husband aspire to improve their standard of living and have a better future. To achieve their goal, Mery Joy wants to improve her business to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of used clothes, foot sacks, bed sheets and blankets to resell. 

With this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes, foot sacks, bed sheets and blankets to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, and to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Editha would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 23,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Editha hopes to progress in her business and improve the general living conditions of her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to resell in her store.

loans.name: Zayton

texts.en:
This is Zayton. She owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for six years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her house rental business.

In relation to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting the amount of PHP 32,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Zayton hopes to own and manage a bigger store. She also dreams for her family to have longer life, free from any sickness and she hopes that her children will all complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a stockpile to conserve water and a private bathroom.

loans.name: Khantawi De Andrani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KHANTAWI DE ANDRANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Paulina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de construcción, taller de encuadernación, tejido de mantas de alpaca, tejido de ropa de bebe, tejido de mantas de hilo, producción y venta de sombreros, tejido y venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Paulina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de sombreros de cuero; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia conjuntamente su pareja, ya que él ya conocía anteriormente esta forma de producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Khantawi De Andrani loan group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Paramericana communal bank. The group is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors, where Paulina is the president. The business that the group members are part of are varied and include: construction services, a bookbinding workshop, weaving of alpaca blankets, weaving of baby clothes, weaving of linen blankets, production and sale of hats, and weaving and selling blankets. 

The loan that they will take out will help small businesses in which Paulina is a member. She says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer; she was accepted based on an invitation from a promotional campaign from the institution. At present, she has a business making and selling leather hats. She said that she started this business with her partner, since he already knew how to produce the hats.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital by buying leather wholesale; she will acquire the leather from wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto. After making the hats, she will sell them in her store. This work allows her to earn resources to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has four children. 

When asked if she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy leather wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for baking, like flour, baking soda, sugar, sugar, milk, butter, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her small general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan that she will use as her working capital to buy fruits, mostly bananas, which she sells. She knows that more fruits at her store will yield more sales, thus increasing her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to support her family's basic needs and the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Elena dreams of having a bigger fruit stand at her own place, and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits, mostly bananas, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 42-year-old mother who was blessed with four children, now attending school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she engages herself in a vegetable vending business to supplement her husband's income. 

She wants to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP7,000 to buy more stock of papaya, ginger, potatoes, tomatoes, squash, beans, cabbages and bananas to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of papaya, ginger, potatoes, tomatoes, squash, beans, cabbages and bananas to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a hardworking mother who supports her husband in earning income. She is 26 years old and has only one child. She buys and sells various fruits and vegetables, and she would like to improve her business to increase her income. She wants to acquire more stock of fruits and vegetables to resell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance of 15,000 PHP to buy more cabbage, tomatoes, beans, squash, eggplants, bananas and ginger to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that someday, she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more cabbage, tomatoes, beans, squash, eggplants, bananas and ginger to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Segundo Elido

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia dedicado, con una familia excepcional conformado por su esposa y sus hijos. Diariamente Segundo se encuentra en la lucha constante de tener un futuro mejor y dar una mejor educación a sus hijos. Desde hace muchísimos años se dedica al cultivo de cacao, cree que le está yendo bien porque trabaja de sol a sol para poder tener una excelente producción.
Segundo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su terreno, comprar abono orgánico y podar las plantas. Con esto espera tener una mejor producción y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para su familia. Más adelante espera poder ampliar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Segundo is the dedicated father of a wonderful family made up of his wife and children. Daily, Segundo fights constantly to have a better future and to give the best education to his children. For many years, he has been dedicated to harvesting cacao. He says that it is going well because he works from dawn until dusk to be able have an excellent harvest. 

Segundo is thankful for the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered, he will be able to take care of his land, to buy organic fertilizer, and to prune his plants. With this, he hopes to have a better production and, thus, to be able to improve his family’s income. In the future, he hopes to be able to grow his farms.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his cacao plants and to prune the plants.

loans.name: Mary Rosaly

texts.en:
This is Mary Rosaly. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan  to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help support her family’s daily needs and her children's education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Rosaly hopes to grow and expand her business. She dreams for her children to complete their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Her name is Leonora, 52, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She has three children.  The eldest is in high school while the other two are out of school.  She works hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of her child.  

Leonora is in the food business. She has been operating a school canteen for five years. She has a captured market in that school since most of the student population eat in her canteen. They enjoy the freshly cooked meals she prepares every day. The income from her canteen provides for her family's daily needs and helps send her child to high school.

To help maintain her business, Leonora is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional raw ingredients like pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her cooking.  She believes that with this financial assistance her sales and earnings will increase. She is thanking God and you in advance for your great help.

Leonora dreams of having another canteen so she could send her two other children to school. She wants her children to have a better future and lead a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to cook the food in her canteen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hand tools that will improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Normalyn

texts.en: Normalyn lives at Piat with her family. She is 28 years old, married, and had one child. She operates a retail store selling grocery items to the people in her village. She hopes to keep increasing her sales, so she is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits and noodles to sell. She will continue offering good products and services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a vegetable vendor living in Piat with her family. She is 42 years old and had two children whom she is sending to school. In her stall, she sells fruits and vegetables. Marites is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy bananas, eggplant, beans and squash to sell. This will help ensure good sales in her business so she can keep acquiring profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, eggplant, beans, and squash to sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
For almost a year now, Myra, a resident of Dulag, Leyte, has operated her small "sari-sari" or variety store. This business provides an income for this mother of one child. Myra works hard to help her husband meet the needs of the family.

Myra is asking for a loan from Community Economic Ventures (CEVI) worth 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional groceries to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods. With this loan, Myra will be able to augment her inventory, which gives her the chance to attract and sell more products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 35-year-old married man and a father of a five-year-old child. Jimmy earns a living through his hog-raising business. Jimmy is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, he will be able to improve his hog raising business so that it will generate more revenue.

Jimmy hopes to expand his business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is a meat vendor from Dulag, Leyte. She is 37 years old and has five children. Desiree has been in the meat vending business for several years now. She also buys and sells coconut for copra making.

She is asking for a loan to buy meat to sell. She dreams of expanding her businesses in the future so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
This is Reynalda, 64 years old, and a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Efipanio, her business partner, and they have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for her everyday expenses.

Reynalda operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them, and sells them at a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different products such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, powder bleach and other products for repacking.

Reynalda hopes to become successful in business and dreams of a prosperous life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 65 years old and married with eight children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Susana requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed one other time from NWTF.

Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Beishekan

texts.ru: Бейшекан 55 лет, вдова,есть сын, в сезон он приезжает и помогает по хозяйству. Образование у Бейшекан среднее, она много лет проработала дояркой, сейчас на пенсии. На протяжении 11 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве Бейшекан есть 1 дойная корова, 5 овец, 4 ягнят, 1 лошадь. Также есть 1,435 ГА земельной доли, где Бейшекан выращивает эспарцет, картофель. Ежедневно Бейшекан продает около 10 литров экологически чистого молока, которое пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей, которым она и реализует молоко. Совокупный доход Бейшекан составляет около 8,000 (KGS) в месяц. Однако этого катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Бейшекан решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Увеличение прибыли от бизнеса позволит Бейшекан улучшить ее благосостояние.
texts.en:
Beishekan is 55 and a widow with one son who comes and helps her around the property seasonally. She has a high school education and worked as a milkmaid for many years but is now retired. For the past 11 years she has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture. She is a very pleasant and responsible woman, very sociable and hardworking. She currently has one milking cow, five sheep, four lambs and one horse, as well as 1.435 hectares of arable land where she grows hay and potatoes.

Every day, Beishekan sells about 10 litres of organic milk, which is in high demand among the local residents who are her customers. Her total income is about 8,000 KGS per month; however, this doesn't come close to what she needs to cover her living costs, and therefore she has decided to develop her business. For this reason she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow. The increased revenue from this will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so she can sell a higher volume of milk

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago de 44 años de edad,  no posee ningún grado académico,  ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para darle los estudios, el padre se lo llevaba a trabajar la agricultura y no tenía tiempo para estudiar. Actualmente, está casado y 3 hijos que estudian.

Santiago se dedica a trabajar la tierra donde cultiva maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 28 años. Esta actividad que su padre le enseño desde muy pequeño y también trabaja como Jornalero. Sale a trabajar a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 2 pm, camina 30 minutos para llegar al lugar de trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar formulas y sulfato y productos de herbicidas y pagar la mano de obra para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de Maíz y Frijol.

Desea poseer buena salud para seguir trabajando fuerte para darle los cuidados necesarios a sus hijos y poderlos sacar adelante con los estudios de educación básica y seguir trabajando con los cultivos de maíz, ya que espera que los rendimientos sean muy buenos.
texts.en:
Santiago is 44 years old and does not have any level of studies, as his parents did not have the economic resources to send him to study. His father took him to work in agriculture and he didn't have time to study. He is now married with three children who are at school.

Santiago works on the land where he has grown corn, beans and sorghum for 28 years. His father taught him how to do this when he was very young. He also works as a day laborer. He goes out to work at 5 a.m until 2 p.m. He walks 30 minutes to arrive at his place of work.

The loan he is applying for is to buy formulas, sulfate and weed-killers, and to pay the labor costs of maintaining his corn and bean crops.

He hopes to have good health so that he can continue working hard and give his children the care that they need and get them through their basic studies. He hopes to continue working with his corn crops, as he hopes that the yield will be very good.

loans.use: to buy formulas, sulfate and weed-killers, and to pay the labor costs of maintaining his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Estrella Dorada Group

texts.es:
Estrella Dorada es el nombre de un grupo conformado por 6 personas todas ellas viven en una localidad productora de caña y de hule. El clima de la localidad es fresco y desde la carretera se logra apreciar parte de la sierra donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo. La mejor vista es por la mañana cuando el cielo esta despejado y por la tarde, cuando es la puesta del sol.

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron los integrantes debido al gusto que tienen por las estrellas. Además, una de la integrantes comenta que por las noches se puede ver el resplandor casi dorado de las estrellas, aun más cuando las luces de las casas están apagadas: entonces el cielo también se convierte en un hermoso cuadro.

Los integrantes del grupo son:
Cinthia- Venta De Ropa
Elizabeth- Venta De Ropa
Francisca- Tienda Artesanal
Juan Carlos- Venta De Abarrotes 
Rosario- Venta De Dulces
Rosina- Venta De Abarrotes

Elizabeth tiene 24 años de edad, está casada con Wilfrido quien trabaja en el ingenio, tienen una hija de 6 años la cual es su todo y el motor principal para que ellos se esfuercen día tras día para salir adelante. Elizabeth ha vendido ropa de manera ambulante desde hace tres años por lo cual ya tiene varios clientes. Comenta que con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con parte de los gastos de la casa y satisface sus necesidades personales. El trato amable y la comunicación con los clientes es lo que la distingue de las demás personas que venden ropa, el préstamo otorgado lo utilizara para invertir en pantalones, blusas, faldas, playeras, camisas. A Elizabeth le encantaría poder establecer un espacio en su casa y comenzar a vender también ropa de segunda mano.

*En la imagen: Elizabeth viste una blusa verde a rayas.
texts.en:
Estrella Dorada [Golden Star] is the name of this group consisting of six women who live in an region known for producing cane and  rubber that also enjoys a pleasant climate. Travelers along the highway can enjoy the views of the sierra where the group members live. The best views are in the morning, when the sky is clear, and in the evening when the sun sets. 

The group members chose the name Estrella Dorada because of their love for the stars. One of the members also noted the spectacular views that they enjoy: the night sky is so resplendent with stars that it almost takes on a golden glow, especially when residents turn off the lights in their homes, and resembles a beautiful work of art. 

The group members are:
Cinthia, who sells clothing
Elizabeth, who also sells clothing
Francisca, who runs a shop where she sells artesanal crafts
Juan Carlos, who runs a grocery store
Rosario, who sells candy
Rosina, who also runs a grocery store

Elizabeth is 24, married to Wilfredo, who works in a sugar plant. The couple has a six-year-old daughter, who is the motivation for her parents to strive each day to improve the family's situation. Elizabeth has sold clothing on the street for the past three years, and has a range of customers. She notes that the income she earns, combined with her husband's salary, meets the family's household expenses and personal needs. Elizabeth provides excellent and attentive service to her customers and communicates well with them, making her stand out from other clothing sellers.   

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, and t-shirts. She would love to set up her own shop in the family's home and also start selling second-hand clothing. 

*In the photo, Elizabeth is wearing a striped green shirt.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling vegetables for over a year now. She wants to sell more vegetables but had insufficient funds; that is why she is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy string beans, eggplant, tomatoes and squash. This will help increase her sales. She will save any additional revenue gain for education expenses.

loans.use: to buy string beans, eggplant, tomatoes and squash.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them are still studying. To make a living, she sells bananas and vegetables and weaves baskets to sell, while her spouse is a construction worker. Income from their businesses serves as sustenance for meals, bills at home and education fees. 

Romana is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy more bananas to sell and bamboo for basket-weaving. She hopes this loan will be a great help in maintaining good sales from her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell and bamboo for basket-weaving.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Her name is Amelia, 45, a resident of Coron, Palawan City, Philippines. She is married to Ruben, a pastor, and has one child. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her child.

Amelia has a direct selling business. She sells beauty products like whitening soap, lotion, natural food supplements and vitamins. Dealers buy the products in volumes at wholesale prices and retail them at a reasonable price. Filipinos are now more knowledgeable and conscious about their health and beauty which makes her products very salable. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php3,500 in sales every week.  She also offers a massage service to tourists and local residents and she has a loading business as well.

To help her sustain her business, Amelia is requesting a Php 50,000 loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products and health products for her customers. She is positive that her sales will improve as more products are displayed in her store. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.   

Amelia aims to grow her business so she can send her child to the best school possible. She dreams that her child will finish college and that her family will continue to serve and love God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more personal products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking mother who is engaged in a vegetable vending business to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardship of their lives, she and her husband have the determination to improve their status of living. In this regard, Lilia aims to improve her business to generate sufficient income. 

Having inadequate capital, she would like a loan of PHP5,000 to buy more string beans, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, squash and bananas to resell. Having patience and strong determination, she hopes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more string beans, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, squash and bananas to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Dulag, Leyte. Gemma earns a living through her coconut wine (or tuba) selling business. Tuba or coconut wine can also be fermented into vinegar and is commonly used in Filipino cuisine. 

Gemma needs a loan for her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more tuba wine to sell. Gemma dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more tuba wine to sell

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 49 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. Wilfreda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, sanitary pads, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sanitary pads, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, sanitary pads, canned goods, noodles, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 57 years old and has six children. Celestina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Celestina is in the agricultural business, farming flowers and vegetables in the Philippines. Celestina requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celestina has been farming flowers and vegetables for 20 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Celestina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 39 years old and married with three children.

Nena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nena has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 53 years old and married with five children.  

Flora is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Flora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flora has been farming rice for 12 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 42 years old and married with ten children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard is an agronomist from the town of Agarak. She lives with her daughter and son. Nvard and her two children work at the local copper plant. 

To assist her children in earning a living for the family, Nvard is engaged in breeding two cows and in the cultivation of fruit trees (peach, pear, apricot, nut, and apple). Nvard's children help her greatly in selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

As life is getting more expensive on a day-to-day basis, Nvard wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to more effectively meet her family’s needs. A loan of $3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase two cows and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Nvard and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Nidia Rosa

texts.es:
Nidia es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad. 

Nidia es una madre muy responsable y amorosa que siempre hace lo posible para que su familia pueda tener una buena calidad de vida.

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo y cuando su esposo enfermó y quedó incapacitado por un tiempo le tocó incrementar sus ventas para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, y para lograrlo le tocó trabajar fuertemente. 

Actualmente Nidia tiene unos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas de manos, entre otros y responder a estos pedidos.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos y su esposo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nidia is a hard-working person who thanks to her daily efforts has been able to bring up her 3 children and provide them with a good quality education. Nidia is a very loving and responsible mother who always does all she can for her family so that they have a good quality of living.

A long time ago she started to sell personal use products by catalog. When her husband got sick and was disabled for some time she had to increase her sales to support the household expenses. So she had to work very hard.

Today Nidia has some requests from her clients and since she does not have a lot of capital she is looking for a loan to buy personal use products like lotions, deodorants, hand cream amongst others so she can fill these requests. Her main dream is to get ahead with her business and doing this offer her husband and children a good living standard and more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a variety of personal use products for her business.

loans.name: William Andres

texts.es:
William es un hombre de buenas ideas y de mente creativa, siempre está tratando de buscar actividades para aumentar sus ingresos familiares.

El monto un café internet desde hace varios años y ofrece alternativamente el servicio de videojuegos en el municipio de San Rafael.

Tiene 26 años y tiene todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar los desafíos que la vida le tenga preparados.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar algunos videojuegos, televisores y consolas para mejorar la calidad de su servicio. 

Con este dinero podrá invertir en su negocio y atraerá más clientes impactando de esta manera sus utilidades de una manera positiva.

Su mayor sueño es tener una gran sala de internet con buenos ingresos y generar empleo.
texts.en:
William is a man with good ideas and a creative mind who is always trying to find activities to increase his family income. He set up an internet café a few years ago and offers as an alternative, video game services in the San Rafael municipality. He is 26 years old and is full of energy to face the challenges that life has in store for him.

He is requesting a loan to buy some video games, televisions and consoles to improve the quality of his services. With this money, he will be able to invest in his business and will attract more customers, impacting his profits in a positive way. His biggest dream is to have a great video game room with good income and to generate employment.

loans.use: to buy televisions, video games and consoles to improve the services he provides

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is a 46-year-old, married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her food vending business by selling home-cooked foods to the people in her village. Her husband is a farmer. Chona is requesting a loan to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc. Through this loan, she will be able to cook more food and sell it to her customers. In the future, Chona dreams of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending such as flour, baking soda, butter, sugar, milk, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA, él banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia continua con su negocio de cafeteria,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra galletas, gaseosas entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She continues to manage her cafeteria business. The borrower wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. She has been in this business for years and it has given her personal satisfaction.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy cookies, sodas, and other products. She appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is 40 years old, married and has been blessed with one daughter who is still at school. He has been a taxi driver for ten years, employed by a taxi service.
