He has been struggling every day to make sure he own his own car, and now he has done so. With his previous credit cycles, this was possible and so he is thankful for Kiva's support.

Abdu works from 8 am to midnight or sometimes overnight. He is able to make a good profit every day. Taxi business today has become too hard, and as he said, this is due to the emergence of more three wheelers and motorbikes that seem to be the biggest rivals to his business. But, since Abdu has been in this business for a long period, he has commented that customer relationships are the key to his business success. He has longtime existing customers who still demand his service every day. 

For the sake of improving his business, Abdu is in Tujijenge, Tanzania, requesting his third credit. Since he repaid his previous loan, he used the profits to add to his savings, to buy his current business car, and pay for his maintenance expenses. His desire is to manage more than one business car. 

Abdu will use his new credit request to pay the charges of changing his new private car to a taxi. He will be responsible for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to pay charges of changing his new private car to taxi.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en: Ria is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. They are from Dulag, Leyte. Ria was in a hog raising business but was forced to stop after a super typhoon hit the country several months ago. Now, she wants to restart her business. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. Through this loan, Ria will be able to improve her business again. She also wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Gelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gelyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Gelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Loreta is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Loreta has a general store business in the Philippines. Loreta requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Loreta has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Range Group

texts.en:
Amina is in her forties, not married and has three children, two of whom are in school while the other is grown up. She manages her family's affairs by selling fried fish. She has been in this business for six years now. Amina obtains stock from the big city market where there is plenty of fish. To do so she travels for about five hours (coming and going). Amina wakes up early in the morning at 4 am to begin her work day. After returning home, she fries the fish and then sells her product until about 9 pm. She does this daily. Amina enjoys a good monthly profit from her business. 

Amina is from Tujijenge, Tanzania. This is her tenth loan request and she will use it to buy fish and frying oil. With her previous loans, which she has since repaid successfully, she improved her fish business by buying satisfactory fish stock and buckets of frying oil. Also, she managed her business well and received extra income which she used to build the house she is living in now. Amina is happy with her house and thanks Kiva for the support. She is also able to pay school fees and household expenses. Her dream is to grow her business more and be better off in life. She will share this loan with her loan group "RANGE" which consists of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and frying oil.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a young agronomist from Litchk village, Syunik region. She lives with her husband, who works at local electricity company. To assist her husband in earning a living, Armine is engaged in agribusiness; she breeds cattle and cultivates greens, and sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Armine's agribusiness currently needs some investments in order to function in a sustainable and productive way. She needs a loan of USD 2,700 to renovate the barn and to purchase one more cow for her livestock. Armine and her husband highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and renovation of her barn.

loans.name: Luís Rodolfo

texts.es:
Luís de 29 años de edad, es casado y padres de un hijo de 7 años de edad. Luís estudio hasta bachillerato.

Él se dedica a trabajar con ganado de repasto, lo compra flaco y a un precio bajo y por un tiempo lo cuida para engordarlo y venderlo a mejor precio, esto lo viene realizando desde hace unos 2 años. Esta actividad la aprendio de unos familiares. Tambien trabaja la agricultura y las estructuras metalicas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un ganado de repasto, para continuar desarrollando su actividad y no dejar de persivir sus ingresos. Su sueño es que su hijo termine sus estudios y trabajar muy fuerte como familia.
texts.en:
Luís is 29 years old, married, and the father of a seven-year-old son. He studied through high school.

Luís works with grazing cattle. He purchases the animals at a low price when they are thin and takes care of them over time so that they will gain weight and can be sold at a higher price. Luís has been doing this for about two years. He learned this trade from a few of his relatives. He is also a farmer and does metal work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a head of grazing cattle so that he can continue developing his business. Otherwise, he will not have any income. His dream is to see his son finish his studies so that they can work hard as a family.

loans.use: to buy a head of grazing cattle.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yovana; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio picantería, la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como milanesa de pollo, carne, sopas, lechón entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, carnes entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Yovana is a member of the Communal Bank “San Valentin” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She continues to manage a “picantería” (a restaurant that specializes in spicy food). Yovana sells different types of dishes such as breaded chicken cutlets, beef, soup, roasted pork, and other foods. She has been in this business for quite some time and it has given her personal satisfaction. Working in this manner enables her to help her family get ahead.

Yovana is requesting a loan in order to buy oil, meat, and other items. She is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en: Jojo is 21 years old from Dipaculao, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He chose this course because he thinks that this is in demand abroad. He wants to finish his studies despite the fact that he doesn’t have enough money for schooling. That’s why he wants to avail an educational loan of PHP 15,000 from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Her name is Joy. She is 31, and a resident of Tondo, Philippines.  She is married to Roy, a construction worker, and a mother of two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.  She works hard to augment their income to meet her family’s basic needs.

Joy has a rug-making business. She makes rugs for different uses and various sizes. There are from round palm-sized used to clean cabinets and kitchen counters, to large doormats. In the Philippines, rugs are a major item for housekeeping and cleaning, and every household has them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional raw materials like fabric, and thread for her business.  This will in turn boost her income as she expands her business.  

Joy hopes to get more suppliers to grow her business, and desires that all her kids finish college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics, etc. for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. Susana is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions like sugar and milk for resale.

loans.name: Itzhak

texts.en: Itzhak, originally from Ethiopia, opened a spice and products shop in Netanya. He chose a location near the market which has foot traffic daily. Itzhak originally started the business in partnership with a friend whose family is well known and experienced in authentic Ethiopian spices. Also, he took a business development and microenterprise management course through the local small business association. In order to expand his small customer base, Ithak decided to branch out into additional dry good products which are in demand. Itzhak needs this loan to purchase new stock and other store supplies. Itzhak is working to develop his business and improve his financial management. His goal is to expand and bring staff on to assist with the daily tasks.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and other store supplies.

loans.name: Jesús Ana

texts.es:
Jesús con el crédito anterior compro una variedad de productos para venderlos en su tienda, ella comenta que le esta llendo muy bien, la demanda esta aumentando, debido a ello esta solicitando otro crédito para comprar jabón, articulos del cuidado personal, pan de diferente variedad, embutidos, lácteos, etc. para abastecer a sus clientes que llegan a buscarle estos productos.

Ella desea seguir trajando para obtener ingresos y suplir sus necesidades familiares e invertir las ganancias para que su negocio se amplié y siempre disponga de diversos productos para la venta y también poder ahorrar  y tener dinero para cuando ella no pueda trabajar usar sus ahorros y que sus hijos la apoyen cuando ella mas lo necesite.
texts.en:
With her earlier loan, Jesús bought a variety of items to sell in her store.  She says that this is going really well, demand is growing.  Due to this she is asking for aother loan to buy soap, personal care products, a variety of breads, cold meats, dairy products, etc., to satisfy the customers who come looking for these.

Jesús wants to continue working for the income to provide for family needs and to use the profits so that her business will grow and she will always have a wide variety of products to sell.  She also wants to be able to save and have money for the time when she will not be able to work; then she will uses her savings and her children will support her when she most needs their help.

loans.use: to buy soap, personal care products, a variety of breads, cold meats, dairy products, etc., to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, leaf absorbed fertilizers, among others to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gemmar

texts.en: Gemmar is 23 years old from Dipaculao, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He chose this course because it’s his interest. He knows that it is hard to be away from his family while studying, but he bears all that because he knows that his sacrifices will be worthy. He wants to lessen his family’s expenses, so he would like to avail an educational loan of PHP 15,000 from the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Renz Marion

texts.en:
Renz Marion is 22 years old from Dipaculao, Aurora. He is studying Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. He chose this course because it is in demand and so that he can find a job easily. He wants to finish his studies to help his parents. 

While studying, his struggles are financial and emotional; financially because he doesn't have enough money and emotionally because he will be far from home. But he will endure all this for he knows that this is for the betterment of his and his family's life. 

To help him in his school expenses, he wants to avail an educational loan of 15,000 PHP from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an experienced farmer from Sarnakunk village, of the Syunik region. She lives with her husband who is currently a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Unfortunately, his salary alone is not enough to fully cover their needs. Anahit has also been engaged in agribusiness for 15 years. She is involved in aviculture, livestock breeding, keeping cows, calves, sheep, and in the cultivation of barley, wheat and emmer wheat. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anahit needs a loan of USD 3,000 to pay for forage for the livestock, renovation of the agro machinery and to hire workers for cultivation work. She and her husband highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be thankful to them for the support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock, renovation of the agro machinery and to hire workers for cultivation work.

loans.name: Aychurok

texts.ru: Айчурок 59 лет, не замужем, мать 2 детей. У Айчурок - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, благодаря упорному труду Айчурок, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 5 овец, а также земельный надел мерою 0,79 ГА, где она выращивает клевер. Также Айчурок занимается пошивом национальных изделий - тюшаков и одеял. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 15,000 до 20,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства Айчурок старается вкладывать в развитие и расширение бизнеса.  Однако нужно и улучшать жилищные условия своей семьи, Айчурок начала строительство собственного дома, закончив его примерно на 60 процентов, не хватает средств на завершение строительства и отделочные работы. Поэтому Айчурок и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку цемента, краски, пеноплекса и других материалов. Доходы же от ведения бизнеса, Айчурок будет направлять на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Aychurok is 59, unmarried, and has two children. She has a high school education and earns a living by raising livestock and planting crops. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows, five sheep, and a 0.79 hectare plot of land where she grows clover. Aychurok also sews traditional items such as quilted mattresses and blankets. She earns 15,000 to 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Aychurok is saving money to invest in the development and expansion of her business. However, she also needs to improve her family’s living conditions, so she began building her own house. She has completed about 60% of the work but does not have enough money to finish building. This is why she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cement, paint, insulation, and other materials. She will continue investing her profits in the further development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and finish building a house for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor, buy fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine in order to complete a lot of sewing work in a short time.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, chompas, casacas entre otros para sus clientes que le solictan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to operate her clothing sales business. She sells trousers, sweaters, jackets, and other garments to her customers who request them. Working in this manner allows her to help her family get ahead.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy sweaters and other garments. She appreciates the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a farmer from Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has two children. Alma has been in the farming business for more than eight years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her farming business, thus improving her harvest and yield. In the future, Alma dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 48, is a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a vendor, and has two children. One child is in high school and the other is out of school.  She manages her own household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s  daily personal and household needs. 

Marivic operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Aside from this she also sells fresh meat. Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 4,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Marivic hopes to be maintain and grow so she can set aside savings for her old age and send her child to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Kiva Lenders! Meet Andrea, aged 51, who lives in lolminingai, a remote village in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. Nandi hills area is an area where hard-core poverty pervades every homestead, but Andrea has shown resilience and has been toiling on his farm for the past 34 years. Because of the immense knowledge he has on farming, he is regarded as a mentor to upcoming farmers. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business that he engages in to the make ends meet. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family expenses, but he has still kept hope alive that he will improve. 

He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. Andrea passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow, but to buy a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence, improved living conditions. 

The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan, and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure, which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Andrea waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Esther Manuela

texts.es:
Esther es una madre de familia dedicada, con una maravillosa hija, trabaja como cocinera en un restaurante de su ciudad, Guadalupe. El motor de su vida es su familia, es por ellos que trabaja todo el día para poder tener mayores ingresos y así pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos y a la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar una profesión, por eso quiere que el futuro de su hija sea diferente.
Esther está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su casa, de esta manera sus comidas se mantendrán en mejor estado por más tiempo. En un futuro Esther espera ver a su hija convertida en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Esther is a devoted mother with a wonderful daughter. She works as a cook at a restaurant in the city of Guadalupe. Her family is what motivates her in life. For this reason, Esther works every day so that she can have more income and be able to improve her family’s quality of life. Due to few financial resources and her need to work, she was not able to study for a profession. For this reason, she wants her daughter’s future to be different.

Esther is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have offered. She will be able to buy a refrigerator for her house. This will allow her to keep her food in good condition for a longer period of time. In the future, Esther hopes to see her daughter become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for storing her food.

loans.name: Armida Erodita

texts.es:
Armida de 55 años de edad,  solo estudio hasta primer grado, donde aprendió lo poco que sabe de leer y escribir, ella es madre soltera de cuatro hijos mayores que están casados, ella vive junto a 2 hijos y una nieta, prácticamente en su casa trabajan todos y se apoyan en los gastos.

Armida desde hace 30 años se dedica a la sastrería que tiene en su vivienda, comenta que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, es una actividad que la desarrolla a la perfección y que le apasiona este su único trabajo que por años lo ha desempeñado y que lo ha heredado a todos sus hijos e hijas y lo han aprendido, gracias a esto a logrado sacar sus hijos adelante económicamente y arreglar un poco su casa, y gracias también a que sus hijos que están con ella la apoyan a realizar los trabajos de costura y pedidos que le hacen generándole buenos ingresos a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 500 bloques de concreto, 15 bolsas de cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para terminar su cocina. 

Para el futuro Armida desea tener su propio taller más amplio, más maquinaria y poder emplear más personas que trabajen para ella, también seguir arreglando más su casa y dejarla como ella la desea, y para sus hijos desea lo mejor que también en un futuro puedan montar su propio taller de costura.
texts.en:
Armida is 55 years old. She studied only up to first grade, where she learned what little she knows of reading and writing. She is a single mother to four children who are now of legal age and married. She lives with two of her children and one granddaughter. Practically, everybody in her home works and helps out with the household expenses.

For 30 years now, Armida has been making a living working at the tailor's shop she set up at her home.  She says that it's a business that generates a good income for her and her family; that she does her job flawlessly; that she is passionate about it; that this has been her only job, which she has done for years; and that her children have inherited and learned the trade from her. Thanks to all of that, she has been able to get her children ahead and do a few home improvements—and also thanks to the support she receives from her children who live with her, for they help her out with the sewing and the customer orders, which generate good income for her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase 500 cinder blocks, 15 bags of cement, and sand; and to pay for labor to finish her kitchen.

In the future, Armida hopes to have a larger workshop and more machines, and be able to employ more people. She also hopes to continue doing more home improvements and turn her house into the one she always wanted. She wishes the best for her children and hopes that they will also be able to set up their own sewing workshop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 500 cinder blocks, 15 bags of cement, and sand; and to pay for labor to finish her kitchen.

loans.name: Baburyeli

texts.en: Baburyeli is a 69-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening and selling, alongside banana planting. He started this business to increase on his income and have a better standard of living. He has hardships of bad weather, animal diseases, and dry seasons that affect his cows. He has a vision of increasing the size of his farm. He is requesting for a loan to buy more cattle for fattening for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening for his farm.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 52 years old, and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, now at their adult age. Florida has been earning a living from a snack vending business for more than 10 years already. Florida earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity, which is of great help for their family income. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional varieties of snacks and other food products for retail. Florida has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Florida hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of snacks and other food products for retail.

loans.name: José Valdemar

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado ya que solo creció con su madre y ella no contaba con los recursos económicos necesarios para cubrir los gastos educativos.  Con él vive su hermano menor y su madre quienes dependen económicamente, su estado civil  es soltero.

Su principal fuente de ingresos es la agricultura trabajo que ha venido realizando por más de 10 años consecutivos, trabajo que aprendió con un amigo suyo y decidió dedicarse a esta debido a que produce granos básicos para el consumo familiar y parte para la venta, también elabora artesanías a base de nylon como lo son hamacas,  bolsos, etc. su lugar de cultivo está a 30 minutos a pie de su casa su madre y su hermano lo apoyan en la realización de las diferentes actividades que hay que hacer en el cultivo.

Con el préstamo comprara abono y pesticidas para aplicarlos a su cultivo y erradicar  un poco las plagas y enfermedades y nutrir la planta para tener una buena cosecha y así poder tener granos básicos para la venta y el consumo familiar.

Planea seguir trabajando y poder obtener una buena cosecha, ya que esta seguro que trabajando fuertemente sacara adelante a su familia, pues él desea darles una buena calidad de vida y en un futuro no muy lejos pretende construir su casa para cuando decida formar su familia pueda tener algo que ofrecerles
texts.en:
26-year-old José studied through the sixth grade since his mother raised him on her own and she didn't have the economic resources necessary to cover educational expenses. He lives with his younger brother and his mother who depend on him economically. He is single. His principle source of income in agricultural work, which he has done for 10 consecutive years. He learned this work with his friend and decided to work in it since he can produce basic grains for his family's consumption and sell part of it. He also makes artisan goods from nylon like hammocks and bags. His fields are 30 minutes walking from his mother's house and his borther supports him in the work that he must do in the fields. 

With the loan, he will buy manure and pesticides to apply to his crops and eradicate some plagues and diseases and feed the plants in order to have a good harvest. Thus, he will have basic grains so sale and familial consumption. He plans to continue working and cultivating a good harvest since he is sure that hard work will help him get ahead with his family. He hopes to offer them a high quality-of-life. In the near future, he plans to construct a house so he has something to offer when he decides to create a family.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides to apply to his crops and eradicate some plagues and diseases and feed the plants in order to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio is a 37-year-old, hardworking, married man with four children ages 15, 14, 12, 10 and 5 years, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling maize, groundnuts, and coffee as his main source of income, though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. 

He started this business to sustain his family and to educate his children. He faces a challenge of weather changes that affect his produce business, and lack of capital to meet the increasing demands. He has a vision of expanding his business. He is requesting for a loan to buy more maize, groundnuts and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, groundnuts, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.ru: Айчурок, 42 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2002 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айчурок на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 3 бычка, 1 теленок. На ежедневной основе Айчурок продает молоко. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Айчурок планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en: Aichurok is 42 years old, married and the mother of two. She has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, since 2002 she has been raising livestock and growing farm produce. Thanks to Aichurok's hard work, her farm at present includes three cows, three bulls, and one calf. Aichurok sells milk every day. In order to grow her business, she has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan n the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle. Aichurok plans to invest the resulting revenues into an additional livestock increase. She also would like to save up to buy some household appliances.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle.

loans.name: Marisol Modesta

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito 

Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage her business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for years and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. The borrower wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

The borrower is requesting a loan. She is pleased to receive it and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en:
Dionicia, is aged 54, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. 

Dionicia has been selling food at retail in her village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Due to insufficient funds in her business she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase noodles, sugar, salt, vinegar, soy sauce and condensed and evaporated milk to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, sugar, salt, vinegar, soy sauce and condensed and evaporated milk to sell.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 55 years old, has two children and they live at Piat. She is a hog raiser in her village. 

She wants to improve nutrition for her hogs, that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy feed and medicines for hogs. This will help ensure good growth of the hogs so she will be able to sell them at a higher price someday. 

She will save her additional profits for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for hogs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
In 2010, Antonia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives for start-ups. Antonia tried her luck, in doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative, for having trusted her with the money she used as capital.

Antonia borrowed another amount, to pay for seedlings and compost for her corn production business. This will help her by giving her farming income a big boost. Antonia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: To  pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa always dreamed of opening a flower shop, to support her two children. She used her loan to purchase fertilizers for her flower business. Now she is on her way to repaying the loan, with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her flower business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy towels, gels, creams, essences, and other supplies for providing physiotherapy services.

loans.name: Jhon Edwar

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven 19 años de edad, que desarrollo una gran pasión por todo lo relacionado con la barbería  y desde que salió del colegio comenzó a realizar cursos en esta área.

Inicio su etapa en distintas barberías de su localidad hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio en su propio y humilde hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, entre otros, adicionalmente desea realizar mejoras locativas para cambiar la apariencia de su negocio y hacerlo más llamativo. 
El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese y tenga muchos clientes para salir adelante al lado de sus padres.
texts.en:
Jhon is a young man of 19 years of age who developed a great passion for everything related to barbershops and since he left high school he began to carry out classes in this area.

He began this stage in different barbershops in his town until one day he took a risk and decided to go in search of his own customers, putting together a business in his own modest home.

He requests a loan in order to buy stock since he also wants to sell products to complement his services, such as hand cream, gel, hair products, among other things. In addition, he wishes to carry out renovations in order to change the appearance of his business and make it more striking. 

The loan will be very important because it will end up establishing his business, complementing it with all of the supplies necessary to operate and offer any service that is requested. 

His dream is that his business progresses and that he has many customers in order to get ahead alongside his parents.

loans.use: to buy hair products and renovate his barbershop.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia, con 46 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a un negocio de tienda de abarrotes y cafetería ubicada en el municipio de San Pedro De Los Milagros donde reside; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una licuadora y freidora que debe cambiar, además comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.
Amalia manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Amalia is 46 years old, and has made a living with her grocery store and coffee shop in the town of San Pedro De Los Milagros. where she lives, for many years. This is how she supplements the earnings with which she has raised her children.

Her tenacity and perseverance have enabled her to fight tirelessly, always seeking ways to move forwards. This is what has driven her to request the loan to buy a blender and a fryer she needs to change, and to buy wholesale stock (fast food, fizzy drinks, sweets, baked goods and other items). This will allow her to continue her work with a greater variety of goods to offer her customers, improving sales and income as a result.

Amalia says that her biggest dream is to acquire her own store in the city centre to set up her business and make it much more profitable, in order to guarantee her financial stability and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fizzy drinks and food to boost her sales and increase her income for her family.

loans.name: Luzma

texts.en: Luzma signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Luzma was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Levina

texts.en: Levina signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital PMPC extended to a small-time borrower like her. Levina was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan, to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to establish a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Adorna

texts.en:
Adorna is a pensioner and she is supervising the renovation of their home. Adorna hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing, supported by her loan of Php 40,000. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. 

Matter that Adorna has given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to use for house renovation

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a 65-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming as his main source of income, though he earns extra income from produce selling. He started this business to take care of his family and have a better standard of living. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations. He has a vision of becoming a role model in society.

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure for his farm and seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy manure for his farm and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for his food preparations and to buy a freezer to store them.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a thirty-four-year-old, hard-working, married man. He lives in Kamwenge, in Uganda. He deals in livestock farming as his main source of income, though he also earns a monthly income as a secretary. He started the livestock business, to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces a challenge of seasonal weather changes that affect his business; however, he has a vision of expanding his farm and coffee plantation.

He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Alozious

texts.en:
Alozious is a 54-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in pineapple farming as his main source of income, though he also earns an extra income from his retail shop. He started this business to have a better standard of living. He faces a challenge of pests, diseases, and prolonged drought, however, he has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 31 years old. She lives in the Carangan, Ozamiz city. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan for her house extension. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to use to expand her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother to a thirteen-year-old child from Dulag, Leyte. Adelaida has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 11 years now. This is the source of her income. Adelaida is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her hog raising business to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a twenty-seven-year-old single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a boutique as his main source of income, although he also earns money from a transport business (taxi) as his side income. It is through these businesses that he has been able to sustain himself. High rental and license fees are a problem, but he has hopes of expanding his business into a big boutique.

Ambrose is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows in order to increase the volume of milk to sell, and to harvest eco-friendly haricot

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 50 years old and lives in Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child currently at school age. 

Paulina has been engaged in the hog fattening business for 5 years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. At present she has one sow and two piglets. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 sacks of lactating feed and 3 sacks of booster feed.

Paulina has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years. In the future, Paulina hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of lactating feed and 3 sacks of booster feed for her pigs.

loans.name: M Deliphine

texts.en: M Deliphine is 40 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 17 years, all of whom attend school. She sells shoes and has been selling in a business for the past 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel is 27 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children, now at school age. 

Mitchel just recently engaged in the meat butchering and vending business together with her husband. The couple earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing one pig for butchering and for sale to their neighbors and friends.

Mitchel has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Mitchel hopes to expand her meat butchering and vending business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing one pig for butchering to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a welding machine for his workshop

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny is a 34-year-old man married with children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling bread, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc., and obtains other income from a salary. He is hard working and began the business so as to be able to pay school fees for the children and supplement his salary as a cashier. 

Tonny hopes to expand his retail shop, though he faces a challenge of high prices of commodities. He is requesting the loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap, etc., to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 33-year-old married man with three children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a trader who buys and sells produce such as maize, beans, and soya beans, and he earns additional income from rentals. He started the business to meet his family’s needs. He hopes to grow into a large-scale produce buyer, although he is faced with the challenge of few customers to buy his produce. Deo needs the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 25 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4, and all of them go to school. 

She has been selling clothes for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is 35 years old, she is married with 5 children aged between 1 and 8 years of age; 2 of them go to school. 

She has been selling cooking oil for 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudance is 31 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 12 and 2 years, two of them go to school. 

She sells charcoal and has been running a business for the past 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for sale.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as organic and non-organic fertilizers and to pay for labor to seed potatoes and strawberries.

loans.name: Sairakan

texts.ru: Сайракан, 51 год, замужем, мать 5 детей. Семья очень дружная и уважаемая в селе. Сайракан работает помощником повара в кафе, также занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сайракан есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль от животноводства составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS), также есть зарплата в размере 6,000 сом (KGS). Всю прибыль от бизнеса Сайракан старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. Однако в этом году она решила построить времянку и хоз постройки на территории дома. Поэтому Сайракан и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку окон, дверей, шифера и прочих строительных материалов. Прибыль от бизнеса позволит Сайракан и дальше развивать ее деятельность и накопить средства на свадьбу сыновей.
texts.en: Sairakan is 51, married, and has five children. Her family is very friendly and respected in the village. Sairakan is an assistant cook at a cafe and also raises livestock. She currently has two cows and ten sheep and earns about 5,000 som (KGS) per month in addition to her monthly salary of 6,000 som (KGS). She invests all of the profits from her business in its continued development. This year, however, she decided to build a temporary building on her property. This is why she applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum Bank for 30,000 som (KGS) to buy windows, doors, slate and other building materials. Profits from her business will help her to continue expanding and to pay for her sons’ weddings.

loans.use: To buy windows, doors and other construction materials to build a temporary structure on her property

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the process to get his professional degree of environmental engineer.

loans.name: Margoth Isabel

texts.es: Margoth de 56 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos básicos, sopas, aceite, jabón, refrescos, detergentes, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Margoth is 56 years old and is a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives in a house with her husband who helps her in the business.  She has a small store located in at her home.  She has many customers thanks to her good prices.  She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as basic grains, soups, oil, soap,  soda, detergent, etc. and this way have better income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as basic grains, soups, oil, soap, soda, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized aluminum and wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and lime for tortilla making.

loans.name: Dora  Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la calidad del productos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más variedad de zapatos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Dora is 36 years old, lives in a house she owns with her four children and her husband, she sells shoes.  Her business is located in the municipal market located close to her place of residence.  She has many customers because of the good prices and quality of the products she sells.  She is requesting a loan to buy more shoes at wholesale prices to continue with her sales and obtain more income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de peluqueria,la socia continua realizando corte de cabello, teñido entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She continues with her hairdressing business. She continues to do haircuts and color, among others, for all her customers who ask her. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan to buy hair dyes, among other items.

She is grateful for the loan given and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, among other items

loans.name: Los Parra Group

texts.es:
Los Parra es un pequeño grupo integrado por cuatro personas, trabajadoras,alegres,hospitalarias, de las cuales tres radican en una comunidad que se encuentra rodeada por cañales y en temporada de lluvia la laguna se llena y algunas veces impide el paso a los habitantes por lo que deben tomar caminos alternos, la localidad es 100% cañera aunque también hay piedras de cal las cuales son llevadas a la calera ubicada a una hora de la comunidad para ser procesadas y así obtener la cal.

Los integrantes del grupo son:
Efigenia-Venta De Fertilizantes
Teresa-Venta De Fertilizantes
Jesús-Venta De Fertilizantes

Y  el señor  José Antonio  quien tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Griselda quien es modista y se dedica a costurar desde un short  hasta un vestido de novia, solo viven ellos dos  pues no tienen hijos, Jose Antonio es mejor conocido como “Toño” o “Tornado”, desde hace ya mas de 23 años se ha dedicado a trabajar como taxista, al principio era chofer de uno de los taxis de su padre, lo cual cambio con el paso del tiempo pues con esfuerzos de el y su esposa lograron ahorrar para comprar una concesión de taxi, iniciando de esta manera a manejar el para su propios ingresos,hace algunos dos años su mayor anhelo era obtener otra concesión suelo que cumplió con ayuda del préstamo otorgado por vision fund hace dos años,ahora tiene un trabajador, Toño trabaja todos los días de 8:00am- 8:00pm, de la misma manera acude a cualquier llamado de sus clientes llevándolos a buscar hasta su domicilio también hace viajes especiales, comenta que al laborar como taxista ha conocido muchos lugares y lo mejor de todo ha hecho muchas amistades por lo cual se siente muy a gusto, comenta que el préstamo otorgado lo utilizara para arreglar el motor de un taxi que anda fallando y darles mantenimiento pues con el servicio que presta obtiene ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y apoyar a su esposa en la compra del material necesario para continuar con sus costuras.

José Antonio viste de playera blanca y esta sentado al lado de la señora Teresa quien viste con blusa a rayas en color verde.
texts.en:
Los Parra is a small group made up of four hard-working, cheerful and hospitable people. Three of them live in a community that is surrounded by sugar cane plantations and in the rainy season the lagoon sometimes fills up and they can no longer pass on the roads, and must take alternate routes. The locality is 100% sugar cane, although there are also some lime stones that are taken to the quarry one hour away from the community to be processed and thus obtain lime.

The members of the group are:
Efigenia - sells fertilizers 
Teresa - sells fertilizers 
Jesùs - sells fertilizers 

And Jose Antonio who is 43 years old and married to Griselda, who works as a seamstress and can sew anything from a pair of shorts to a wedding dress. The two of them live alone since they don't have children. Jose Antonio is better known as “Toño” or “Tornado”, and has been working as a taxi driver for more than 23 years already. He began driving one of his father's taxis, but this changed with the passage of time as his and his wife's efforts enabled them buy a business license for their own taxi. In this way, the income from his driving became his own. Two years ago his biggest wish was to buy another license, a dream he fulfilled with the help of a loan from Vision Fund two years ago. He now has an employee. Toño works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., in this way he can answer any calls from his clients, even going to pick them up at their homes. He also does special trips. He says that by working as a taxi driver he has gotten to see many places and the best of all is that he has made many friends. For this reason he really likes his job. The requested loan will be used to fix the motor of a taxi that is failing and ensure their maintenance, since the service he provides allows him to satisfy his family's needs and help his wife to purchase the materials she needs for her sewing.


José Antonio is wearing a white T-shirt and is sitting next to Teresa, who is wearing a green striped blouse.

loans.use: to fix the motor of one taxi and ensure maintenance on his taxis.

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 53-years-old farmer from Dulag, Leyte, Philippines. She is a widow and has three  children. Myrna has been in the farming business for more than 5 years now. 

Myrna works hard to earn a living to support her family, especially to pay for her children's schooling. Myrna is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for farm labor. Myrna believes that with a loan she will be able to grow healthy crops allowing her farm to produce more to harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Didacienne

texts.en: Didacienne, 30 years old, is married with two children between two and four years old who do not yet go school. She has been selling shoes for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, lotions and cosmetics to sell on the street and take care of his family.

loans.name: Alejandra Carolina

texts.es: Alejandra de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una joven con ganas de superarse y salir adelante y es por ello que todos los días se esfuerza para apoyar a su compañero de vida con los gastos económicos del hogar prestando sus servicios domésticos, ya que él se desempeña como empleado de una gasolinera. La vivienda de Alejandra es humilde como se puede observar en la fotografía, pero ella en su deseo de mejorarla poco a poco solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: dos puertas para cambiar las de los cuartos ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas por lo siente que son inseguras.
texts.en: Alejandra is 22 and lives in a humble home but her own with her life partner and her two year-old daughter.  She is a young woman with dreams to get ahead and improve; this is why she makes an effort every day to help her life partner with the home expenses. She provides cleaning services and he works at a gas station.  Her house is humble as it can be seen in the photo, she wants to improve it little by little and requests a loan to FUSAI to invest in two doors to replace the bedroom doors that are deteriorated and are unsafe.

loans.use: to invest in two doors to replace the bedroom doors that are deteriorated and unsafe for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized aluminum, wood, nails and this way build a back corridor at her home.

loans.name: Dar West Group

texts.en:
Bryson is 42 years old, married and has two sons and one daughter. Two of his children are in school and one is still a baby. 

He has been a businessman managing a kitchen selling soup and roasted meat, known as nyama choma with ugali. He is so good at roasting meat, that it has allowed him to fulfill more customer's orders. He has been in this business since 2006. Working from 8am to midnight each working day, he is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his third credit request which he will use to buy a fridge and stocks of meat for his business. He used the previous credits to buy goats and kilos of cow meat, cooking oil and bananas (which he used to mix with soup), and also maize flour for his business. Bryson earned extra income which he used to pay school fees, household expenses and lastly he saved because he want to build a house for his family.  

His desire is to build a house and improve his business. 

Bryson will share this loan with his loan group "DAR WEST" which totals three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and meat for his business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEI, el socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesanía, el socio es una persona respaonble y empeñoso, el socio continua vendiendo collares, pulseras entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
 El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de collares entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. He continues with his handcrafts business. He is a responsible and dedicated person. He continues selling necklaces and bracelets, among other items, to all his customers who ask him. In this way, he moves his family forward.

He is asking for the loan to buy necklaces, among other items.

He is grateful for the loan given and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, among other items

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y pollos, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She continues with her business raising small animals such as hens and chickens. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan to buy hens.

She is grateful for the loan given and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy hens

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a 55-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than three years now. Her husband works as a carpenter. Clarita also raises pigs, which provides a supplemental income.

Clarita is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to raise more pigs that she can sell after several weeks. Clarita hopes to expand her venture and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 63 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad y en su condición de mujer separada de su esposo debió acudir a generar ingresos suficientes para su hogar, así fue como desde el año 1983 decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancías para lograr apoyar el bienestar de sus 5 hijos, hoy en las edades de 28 a 39 años. Con su negocio ha salido adelante con su núcleo familiar pues distribuye por encargos sabanas, cubrelechos, ropa y artículos que sus clientela le solicita, haciéndole a cada uno de ellos un plan de pagos ajustados a sus necesidades. En un 100% sus ventas las realiza a crédito, con una frecuencia quincenal, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa para damas. Con esta inversión proyecta que su negocio esté surtido y ella pueda cumplir efectivamente los pedidos de su clientela
texts.en: Nancy is 63, she lives south of the city, she is separated from her husband and as a single mom she needed to generate sufficient income for her home, this is how in 1983 she decided to sell merchandise to support the well-being of her 5 children from ages 28 to 39.  With her business she has been getting ahead with her family.  She distributes sheets, comforters, clothing and articles that her customers request.  She prepares a payment plan according to each customer’s needs. 100% of her sales are credit with biweekly repayments; she works from 8 am to 4 pm.  Currently she is applying for a kiva credit through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy women’s clothing.  With this investment her business will be stocked and she will be able to fill her customer’s orders.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 46, is a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. Married to Ricardo, a driver, she has one child  who is now in High School. She, together with her husband, manage their own household. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expense and school needs of her family.

Imelda buys and sells native fruits like "dalanghita", corn and other snack items like biscuits. Filipinos love to eat the local oranges and sweet corn for snacks. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her  business she is requesting a Php 9000 loan which she will use  the loan to buy the fruits and biscuits for her snack stall. She is positive for a good turnout for her business as she is already known for selling these favorite snacks. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 
 
Imelda aims to grow her business and save for her old age.  She also desires to send her child to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for food & snack items to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 35 and married with 3 children between 12 and 8 years old. All of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been working in this business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and books for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and for the  welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and books for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her squash crop.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo de manera independiente a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She continues to work at her business, where she purchases and sells clothing.   She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to make her established payments.

She continues to sell independently to customers who come to her business. This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy jackets.

loans.use: to buy jackets.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia continua con su negocio de peluqueria,la socia  se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua realizando peinados,cortede cabello entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes entre otros.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. She is continuing with her hairdressing business. She is grateful for the loan granted to her and is committed to making her loan repayments on time. She still works styling and cutting hair, among other things, which is how she supports her family. The member is requesting the loan to buy dyes and other items.

loans.use: to buy dyes and other items.

loans.name: Pabiosa

texts.en:
This is Pabiosa. She is 35 years old and she lives with her family in Iloilo, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her child. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their child with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Pabiosa would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 6,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Pabiosa hopes for her business to grow and get bigger. She also dreams of giving her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa es una joven de 22 años de edad, muy emprendedora y segura de cada paso queda en su vida. Actualmente ella trabaja y estudia Banca y Finanzas, lo cual hace que cada conocimiento que adquiere en sus clases lo aplique en su trabajo como Administradora. Unos de sus sueños es obtener una maestría motivo por el cual María Luisa solicita un préstamo para pagar su maestría y de esta manera estará cumpliendo con su sueño. Sus principales futuros es seguir estudiando, aprender otro idioma y aperturar su propio negocio.
texts.en: María Luisa is 22 years old, and is very enterprising and sure of every step she takes in life. She currently works and studies banking and finance. She applies every new thing she learns in her classes to her work as an administrator. One of María Luisa's dreams is to get a master's degree, which is why she is requesting a loan to pay for her master's degree and achieve her dream. She plans to continue studying, learn another language and open her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her master's degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for ultrasounds and medical consultations

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles à  BLAKALAMA KABOILA  un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur trente-sixième prêt solidaire à travers le groupe qui évolue avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de mieux satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame AFOU  fait le commerce de plastiques pour la cuisine dans ce groupe de femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA. Elle est assise à la première position de la droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  des quantités importantes de plastique pour la cuisine pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée des femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group KOTOGNOGONTALA are married women, who average 47 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in BLAKALAMA KABOILA, one of the working-class districts in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they are on their 36th solidarity loan with the group, which is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for meeting customer needs better. 

Ms. AFOU does commerce in kitchen plasticware in this women’s group KOTOGNOGONTALA. She is the one sitting first at the right in the photo. With this loan, she intends to purchase significant amounts of kitchenware made of plastic to resell to women customers paying with cash at the market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is for paying back the loan with interest, and part is going toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase plasticware for the kitchen

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de flores y venta de  comida a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Zoraida belongs to the "COMUZONE I" communal bank. She continues with her business of selling flowers and selling food to all of her customers that request it.

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledged to make her established payments.

She is requesting the loan to buy cooking oil, among other things.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, among other things.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, el socio continua dedicándose a ejercer su carrera, el socio es contador de profesión, El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para los estudios de su hija.
texts.en: Felix belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. He continues to work in his job as an accountant. He is grateful for the loan granted to him and is committed to making his loan repayments on time. He is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how he supports his family. Felix is requesting the loan to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza (mother) has been photographed with Klediona (daughter) for whom she is requesting a loan for her higher education. Next to her is their restless dog, Defor. 

Mimoza is a 48-year-old married mother of two children who are 23 and 18 years old. They live in the city of Korca, known for its cuisine, carnivals, serenades, cobblestone streets, the clean environment and the bitter cold and snowy weather that starts as early as October and lasts until the end of April. 

Mimoza works in a clothing manufacturing business that is operated by foreigners while her husband has been running his little welding shop for a few years now and according to him, he’s busy.

loans.use: to pay for her daugher's university fees

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: José es un señor de 56 años de edad, casado, hospitalario, muy humilde, amigable y padre de 4 hijos de los cuales solo del menor está cargo. José es una persona que trabaja la madera de diversas formas pero principalmente en muebles y casitas para mascotas como los canes. Toda esta actividad la inicio hace 25 años cuando solo era un aprendiz de carpintería y poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta comprar su propia maquinaria y emprender su propio negocio. Hoy en día José solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera y así de esta manera seguir elaborando sus grandes obras artísticas en madera. Unas de sus grandes metas es incursionar nuevos productos en el mercado siempre a base de madera.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old and married. He is a hospitable, friendly, and very humble man. He is the father of 4 children, but he is currently only in charge of the youngest. Jose works wood in various ways but mostly makes furniture and little houses for pets such as dogs. He started all of this work 25 years ago when he was only a carpentry apprentice.
