Little by little he started saving until he was able to buy his own machinery and start his own business.

Today, Jose is requesting a loan to buy wood so that he can continue to create his great artistic works in wood. One of his greatest goals is to experiment in the market with new products that are made of wood.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a hardworking man who deals in the buying and selling of maize, groundnuts, millet and beans. He gets other income from growing and selling bananas. He began his business in order to improve his standard of living and build a permanent home but with a limiting factor of capital. The purpose of the loan is to purchase maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.
.

loans.use: to purchase maize, groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She continues earning her living selling sweaters. She feels grateful for the loan granted and she promises to make her established loan payments. She is a responsible and hardworking person, which is how she provides for her family. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sweaters.

loans.use: to buy sweaters

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, el socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas., el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas,chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs tot he COMUZONE I Communal Bank.  He still has his clothes-selling business.  He is thankful for the loan he has been offered and promises to make his payments. He has had his business for a good while and it brings him personal satisfaction, as this is the way he gets his family ahead. 

He is requesting a loan to buy coats and sweaters, among other things.

loans.use: to buy coats and sweaters, among other things

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman and a mother of two children ages nine and five years old. She lives with her family in Dulag, Leyte. Arlene operates a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. For more than six years now, this business has provided Arlene the income that she needs to support the family. 

Now she is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings. Through this, she will be able to improve her stocks, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her store. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, beverages, toiletries, cooking oil, and seasonings

loans.name: Al- Ikhlas 34 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Ikhlas 34. It consists of three ladies and one man who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is a hardworking woman. She is a 42-years-old married woman with ten children. Her oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest one, a 9-years-old lives with her family in a poor area in Hodeidah. She is the leader of the group. 

In order to help her husband with the expenses of the family Fatima decided to work in dressmaking for women's and children's clothes. She started her own business with a small capital 9 years ago. Fatima's business lacks many of sewing materials and her capital still is low. For this reason, Fatima applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials such as fabrics, threads, and buttons in order to improve her business more.

Fatima looks forward to expanding her business more through opening a small store for dressmaking and buying many sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.name: El Arca De Noe Group

texts.es:
El Arca De Noé es un grupo conformado por  10 mujeres  trabajadoras, responsables y honestas. Comentan que el nombre del grupo surgió a raíz del nombre de su Oficial de Crédito quien al igual que VisionFund México les ha brindado un voto de confianza. La comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo pertenece a una zona cañera, muy cerca, funciona un ingenio, gran fuente de empleo tanto en tiempo de reparación como en zafra (corte de caña).

Las integrantes del grupo son:
Mariana-Venta De Oro Laminado 
Reyna-Venta De Refrescos Y Dulces
Alberta- Venta De Ropa 
María-Venta De Calzado 
Cintia-Venta De Abarrotes
Joaquina-Venta De Refrescos Y Comida 
Asencion-Venta De Ropa
Ciria-Venta De Comida 
Dolores-Venta De Oro Laminado Y Jafra
Ana Laura-Venta de Abarrotes

Ana Laura es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre; tiene tres hijas de las cuales, dos aún dependen económicamente de ella y de su esposo, el señor Osbaldo, quien trabaja en el campo. Las dos pequeñas de la señora Ana son patrocinadas por World Vision. Cuando ella escuchó acerca de los prestamos de VisionFund decidió organizar un grupo para el cual busco a mujeres responsables y con una actividad económica en la cual pudieran invertir el dinero.

La señora Ana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace 13 años; adecuó un pequeño local en su casa para no descuidar a su familia. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, comenta que el préstamo otorgado lo empleará en la compra de mercancía: arroz, sopa, azúcar, frijol, maíz, aceite, papel higiénico, galletas, atún, chiles y detergente para ofrecer un mejor surtido a sus clientes.

*En la imagen: Ana Laura viste de playera roja y se ubica detrás de Cintia quien viste playera blanca.
texts.en:
Noah's Ark is a group made up of 10 hard-working, responsible, and honest women. They note that the name of the group arose from the name of their Loan Officer, who has given them a vote of confidence, just like VisionFund Mexico. The community where the group is located is in a sugarcane growing region. There is a sugar factory very close by that is a large source of employment, both during preparation and harvesting (cutting the cane).

The members of the group are:

Mariana - Sells gold leaf
Reyna - Sells soft drinks and sweets
Alberta - Sells clothing
María - Sells shoes
Cintia - Sells groceries
Joaquina - Sells soft drinks and food
Asencion - Sells clothing
Ciria - Sells food
Dolores - Sells gold leaf and Jafra products
Ana Laura - Sells groceries

Ana Laura is a very hard-working and happy woman. She has three daughters, two of whom depend financially on her and her husband, Osbaldo, who works in the fields. Ana's two small children are sponsored by World Vision. When she heard about VisionFund's loans, she decided to organize a group, for which she seeks responsible women with an economic activity in which they can invest money.

Ana has sold groceries for 13 years; she fitted out a small store in her home in order to not neglect her family. With the earnings obtained she helps her husband with the household expenses. She notes that she will use the loan given to buy merchandise: rice, soup, sugar, beans, corn, oil, toilet paper, cookies, tuna, chiles, and detergent, in order to offer her customers a better supply.

*In the image: Ana Laura is wearing a red t-shirt and is located behind Cintia, who is wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy: rice, soup, sugar, beans, corn, oil, toilet paper, cookies, tuna, chiles, and detergent

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMDEDIO ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence ia aged 35. She is married with 3 children aged between 12 years and 9 months, 2 of them go to school. 

She sells food stuffs and has been running a business for the past 3 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for selling. The profits from the business will be used to support the family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Group

texts.en:
In the small town of Santa Cruz La Laguna on the shores of Lake Atitlán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, nine ladies have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Corazón de Oro” (Heart of Gold). These hard-working women are truly heart-centered and determined to move ahead in their lives. Their average age is 35 and they have an average of 2 years of formal education. They each have an average of 4 children. The ladies work in textile production, creating the traditional clothing of the area. As Santa Cruz La Laguna draws tourists to the area, the women want to have enough inventory to attract customers.

The group has just welcomed a new member whose name is Paulina. At 23 years of age, she is the youngest in the Trust Bank. Paulina has one child. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase thread, needles and fabric to create traditional tubular skirts, called “cortes", and elaborately embroidered belts. She is motivated to create a better future for her small child. 

Paulina decided to join the Trust Bank because she witnessed how the members of the Trust Bank improved their lives with their small loans and education, a combination that Friendship Bridge calls Microcredit Plus.  A portion of the monthly Trust Bank meeting is dedicated to sharing knowledge by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. Some of the topics covered include effective business management practices (business design, budgeting, customer service, marketing, accounting), as well as nutrition, health and hygiene. The ladies learn about women’s rights, women’s empowerment and self-esteem.
 
We look forward to providing a follow-up report on Paulina and the ladies in the “Corazón de Oro” Trust Bank. They are thankful to have the opportunity to secure loans and education. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles and fabric that she will use to create traditional tubular skirts called “cortes"

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plastiqueria como escobas,valdes entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vasos, platos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. She is 32 years old and single. She divides her time between her everyday activities and her business of selling plasticware like brooms, buckets, and more. She has had this business for a good amount of time and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day; this is how she provides for her family.

The member is requesting the loan to buy cups, plates, and more. She feels grateful for the loan granted, and she promises to make her established loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase cups, plates, and more.

loans.name: Avelina Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia tiene 37 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,pefumes entre otros, la socia vende de forma independiente a toso sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs to the COMUZONE I Communal Bank.  She is 37 years old and she is married.  She alternates her daily chores with her business selling beauty products, such as creams, colognes, and perfumes, among others.  She does her selling independently to all of the customers who patronize her.  She has had her business for a good while and it is going well for her because of the effort she puts into her business every day.  In this way, this bank member is getting her family ahead.  

She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes.

She is very thankful for the loan she has received and she promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Karifa Dit Idrissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur KALIFA DIT IDRISSA est né en janvier 1983 à Kayes 1ere région administrative de la république du MALI, célibataire et résidant sous-couvert de son père au quartier  BABEMBA  un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès monsieur KALIFA DIT IDRISSA s’est initié des activités d’achat et de vente des marchandises de la librairie (cahiers,  bics, règles, des gommes plus divers matériels pour la librairie., il s’approvisionne  dans les sous régions.
 Il est à son deuxième prêt  individuel commerçant avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 15 cartons de cahier de marque différente, 8 cartons de bic, 5 cartons de règle pour les élèves plus une quantité importante de gomme. Sa vente se fait dans sa librairie au quartier BABEMBA à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice bimensuel moyen de 240 000 francs CFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. KALIFA DIT IDRISSA was born in January 1983 in Kayey in the 1st administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He is unmarried and is staying with his father in the BABEMBA, a working-class district in SIKASSO CITY (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Mr. KALIFA DIT IDRISSA became familiar with the business of buying and selling office supplies (notebooks, pens, rulers, erasers, and a variety of supplies for bookstores). He gets his supplies from sub-regions. 

He is on his second individual loan for merchants at the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso out of concern for satisfying his burgeoning customer base. The previous loan was correctly paid back. This loan will enable him to purchase 15 boxes of notebooks of different brans, 8 boxes of pens, 5 boxes of rulers for students, and a significant amount of erasers. 

His sales are made to men and women customers paying with cash or credit at the bookstore in the BABEMBA district. He envisions making an average profit of 250,000 francs CFA every two months. This profit will enable him to pay back the loan with interest and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, rulers, erasers, and a variety of supplies for the bookstore

loans.name: Engracia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS INMACULADAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Engracia tiene 42 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta d pollipapas, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera la socia continua apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de papas, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Las Inmaculadas communal bank. The bank is located in the Santa Ana district in La Convención province and Cusco department.

Engracia is 42 years old and has 2 children. She is in a common-law marriage. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling pollipapas [fried potatoes with chicken]. She sells in one of the area markets. She has had this business for a long time, and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her business every day. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan to buy potatoes and oil, among other items.

She is grateful for the loan give and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and oil, among other items

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 36 years old. She is married to Fredrick and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children who are 14 and 8 years old, respectively. Fredrick runs his own business, providing additional income for the family.

Millicent is in the transport business, which she has run for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. Millicent has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 50,000, which she will use to buy spare parts for her van (matatu). She successfully repaid her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Millicent will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and live a happy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her van

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a 40-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 14 and 3 years, all of whom go to school. For the past seven years she has operated a bar. 

Claire has requested this loan to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will pay school fees for her children and be reinvested in her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda for sale.

loans.name: Bujubuli Abeteraine Development Association Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 60-year-old married mother of four living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, is a member of a village bank whose members guarantee each other's loan repayments. Elizabeth has been growing and selling bananas for many years, and  she earns additional income weaving and selling baskets, a business she started to diversify her income.

Elizabeth is faced with the problem of inadequate capital to expand her banana plantation into a large farm to serve the surrounding urban population. She is therefore requesting a loan to expand her banana acreage.

loans.use: to expand her banana acreage

loans.name: Arnes

texts.es: Arnes: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Waspan, tiene 33 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, arena, cemento. Su sueño es comprar una motocicleta para utilizarla como medio de transporte y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Arnes is a hardworking man from Waspan.  He is 33 years old, married, and has four young children.  He is requesting his third loan to buy construction materials: wood, sand, cement.  His dream is to buy a motorcycle to use as a means of transportation and to support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: wood, sand, cement

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is member of the Egyptian Albanian vulnerable community.  He is 52-years-old and a father of one. Alberto is being photographed here with his mother Fato. They live in very poor conditions, yet they remain humble to their situation and thankful to God for their state. While Alberto does painting to earn a living, his mother is a retiree with a little pension. 

Alberto and his mother now are seeking your compassion to install roofing to their destroyed house. They live in the city of Korca, known for its bitter cold and snowy weather.  The minus temperature has already started and if they do not have your financial help they both will literally suffer from the cold; yet, Alberto is more concerned for his mother who already has health issues.

loans.use: to install a roof

loans.name: Demetrio Allen

texts.es: Demetrio: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 58 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Por razones laborales desde hace 2 años se trasladó al municipio de Waspam, para trabajar como docente. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para construir un anexo en su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción. Su sueño es establecer un negocio para incrementar los ingresos en el hogar.
texts.en:
Demetrio is a determined man and a native of Puerto Cabezas. He is 58 years old, married, and has four children who are minors. For employment reasons, he has traveled to the city of Waspam for two years to work as a teacher. 

He is requesting his second financing in order to build an addition on his house and to buy construction materials. His dream is to establish a business to increase his household income.

loans.use: to build an addition on his house and to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis esta siguiendo la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, es una persona muy emprendedora, que esta luchando por poder salir adelante y ser un profesional exitoso que ayude a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
El esta luchando y se esta esforzando por poder cumplir su meta. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Luis is pursuing an commercial engineering degree; he is an enterprising person who is working to be able to get ahead and become a successful professional who helps other people through his work.  

He is working and applying himself to be able to achieve his goal.  He tells us that he used his previous loan to pay his university fees, which helped him a great deal.  

Now he is requesting a new loan to spend once again on his university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Koniba

texts.fr:
Monsieur KONIBA est né vers 1959 à CINZENI, marié et père de 10 enfants il réside avec ses épouses et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU I un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur  KONIBA   après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié aux activités d’achat et vente des  accesoires de téléphone ( façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, cartes mémoires, etc) et de cigarettes. Il mène son activité à SANOUBOUGOU I où il dispose d’une d’une petite kiosque. Monsieur KONIBA est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son sixième prêt individuel. 
Avec ce sixième prêt, il compte acheter 1 carton de façade, 20 chargeurs, 2 paquets de carte mémoire, 2 cartons de cigarettes, 3 cartons de batterie et 2 douzaines d’écouteur. 
 Il s’approvisionne au grand marché pour la revendre en détail à SANOUBOUGOU I à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce,  payer les prêts et son intérêts.
texts.en:
Mr. KONIBA was born around 1959 in CINZENI. A married father of ten children, she resides with his wives and their children in a large traditional family in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the working-class district in SIKASSO CITY (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Mr. KONIBA became familiar with the business of buying and selling phone accessories (skins, batteries, chargers, earphones, memory cards, etc.) He operates his business in SANOUBOUGOU I, where he has a small stall. He is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products. 

Concerned about satisfying his burgeoning customer base better, Mr. KONIBA had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his sixth individual loan. With this sixth loan, he intends to purchase a boxes of skins, 20 chargers, 2 packets of memory cards, 2 boxes of cigarettes, 3 boxes of batteries, and 2 dozen earphones. He gets his supplies at the big market and then sells the goods retail to men and women customers paying with cash or credit in SANOUBOUGOU I. 

He envisions making a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase his business capital and to pay back the loan with interest.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories and cigarettes

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Estancia, Iloilo, Philippines. He is 28-years-old and manages a dried fish business. His income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

He buys different kinds of dried fish like Bangus (milkfish, and an important seafood in Southeast Asia and some Pacific Islands) from his suppliers and then sells it in the market. His store is located in a temporary fish market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.
 
Ronald is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell. He will use his loan to improve his sales and his additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

In the future, he hopes to expand soon and manage other business opportunities. He likewise dreams to give his family a better life. He meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of bangus and other dried fish products

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a 37-year-old man. He is married with three children who live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling bread, sodas, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. He earns other income from a salary. He began the business to be able to meet his family's needs. He hopes to expand his retail shop though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital. George is requesting the loan to buy sugar and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo, a 49-year-old married man, earns a living through his retail sales of coconut wine. A father of three children, Segundo has been in the business for more than 14 years now. Coconut wine or tuba can also be fermented into vinegar. This is the source of his income. 

Segundo wants to borrow a loan for his business. He is requesting for a loan to buy more coconut wine. 

Segundo believes that a loan could really help him in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en:
Arshaluys happily lives with his family in the frontier village Sarigyugh of Tavush region. He is 49-years-old and he has a big, nice family; he lives with his wife, son’s family and with his retired parents. During the past many years and now, Arshaluys also works as a driver and on his own track he transfers people from the village to Ijevan city, but he could not sustain all his family’s needs if he wasn’t engaged in farming and agriculture.  He was an 18-year-old young man when he began his farming activities. Now he has a cute farm where he takes care of 4 cows and 40 chickens. His plot of land also gives him a good harvest of fruits (figs, persimmon and apples) and vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and greens) which he sells from his house and some part of it is used for his big family’s use. The sale of his farm’s dairy-products and eggs his wife’s duty. 

Arshaluys asks this loan in an amount of 500,000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy piglets and start swine breeding on his farm and he also wants to buy fodder for his all farm cattle. With this new idea he hopes to have success and more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and start swine breeding on his farm

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: Zacarías: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Waspan, tiene 45 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 11 años estableció una pulpería. Solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida y velar por la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Zacarías is a hard-working man. A native of Waspan, he is 45 years old and married with 3 young children. He established a grocery store 11 years ago with the goal of having his own source of income. He is requesting his third loan in order to buy merchandise. His dream is to improve his children's quality of life and to look after their education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: staple grains and snacks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS INMACULADAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Patricia tiene 40 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollipapas, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera la socia continua apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de papas, aceite,pollo entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member Patricia belongs to Las Inmaculadas Communal Bank, which is located in Santa Ana district, La Convencion province, in the Department of Cusco.

Patricia is 40 years old, has two children, and is single. Her daily activities center on her business selling “pollipapas” [a chicken and potatoes dish]. She sells her products in one of the zone's markets. Patricia has had this business for a long time and it brings her personal satisfaction. She wants to continue working in this manner to help her family.

Patricia is requesting a loan to purchase potatoes, cooking oil, and chicken, among other supplies.

She is grateful for the authorized loan and she promises to comply with her established schedule of payments.

loans.use: buy potatoes, cooking oil, and chicken among other supplies.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a married woman with children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling soap, stationery, cosmetics, sugar, salt, and household items. She obtains additional income from poultry keeping and farming. 

Limited capital to buy more products, coupled with price fluctuations, hinders her business. Jemimah's vision is to be economically well off with proceeds from her business. She needs the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gordfrey

texts.en: Gordfrey is a 42-year-old married man with 6 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a trader and earns additional income from rentals. He started the business in order to meet his family's needs. He hopes to complete construction of his other rental house from the proceeds from his rental income. He faces a challenge of few customers to use his housing facilities. Gordfrey needs the loan to complete his rental house.

loans.use: to complete his rental house

loans.name: Fayadh

texts.en:
Fayadh is a 40-year-old married man and a father of three children. His oldest child is 18 years old, and the youngest one is 6 years old. He is an employee with his University certificate with a small salary. 

Fayadh lives with his family in their own house in Mokala City, Yemen. Over time, Fayadh accumulated a good amount of money and built his own house. The building and renovation of the house cost Fayadh a lot of money. 

Now, Fayadh and his family live in that new and stylish house. Unfortunately, that house lacks much furniture and home appliances, and Fayadh doesn't have enough money to purchase those things. For this reason, Fayadh applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a bedroom for his house to make the house more comfortable and suitable for living. 

Fayadh looks forward to purchasing all of the home appliances and furniture for his house so that his oldest son can marry soon.

loans.use: to purchase a bedroom for his house to make the house more comfortable and suitable for living.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stylish ready made women clothes and resale to her customers.

loans.name: Gema De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gema De Los Ángeles: Es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 46 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos: 3 mayores de edad y 2 adolecente que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar láminas de zinc para la mejora del techo de su vivienda de tambo de manera.  Su sueño es tener su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Gema De Los Ángeles is a hard-working woman. She is 46 years old and married. She has 5 children: 3 adults and 2 adolescents who are secondary school students. With the goal of living in a secure and dignified way, she is asking for her third loan in order to buy zinc sheeting to improve the roof of her house on wooden stilts. Her dream is to have a house made of concrete.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel es de la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, trabaja y a la vez estudia, es una persona que se esfuerza por poder ser un profesional excelente.
Está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, con el fin de avanzar en la vida, tener su título universitario y proyectarse a un mejor empleo y crecer cada día más.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene y que podrá cubrir.
texts.en:
Ariel is from the city of Pilar. He lives with his parents, works, and at the same time studies. He is a person who exerts himself in order to be an excellent professional.

He is studying systems analysis with the goal of advancing in life, having his university degree, moving himself towards a better job, and growing more every day.

He is asking for this loan for his graduation expenses, in order to be able to cover this cost that he has and will be able to cover.

loans.use: to pay graduation expenses

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbasi is a sixty-two-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in banana farming as his main source of income and owns rentals as a source of extra income. 

He started his business so as to educate his children and improve his standard of living. He hopes to become a rich man in the future, though he faces a challenge of price fluctuations of agricultural produce.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, mulches, and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, mulches, and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old. She is married with four children aged between 27 and 2 years; one of them goes to school. She has a restaurant and has been running the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more equipment such as plates, chairs, and cups used in her restaurant. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more restaurant equipment such as plates, chairs, and cups used in her restaurant.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is age 30 and married to a motorcycle driver. She is blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business in their village for almost one year, and she earns a net income of 400 PHP daily. Her net income in this business was going in their savings. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. She is hoping that her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: To make a living, Julie has been operating a tailoring business in their village. She earns well from selling garments and she also accepts order and repairs.The business is doing well and she was able to improve it by having more units of sewing machine for three years in operation. Improving her business is her desire for she wants to have a better source of income for the family in the future. She took a new loan recently to buy garments in volume, thread and cover machine repair costs. She fines GDMPC as her partner in improving the general living of her family.

loans.use: to buy garments in volume, thread and cover machine repair costs

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeline is 51-years-old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 28 and 10 years, all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been working in a business for the past 8 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more salt, sugar and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Waspan, tiene 37 años de edad, casad0, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, solicita su tercer financiamiento para comprar láminas de zinc para la mejora del techo de su vivienda de tambo de manera.  Su sueño es tener su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Evelio is a working man, originally from Waspan. He is 37 years old, married, and has four dependent children. In order to live safely and with dignity, he is asking for his third loan to purchase zinc sheets to improve the roof of his home. His dream is to have a concrete home.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as wood, bricks, and cement in order to make repairs and conduct maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Darly Dannette

texts.es: DARLY DANNETTE: Es una mujer emprendedora de 36 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de un 1 hijo, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 10 años estableció su negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Darly Dannette is an enterprising woman. She is 36 years old, originally from Puerto Cabezas, and is the single mother of one son who is in school. With the aim of having her own source of income, she started her business selling new clothes and footwear.

She is asking for her second loan in order to buy merchandise in Managua to sell in Puerto Cabezas at accessible prices. Her dream is to see her business prosper.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: Idalia: Es una mujer amable de 38 años de edad, originaria de Waspam, casada, tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar. Desde hace 7 años habita en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura, solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Idalia is a kind 38-year-old woman. A native of Waspam, she is married and has 4 school-aged children. For 7 years she has lived in a house on wooden stilts. With the goal of living in a more secure way, she is asking for a loan to replace the wood. Her dream is to build a house of concrete.

loans.use: to replace the wood

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. As he says, he is very happy about his two previous Kiva loans, both of which he used for paying his youngest daughter’s tuition fee. Sergey says that he is very proud of his children, since both of them are very clever, educated, and intellectual ladies. Sergey has a specialty of architecture, but since he cannot find some work in his specialty, he works at the Kapan city’s combine as a driver, and on the days free from his work he gives taxi services using his own car. 

His elder daughter already graduated from the institute, and she has a specialty of economist, and his younger daughter still studies at the Polytechnic Institute. 

This time, Sergey’s great desire of having Kiva support is to connect with such a significant event in his family as his elder daughter’s wedding. He is sure that this loan, together with his savings, will help him to organize his daughter’s wedding party nicely and according to their Armenian traditions.

loans.use: to organize his daughter’s wedding party nicely and according to Armenian traditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Yajaira

texts.es: Yajaira: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 30 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo en edad escolar. Desde hace 19 años habita en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura, solicita su primer financiamiento para construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto, comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cementos, hierro, arena. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Yajaira is a kind woman who is a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 30 years old and is a single mother of one school-aged son. For 19 years, she has lived in a house on wooden stilts. With the goal of living in a more secure way, she is asking for her first loan to build her house made of concrete little by little and to buy construction materials: blocks, cement, iron, and sand. Her dream is to finish building her house made of concrete.

loans.use: to build her house made of concrete little by little and to buy construction materials: blocks, cement, iron, and sand

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives with her family in the frontier village of Aygehovit in Tavush region. Marine has pedagogical education, and for many years until now she has been working at the village school as a teacher of Armenian language and literature. Together with her pedagogical occupation, it has been already twenty years that Marine and her husband have been engaged in farming and agriculture. 

On her farm she has two cows, a pig, fifty chickens, and three beehives. From her plot of land, she gathers a perfect and sweet harvest of apples, grapes, figs, and persimmons. Her farm’s honey is also very famous in her village, but unfortunately the quantity of it is not a lot, unlike the number of her customers who want to buy it.

Marine lives with her husband, who works at the municipality, and they have a daughter who helps them in their farming activities. 

Marine asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams, since she wants to buy ten bee families. In this way, she wants both to enlarge her beekeeping activities and have more honey for sale.

loans.use: to buy ten bee families to enlarge her beekeeping activities and have more honey for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame MARIAM est née en février 1975 à SIKASSO, veuve, mère de 4 enfants et réside chez son feu époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à OUAYERMA I, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Madame MARIAM après plusieurs activités sans succès, cette brave femme s’est initié des activités de petit commerce notamment l’achat et de vente des carafes, des bols et articles divers. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre à sa place au grand marché d’où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour leur qualité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont elle est à son troisième prêt individuel commerçant, les prêts précédents ont été correctement rembourser.
Ainsi, elle sollicite un troisième prêt pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 30 carafes de marques différentes (petit et grand),des douzaines de bols et des tasses thermos. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce troisième prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 105 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. MARIAM was born in February 1975 in SIKASSO. A widow and the mother of four children, she resides in her deceased husband’s house with their children in a nuclear family in OUAYERMA I, one of the suburbs of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful businesses, Ms. MARIAM, a good and honest woman, became familiar with small-scale commerce, especially the buying and selling of pitchers, bowls, and various goods. She purchases her merchandise in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) and then resells the goods at her spot in the big market, where they are much in demand by her customers for their quality.

Concerned about satisfying her burgeoning customer base better, she had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her third individual loan for merchants. The previous loans were correctly paid back. 

So, she is requesting a third loan to increase her business capital in order to purchase 30 pitchers of different brands (small and large), dozens of bowls, and some ‘thermos’ tubs. 

With this third loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 105,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan with interest and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as pitchers and bowls

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela: Es una señora alegre y sociable, tiene 64 años de edad, casada, tiene 11 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 9 años estableció una pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: granos básicos, sopa instantánea, jabón de baño, de lavar traste, de lavar ropa, detergentes, cloro, chiverías, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener una ferretería.
texts.en: Estela is a cheerful and sociable woman. She is 64 years old, married, and has 11 adult children. In order to have her own source of income, she has had a shop for 9 years. She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, instant soup, soap, washing detergent, chlorine, "chiverías" soda drinks and other products. Her dream is to own a hardware store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant soup, soap, washing detergent, chlorine, "chiverías" soda drinks and other products.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela: Es una mujer amable y luchadora, tiene 31 años de edad, casada. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 años estableció una pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es diversificar los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Manuela is a courteous and determined woman. She is 31 years old and married. With the intention of having her own source of income, she opened a small neighborhood grocery store six years ago. 

Manuela is requesting financing to buy merchandise. Her dream is to diversify the products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy staple grains and snack foods

loans.name: Anaglen

texts.en:
Anaglen, a 39-year-old farmer from Dulag, Leyte, is a married mother of three children who are still attending school. Anaglen has been in the rice farming business for more than six years now, and she also sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area. 

Unfortunately, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined her business, forcing her to cease operations. She now wishes to start again but lacks the capital to do so. Therefore, Anaglen joined CEVI to request a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional ingredients for her food vending such as flour, sugar, oil and baking soda.

Anaglen hopes to once more make her businesses successful. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she will be able to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and additional ingredients for her food vending such as flour, sugar, oil and baking soda

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es una persona que se está esforzando para ser alguien en la vida, ya que sabe que la única forma de poder crecer es estudiando.
Quiere estudiar y ser un profesional que sea útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por crecer y llegar a su meta.
texts.en:
Jose is a person who is working hard to be someone in life; he knows that the only way to be able to grow is through education. He wants to study and be a professional who can be useful to society and to other people.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his tuition so that he can continue striving to grow and arrive at his goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 39 años, está casada hace más de 10 años, de allí nacieron 4 hijos, por quienes esta pareja está luchando para sacarlos adelante.
La Sra. Fermina y su marido se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y también a la producción de hortalizas como lechuga, tomate, cebolla, repollo y otros. Ella sale a vender sus hortalizas casa por casa. También vende leche y queso de su propia producción. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pudieron construirse para su casa y criar a sus hijos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales, para poder seguir con su producción de leche y queso, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Fermina is from the city of Carapeguá. She is 39 years old and has been married for more than 10 years. From this relationship she has 4 children, and the couple is working hard to help them get ahead in life. 

Fermina and her husband work in agriculture and ranching, and they also produce vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, onions, cabbages and others. She goes out to sell her vegetables from house to house. She also sells milk and cheese from her own production. Thanks to both of their efforts, they have been able to build a house where they can raise their children. 

She is requesting this loan to invest the funds in buying animals, so she can continue with her milk and cheese production. In this way, she will be able to continue her business as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy animals for milk and cheese production.

loans.name: Gisella

texts.es:
Gisella esta cursando el segundo año de la carrera de administración agropecuaria, está en pareja y vive en la ciudad de San Pedro.
Aspira a tener su propia empresa, es por eso que se está esforzando bastante para poder ser alguien en la vida, está estudiando para ser una contadora y por medio de sus estudios poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de estudios, como materiales y fotocopias, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gisella is in her second year of studying Agricultural Administration. She has a partner and lives in the city of San Pedro. She aspires to have her own business. For that reason, she is making a considerable effort to be someone in life. She is studying to be an accountant and to be able to help people as a result of her studies.

She is requesting this loan so she can invest it in her educational expenses, like materials and photocopies, which would be very helpful and will allow her to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for educational expenses such as materials and photocopies.

loans.name: Sonia Yaneth

texts.es: SONIA YANETH: Es una mujer trabajadora, originario de Waspam, tiene 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Dese hace 4 años habita en casa de familiares, con el objetivo de construir su propia vivienda de concreto, solicita financiamiento para comprar material de construcción: bloques, hierro, cemento, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda de concreto y vivir de  manera segura y digna.
texts.en: Sonia Yaneth is a working woman, originally from Waspám. She is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children of school age. She has lived in her family home for 4 years and in order to build their own house, she is requesting a loan to purchase building materials: bricks, iron, cement, wood, and also to cover labor costs. Her dream is to finish building a concrete home and to live in a safe and dignified manner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials: bricks, iron, cement, wood, and also to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Santa Librada es un grupo que se formo en la ciudad de Encarnación, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada miembro, y conforme a ello poder ir superando los obstáculos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Vicenta quien en su primera encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la peluquería que tiene y que con sacrificio pudo montar. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre acude a ella para sus servicios.
La Sra. Vicenta solicita de este préstamo para la compra de mas insumos  en general para su trabajo, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Santa Librada is a group that was formed in the city of Encarnación. It participates in the poverty elimination program, which will help them understand the circumstances of each member, and based on this, they can work on overcoming the obstacles they face. 

One of the members is Vicenta, who in her first survey showed a poverty level within level three. This means that she was able to advance through her hard work and continuous effort and sacrifice, thanks to the hair salon she operates. She reports that she has good customers who always come to her for her services. 

Vicenta is requesting this loan to buy more supplies in general for her work, such as hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams and other items, so that she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies such as hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams, etc.

loans.name: Iliana Ines

texts.es: ILIANA INES: Es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 2 hijos en edad escolar. Con grandes esfuerzos desde hace 10 años estableció su negocio de repuesto de máquinas, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar: artesanías, motores banda cuero, motores de banda de presión, bujías. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Iliana Ines is a sociable and hardworking woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother of two school-age children. With great efforts, she established her own business 10 years ago selling machine parts in order to have her own source of income. She is requesting her first loan to buy handicraft products, leather band engines, pressure band engines and spark plugs. Her dream is to have a thriving business.

loans.use: to buy handicraft products, leather band engines, pressure band engines and spark plugs.

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Kuña mbarete, que quiere decir mujer fuerte, ya que eso es lo que son, mujeres fuertes que están esforzándose por sus familias y demás seres queridos.
Alguien digno de destacar es la Sra. Rosana, quien desde tempranas horas del día empieza a trabajar, ya que se levanta a hacer las comidas que ella misma luego sale a vender.
Rossana es una mujer muy luchadora, que quiere dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, como ser verduras, carne, hortalizas, condimentos y demás. Todas ellas están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo que les permitirá seguir con el trabajo de cada una.
texts.en:
This group is named Kuña Mbarete, which means "strong woman", because that is what the members are, strong women who are working hard for their families and other loved ones.

Someone particularly worth mentioning is Mrs. Rosana, who begins working in the early hours of the morning when she wakes up to prepare the food that she later goes out to sell.

Rosana is a very determined woman, who wants to give her loved ones a dignified life without hardships.

She is requesting this loan so she can invest it in the purchase of various supplies such as vegetables, meat, condiments and other things she needs to be able to continue making the food she sells. All of the women are grateful for the opportunity that they are receiving which will allow them to continue their own work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other things.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza está estudiando actualmente la carrera de contabilidad y auditoría, con la intención de obtener la Licenciatura de modo a ejercer la profesión en forma independiente. 
Está viviendo con sus padres, trabaja en un Estudio Contable a la par que estudia. Su aspiración es la de progresar y ser un apoyo para su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Liza is currently studying accounting and auditing, with the intention of obtaining a Bachelor degree to be able to work independently. 
She lives with her parents and works at an accounting firm, which helps with what she is studying. Her aspiration is to progress and be a support to her family. 
She is asking for this loan to pay for her graduation expenses. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old. She is married with four children aged between 18 and 3 years; three of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been selling in a business for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more skirts, shorts, and dresses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more skirts, shorts, and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 64 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. У Айнагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 37 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Айнагул, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок и 2 бычка. Также в сезон Айнагул занимается полеводством на собственном земельном наделе мерою 5,20 ГА. Айнагул выращивает клевер и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль Айнагул составляет около 6,000 сом (KGS), этого катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Айнагул и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) в целях развития своей животноводческой деятельности, а именно для покупки бычков и коровы, часть средств Айнагул планирует потратить на сбор урожая. Скот Айнагул намерена перепродавать на местном скотном рынке, доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, что приведет к получению большей прибыли и улучшению условий жизни.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 64 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. Ainagul has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding for a period of 37 years. Thanks to Ainagul's purposefulness and hard work, she currently has two dairy cows, one calf and two bulls on her farm. During the season Ainagul also works with field crop cultivation on her own plot of land of 5.20 hectares. 

Ainagul grows clover and sweet cord. Ainagul's monthly income is around 6,000 som (KGS). This is unfortunately not enough to cover living costs. Therefore Ainagul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) with an aim to develop her livestock breeding business, specifically to purchase bulls and cows. Ainagul also plans to use part of the money on harvesting her crops. 

Ainagul intends to resell the cattle at the local livestock market. She will direct the income from the loan to further increasing the number of livestock, which leads to a larger income and improved living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase bulls for fattening and reselling and cows for increasing the volume of milk to sell, and to harvest crops

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos varones de 19, 16, 14 años y dos hijas mujeres de 26 y 24 y su negocio es el comercio de ganado ovino.
Él es trabajador, emprendedor, responsable, paciente y buen padre. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad de batallas que se encuentra cercano al lago sagrado Titicaca, a una altura aproximada de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, el clima del lugar es frío y los rayos solares son muy fuertes.
Felix es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara, y conoce el español por motivos de comercio. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado ovino (ovejas) él se dedica a la cría de ovejas, engordándolas y ocupándose de sus vacunas y comida, le ayuda su pareja y algunas veces sus hijos porque estudian en la escuela y no tiene mucho tiempo. Sus problemas son la falta de pasto en el mes de agosto debido a la temporada seca. Su casa cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y su sueño es tener tierras donde realizar su trabajo. Él desea realizar la compra de ganado ovino por mayor para mejorar su capital de trabajo.
Es por esos motivos que Felix solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado por mayor y mejorar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Felix is a 48-year-old man. He lives with his partner and has three sons of 19, 16, and 14 years of age and two daughters of 26 and 24 years of age. His business is the trade of sheep. He is hardworking, enterprising, responsible, patient, and a good father. 

He carries out his work in the community of Batallas that is found near the sacred lake Titicaca, at an altitude of approximately 4,000 meters above sea level. The climate is cold and the sun’s rays are very strong. Felix is of dark complexion, short black hair, medium stature, and his mother tongue is Aymara and he knows Spanish for business reasons. 

His business is the trade of livestock (sheep). He works in the raising of sheep, fattening them and taking care of their vaccines and food. His partner helps him and sometimes his children because they study in school and do not have a lot of time. 

His problems are the lack of grass in the month of August due to the dry season. His home has all of the basic services and his dream is to have land where he can carry out his work. He wishes to accomplish the purchase of wholesale sheep in order to improve his working capital. It is for those reasons that Felix requests a loan to buy wholesale livestock and to improve his working capital.

loans.use: to buy wholesale livestock and improve his working capital.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Dulag, Leyte. She is engaged in a farming business. She grows rice and vegetables on her farm. She also raises pigs as a supplemental source of income.

Delia is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. Through this, Delia will be able to improve her farming as well as her hog raising business. 

In the future, Delia dreams of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó su esposa es ama de casa y elabora petates los cuales comercializa. Actualmente tienen 4 hijos, estudiando están solo tres que también en ocasiones trabajan en la agricultura.
Él es empleado como agente se seguridad nacional trabajo que ha realizado por más de 4 años y  trabaja en la agricultura pues solo su empleo no le alcanza para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar, trabajo que también ha realizado por más de 10 años.  Él trabaja en las dos actividades fuertemente buscando un desarrollo económico familiar, sus hijos y su esposa lo apoyan fuertemente.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar mil tejas para reparar el techo de su vivienda, pues algunas tejas están dañadas y es necesario cambiarlas evitar que se mojen las cosas que tiene dentro de su hogar y así tener una vivienda mejor sin estar con preocupaciones por las lluvias y que aun estando dentro de su casa estarán expuestos a mojarse por las inclemencias del tiempo lluvioso.
Desea poder seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia  y que sus hijos puedan estudiar para que tengan un mejor futuro y con la ayuda de este préstamo lograra cubrir esta gran necesidad que tiene de reparar su vivienda y así vivirán más seguros y tranquilos.
texts.en:
Pedro is 38 years old and studied until Grade 6. He is married. His spouse is a housewife and also makes mats to sell. They have four children. Three of them are studying and sometimes help with the agricultural work. He is employed as a National security guard, work he has done for more than four years. He also works in agriculture as with only his job he doesn't have enough to satisfy the needs of the household. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. He does both jobs working strongly for the economic development of his family. His children and wife support him greatly.

The loan is needed to buy one thousand tiles to repair the roof of his house. Some tiles are damaged and need to be replaced so as to not soak the things they have inside their house and to have a better home. They won't have to worry about the rain and even inside the house being exposed to getting wet during the inclemency of the rainy season.

Pedro wants to continue to work to get his family ahead so that his children can study to have a better future. With the help of this loan he can pay for this great necessity of repairing his house and live safer and more at ease.

loans.use: to buy a thousand tiles to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a married woman and the mother of seven children. She is from Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari or variety store, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. This business has provided Aurora an income for more than ten years now.

Aurora is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking ingredients and seasonings. With this purchase, she can augment her stock and cater to the needs of her customers and buyers. In the future, Aurora hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 42 años de edad,  es una persona dedicada a la agricultura; él no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos suficientes para darle el estudio, él desde pequeño se dedicó a la agricultura.
 Actualmente es padre de familia de una joven de catorce años de  edad.  En el transcurso de su vida se ha dedicado a otra actividad la cual es la fontanería, trabaja prácticamente todos los días, se desplaza todos los días a su trabajo en su motocicleta.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, pesticidas y herbicidas para su cultivo de maíz.
Sus  sueños a futuro es que su hija pueda estudiar y sea una profesional de éxito que ella pueda tener lo que él no puedo tener en su vida, por los pocos escasos recursos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and works in agriculture. He could not study as his parents did not have sufficient economic resources to pay for his studies. He has worked in agriculture since he was small. Now he is the father of a family. He has a 14 year old daughter. In the course of his life he has worked at another trade which is plumbing. He works almost every day and gets to work on his motorcycle.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides and herbicides for his corn crops. His dreams for the future are that his daughter can study and become a successful professional. He also hopes that she can have all that he could not have in life, due to the lack of financial resources of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides and herbicides for his corn crops.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is 37 years old and he lives in the frontier village of Aygehovit of Tavush region. He is the father of 4 children (3 daughters and a son) and moreover he is the only one who must take care of them, since his wife died a year ago. Now Vahagn just does his best to manage to be both father and mother to his children, although as he says he fails every day, since for a child his mother is irreplaceable, even by his father. So now Vahagn has a big and very rich farm which helps him to earn to cover his family's big living expenses. On his farm he has 32 cows, 2 bulls, a pig and 12 piglets and also a great plot of land. Thanks to the great number of cattle on his farm, he sells a lot of milk mainly to dairy-products production factories, and also meat to city butchers. The harvest of his land mainly services his family needs (cucumber, tomato, potato, greens and pepper). Vahagn says that this great farm was established by his father and he inherited it from him.
Vahagn will be grateful and sincerely thankful if Kiva lenders help him to have this loan in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams which he will use for the purchase of a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle to get ready for the coming cold months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle to get ready for the coming cold months

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is 36 years old. He is not married, and he lives in Ijevan city in Tavush region with his parents and his brother’s family. He has no higher education, but with the help of his brother, it has been already six years that he has managed his small business. 

In the yard of his house, he produces concrete structures. He works mainly to order. Manvel and his brother also sell his products to the local stores for construction materials. He and his brother together perfectly provide their family with good living conditions. 

Now Manvel needs this loan in order to buy raw materials for his business of concrete structures production. In the future, Manvel also hopes to buy a truck for transferring his products, which his brother now does using his car.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his business of concrete structures production.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José de 37 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, solamente estudio hasta segundo grado  debido a que en esa época da inicio la guerra civil, por lo que no pudo seguir estudiando.  Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijas, una de ellas estudia segundo grado, su esposa solamente se dedica a cuidar  de sus hijas.
Él siempre se ha dedicada a la agricultura y crianza de ganadado desde hace mas de 20 años, ya que su padre se dedicaba también a esta actividad  y se lo enseño en el transcurso de los años, trabaja todos los días en el campo.
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  dos  novillas, con las que pretende  mejorar la calidad de vida  de él y de su familia, trabajando fuertemente , él quiere ampliar su actividad ya que entre más animales logre comprar mejores beneficios obtendrá.  Con respecto a sus sueños es lograr que sus hijas estudien.
texts.en:
José, who is 37 years old, is a very hard working man. He only studied until the second grade since at that time the civil war began, and for that reason he was unable to continue studying. Currently he makes a living in agriculture. He has two daughters, one of whom is in the second grade. His wife dedicates all of her time to caring for the children.

José has always made a living in agriculture and cattle-raising for more than twenty years, since his father also made a living at this activity and taught it to him over the years. He works in the fields every day.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy two heifers, with which he aims to improve his own and his family's quality of life. By working hard, he would like to increase his activity given that the more animals he manages to buy, the more profits he will earn. Regarding his dreams, his main one is that his daughters go to school.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, with which he aims to improve his own and his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 38 years old. She is married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children of 16 and 7 years respectively. Her spouse is employed, hence provides additional income for her family.

Elsa runs a food store, a business she has done for the last 6 years earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. She has requested a loan of KES 60,000 which she will use to purchase/add stock of foodstuff like tomatoes, potatoes and meat to prepare meals.

With the anticipated profits, Elsa will be able to add more stock and hence expand her business even further. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya  after successfully repaying her previous loans.

Elsa's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stabilized business.

loans.use: to add stock of foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Joaquín Humberto

texts.es:
Joaquín de 38 años de edad, estudio solamente 3º grado de primaria, ya que se le hacia muy difícil estudiar y trabajar, tanto por la distancia de la escuela y el nivel económico que tenían sus padres por eso tenia que trabajar en la agricultura para llevar el sustento diario a su casa, luego viajo a los EEUU en donde tuvo la oportunidad de superarse un poco. Luego tuvo que regresar a cuidar a su madre que es de avanzada edad y necesita un cuido especial. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abonos y preparar la tierra para la siembra de pipián y la compra de venenos. Él sueña con tener una familia para entregarles su tiempo y amor.
texts.en: Joaquin is 38 years old and has only a 3rd grade education because it was very difficult for him to study and work due to both the school's distance and his parents' economic status. That's why he had to work in agriculture to put food on his household's table. Then he traveled to the U.S where he had the opportunity to progress a bit financially. Afterward he had to return to take care of his mother because she's elderly and needs special care. He's requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer and prepare the soil for squash planting and to purchase pesticides. His dream is to have a family so that he can devote his time and love to them.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and prepare the soil for planting squash and purchase pesticides

loans.name: Kalifa

texts.fr:
Monsieur KALIFA est né vers 1954 à ZERLABA, marié, père de 9 enfants et résidant chez lui-même avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à ZERLABA un village tout près dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès monsieur KALIFA s’est initié des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales (maïs, mil), il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de ZERLABA.
Il est à son neuvième prêt  individuel commerçant avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, 18 sacs de 100 kg de mil pour la revendre en détail à ZERLABA à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. KALIFA was born around 1954 in ZERLABA. He is married and a father of nine. He lives with his wife and children, in a traditional family, in his own house in ZERLABA. It is a village located close to the city of SISSAKO, third administrative region of MALI.
After several unsuccessful ventures, Mr. KALIFA started a business trading grain (maize, millet). He buys his stock from villages around ZERLABA.
This is his ninth individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of his growing customer base. All previous loans have been successfully paid back.
This loan will allow him to buy 20 100-kg sacks of maize and 18 100-kg sacks of millet, which he will retail in ZERLABA to both men and women, cash or on credit.
He expects to make a monthly profit of 120.000FCFA. This profit will enable him to pay off his loan and its interests, and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grain (maize, millet)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 57-year-old man. He is married to Teresiah, who adds additional income to their family. They have been blessed with five children. Joseph has been a farmer for six years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Joseph was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbour. He is now servicing his first loan of KES 28,000. He intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings, to use in his farm plantation.

Joseph plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a water storage tank and hopes to become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
