Monsieur YACOUBA est né vers 1975 à SEGOU -DIGANI, marié, père de 8 enfants et résidant chez lui-même avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à FACHORIBOUGOU DE  KABOILA un village tout près dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès monsieur YACOUBA s’est initié des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales (maïs, mil), il s’approvisionne à LOULOUNI, à GNEGANSSOBA et dans les villages environnants dans le village de FACHORIBOUGOU.
Il est à son septième prêt  individuel commerçant avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, 18 sacs de 100 kg de mil pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. YACOUBA was born around 1975 in SEGOU - DIGANI. He is married and a father of eight. He lives with his wife and children, in a traditional family, in his own house in FACHORIBOUGOU DE KABOILA. It is a village located close to the city of SISSAKO, third administrative region of The Republic of Mali.
After several unsuccessful ventures, Mr. YACOUBA started a business trading grin (maize, millet). He buys his stock in LOULOUNI, GNEGANSSOBA, and in villages around FACHORIBOUGOU.
This is his seventh individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of his growing custmore base. All previous loans have been successfully paid back.
This loan will allow him to buy 20 100-kg sacks of maize and 18 100-kg sacks of millet, which he will retail at the market to both men and women, cash or on credit.
He expects to make a monthly profit of 120.000FCFA. This profit will enable him to pay off his loan and its interests, and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grain (maize, millet)

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado; tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad y cada uno con su familia, su compañera de vida realiza los oficios domésticos, vive con ellos un hijo que le ayuda en el taller a elaborar machetes, cumas, entre otros.

Efraín tiene experiencia de 15 años como encargado de administrar una hacienda, se dedicó a dicho trabajo pues el papá estaba un poco enfermo y él tubo que venirse de la capital donde estaba a buscar trabajo cerca de su padre para estar pendiente de él.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres cerdos, concentrado, una vaquilla para en poco tiempo poder tener leche en casa.  El crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así tener un mejor nivel de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Efraín is 53 years old and studied through the fourth grade. He has three children, all of whom are adults who each have their own family. His life partner takes care of the domestic tasks. One son who lives with them helps him in the workshop making machetes and cumas (curved knives), among other things.

Efraín has fifteen years of experience as the person responsible for managing a farm. He started that work because his father was a little sick and he needed to return from the capital to look for work closer to his father in order to look after him.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy three pigs, animal feed, and a heifer, in order to soon be able to have milk in the house. The loan will help improve his economic income and therefore he will have a better standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to buy three pigs, animal feed and a heifer so that in a short time he will be able to have milk in the house.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado de estudio, pues sus padres no pudieron darle sus estudios hasta el final. Está casado y padre de dos hijos a los cuales ama con todo su corazón, su señora realiza los oficios domésticos sus dos hijos están estudiando, el mayor esta realizando su último año de bachillerato y el segundo esta en séptimo grado. 

El oficio de albañil lo aprendió desde que tenía 19 años de edad, antes prestaba servicios militares; luego decidió realizar el trabajo de la albañilería, él no tiene un lugar de trabajo fijo, a veces viajaba a otras zonas del país construyendo viviendas.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar arena, cemento, hierro y la compra de una puerta y dos ventanas para su hogar, este crédito le ayudara a él y a su familia a vivir de una manera más segura y con mejor tranquilidad.

El sueño de él es que Dios le de vida para ver a sus hijos siendo unos profesionales y puedan valerse por sí mismos, seguir ayudándole a su familia como hasta ahora y que sus hijos sean en un futuro personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 50 years old and has a 3rd grade education since his parents weren't able to provide further schooling. He's married and is the father of two sons that he loves with all his heart. His wife is a homemaker and his two sons are students. The older son is in the last year of high school and the younger son is in 7th grade.

He learned the trade of masonry when he was 19 years old. Previously he was providing military services. Then he decided to get into masonry, and he doesn't have a permanent workplace but rather travels to other areas to build houses.

The loan he's requesting is to purchase sand, cement, iron, and a door and two windows for his home. This loan will help he and his family live with more security and peace of mind.

His dream is that God will grant him a long enough life to see his children become professionals and self-sufficient, to continue helping his family like he has up until now,  and that his children become productive members of society.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, iron and a door and two windows for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of sewing materials such as new and stylish fabrics, thread, zippers, buttons and other sewing materials

loans.name: Al- Motfaela Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Motfaela. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Hodeidah, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 
Samira is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. Her oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. She is the leader of the group. Samira lives with her family in their own house. She has a diploma certificate in the computer sciences. Due to high rates of unemployment in the country, Samira couldn't find a job to help her husband with the family expenses. Now, she works as a housewife. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Samira and her family live in an old house. It needs a renovation but her husband's income is not enough to make that renovation. Samira wants to help her husband in that responsibility. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that.Therefore, Samira is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials in order to renovate her house from the inside.

Samira looks forward to renovating all her house from the inside to make the house more suitable for living.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials  in order to renovate her house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of paint to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Allakabo vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Ségou coura de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains et de fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  17eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mata (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains mil dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains de mil à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Allakabo group is composed of four women, who all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 46 and have five children. They all live in Ségou coura, a neighborhood in Ségou (4th administrative region of The Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbors, relatives, and their income-generating activities around the neighborhood. They sell grain, as well as fruits and vegetables. In order to increase their business, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their 17th solidarity loan.
Mrs. Mata (the woman standing on the left hand side of the picture) has a great reputation in the neighborhood and around, as a trader of millet. She plans on using her loan to buy two sacks of millet in Ségou. She resells it at the market, cash and often on credit, to various customers.
With this loan, Mrs. Mata hopes to make a monthly profit of 15 000 FCFA, which will be used to cover small expenses for her children, as well as to increase her business. She wishes to keep collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy millet

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This charming lady from Vanadzor city of Lori region just ended her first Kiva loan, and she hurries to have the second one. Flora used her first loan to purchase a new collection of infant's covers and bedding. Now she wants to enlarge her business with the help of a Kiva loan. At the city’s rented stall, she sells a very nice assortment of baby clothes, bedding and covers, towels, toys and shoes. For all this she has great number of loyal customers, whom she is always happy and ready to help with choices among the great variety. 

Flora is married, and she has a son who is a student already. Her husband helps Flora in her business, especially in the process of bringing new products for her stall  from Yerevan city. 

Flora asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy children's autumn season jackets, and also bed coverings for kids.

loans.use: to buy children's autumn season jackets, and also bed coverings for kids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different merchandise for his store, such as new and stylish shoes, handbags, and accessories

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 30 years old. She is married with three children aged between 9 and 4 years old; all of them go to school. She has a bar and has been working in the business for the past three years.  

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda for sale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 26 years old. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 2 years, who do not yet go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been running a business for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de condiment et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kadiatou (la 3eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Kadiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of eight women, who all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 32 and have two children. They all live in Médine, a neighborhood in Ségou (4th administrative region of The Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbors, relatives, and their income-generating activities around the neighborhood. They are into retail (condiments, clothing) as well as catering. In order to increase their business, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their 2nd solidarity loan.
Mrs. Kadiatou (the woman standing, third from the right) has a great reputation in the neighborhood and around, as a seller of African wax print fabric. She plans on using her loan to buy eight units of fabric in Ségou. She resells them at the market, cash and often on credit, to various customers.
With this loan, Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to make a monthly profit of 30 000 FCFA, which will be used to cover small expenses for her children, as well as to increase her business. She wishes to keep collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy African wax print fabric.

loans.name: Wenefredo

texts.en:
Wenefredo is a 49-year-old, married man, and a father of five children, from Dulag, Leyte. He earns a living through his poultry- and hog-raising business.

Wenefredo is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for the chickens and pigs. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his business as well as his income. He wants to save more money, so that he can support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed for the chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Sebougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Ahi (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 paquet de Maggi 1 sac de sel et  1 panier d’oignon à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Ahi espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 10 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of four women, who all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 37 and have five children. They all live in Sebougou, a neighborhood in Ségou (4th administrative region of The Republic of Mali).
They met through neighbors, relatives, and their income-generating activities around the neighborhood. They are into retail (condiments, clothing) as well as catering. In order to increase their business, they have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso; this is their 1st solidarity loan.
Mrs. Ahi (the woman standing, second from the right) has a great reputation in the neighborhood and around, as a seller of condiments. She plans on using her loan to buy one pack of Maggi (bouillon cubes), one bag of salt, and one basketful of onions in Ségou. She resells them at the market, cash and often on credit, to various customers.
With this loan, Mrs. Ahi hopes to make a monthly profit of 10 000 FCFA, which will be used to cover small expenses for her children, as well as to increase her business. She wishes to keep collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic wants to finish his studies and to have a stable job in the future. He is single and a son of a farmer, who settled for living in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. He has two siblings. Dominic studied in the university to take Deck Watch Keeping. He joined Gata Daku MPC and has borrowed a loan to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester. He is thankful to the cooperative, for providing him an opportunity to continue studying despite his financial difficulties. .

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles and electronics, for his house construction and to sell.

loans.name: José Salomón

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria en la escuela, debido a que su padre realizaba trabajos en el campo y tenía que ayudarle, entonces no pudo continuar estudiando.

José está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen cuatro hijos de las edades de 17, 14, 13, y 9 años los cuales estudian en la escuela.

José se dedica a la agricultura en pequeño, comenta que su padre le enseño este trabajo debido a que cuando era pequeño su padre se lo llevaba para que le ayudara y obtuvo experiencia y es así como él hoy puede trabajar sin dificultad para mantener a su familia, José dice que no tiene horario de trabajo debido a que siempre tiene que estar pendiente de sus siembras y junto a sus hijos en los tiempos libres le ayudan a realizar los trabajos en los cultivos.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono, fertilizante preparación de la tierra y pago de mano de obra, para sembrar frijol. Gracias a esto poder tener sus cultivos libres de plagas y así poder obtener buenas y mejores cosechas, también para poder hacerle algunos arreglos a su casa comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
José planea para un futuro poder tener mejores cosechas, para recibir más ingresos económicos debido a la venta de su cosecha, también desea poder ampliar su casa construir habitaciones  para que su familia pueda vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Jose is 59 years old and has a third grade education, since he had to help his father with farmwork and was unable to continue studying.

Jose is in a relationship, and his wife is a homemaker. They have four children ages 9, 13, 14, and 17 who are going to school.

Jose is a small-scale farmer, and he says his father taught him this line of work because when he was a child his father took him along so he could help. That's how he acquired experience and that's how he's able today to perform this job smoothly and support his family. Jose says he doesn't have a fixed work schedule because he always has to keep an eye on his crops, and his kids help him do farmwork in their free time. 

The loan he's requesting is to purchase fertilizer, soil amendment and pay for labor to plant beans. Thanks to this he'll have pest-free crops and be able to obtain good, more abundant harvests. He also will purchase construction materials and pay for labor to do some home improvements 

Jose plans to have better harvests in the future, so he can receive more income from selling his crops. He also wants to expand his house by building rooms so his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, soil amendment and pay for labor to plant beans.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, pues sus condiciones no le permitieron seguir estudiando. él está acompañado y padre de un hijo de 1 año de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa y cuidar de su hijo, recientemente acaban de terminar su casa.

José se dedica a trabajar en una ferretería de materiales de construcción con el cargo de despachador, él trabaja desde hace 1 año gracias a un amigo que lo recomendó para que pudiera trabajar, pues comenta que es una actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos. José también se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño su padre le enseño este trabajo,  a sembrar hortalizas comenta que tiene varios cultivos de tomate, chile y huisquil, estos trabajos los realiza después que sale del trabajo y mayormente en los fines de semana, pues dice que tiene una buena producción y que requiere tiempo y mucho trabajo por eso él aparta tiempo para los cultivos, y su jornada empieza tempranito para salir a su trabajo a una distancia aproximadamente 10 kilómetros abordando el autobús de su casa a la ferretería, mientras que los cultivos los tiene cerca de su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra,  preparación de la tierra, entre otros, para sembrar tomate.  Gracias al préstamo tendrá mejores cultivos sanos y controlados y obtener una mayor producción y mayores ingresos para su familia.

Desea para el futuro tener un sistema de invernadero que no cuenta por el momento, y dice que con ese sistema tendrá mayores cultivos, también tener un mejor empleo que pueda ganar más dinero, mejorar su casa ya que todavía le falta para terminarla, todo esto dice que lo lograra con las ganancias de la producción y también con futuros créditos que solicitara.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old, and he attended school up to ninth grade, since his situation did not permit him to continue studying. He has a common-law wife and is the father of a 1-year-old child. His wife dedicates herself to the household chores and takes care of their child. They recently finished building their house. 

José dedicates himself to working in a hardware store which sells construction materials. His position there is dispatcher. He has worked there for one year, thanks to a friend who recommended him so that he could work. He comments that it is an activity which generates a good income for him. José has also worked in agriculture since he was a boy; his father taught him how to do this work. He grows vegetables, and he reports that he has various crops such as tomatoes, chili peppers and chayote. He takes care of them after he gets off work, and mainly on the weekends. He says that he has a good level of production, and it requires time and a lot of work. Because of this, he sets aside time for his crops, and his workday begins very early when he leaves for his job, about 10 kilometers away, riding the bus from his house to the hardware store. The crops are located close to his home. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizers and compost, and to pay for labor, among other things, to prepare the soil in order to plant tomatoes. Thanks to the loan, he will have better crops which are healthier and better controlled, and he will obtain a better harvest and more income for his family. 

In the future, he would like to have a greenhouse system, which he does not currently have, and he says with this system he will have better crops. He would also like to have a better job where he can earn more money, and improve his home, since there are some more things to be done to complete it. He says that he will achieve all of this with the earnings from his production and the help of future loans which he will request.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost and pay for labor, among other things, to prepare the soil to plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Jose Marvin

texts.es:
José, se mantiene trabajando en la agricultura, crianza de ganado y cerdos, se ha decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerdos, alambre y madera, para aumentar la porqueriza y construir un nuevo corral, con esta inversión tendrá una continuidad en su progreso y sus clientes estarán satisfechos.
Marvin comenta que el préstamo anterior le fue de mucha utilidad para mejorar su negocio y mantener su fuente de ingresos activa, ofrece a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y alimentación, además ha logrado tener puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Jose makes a living by working in agriculture, and raising cattle and pigs. He has decided to apply for a new loan to purchase pigs, wire, and wood to expand the pigpen and build a new corral. With this investment his progress will maintain its trajectory and his customers will be satisfied. Marvin states that the previous loan was very useful to him in improving his business and keeps alive his source of income which provides his family with better nutrition and clothing. Additionally he has been able to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, wire, and wood to expand the pigpen and build a new corral.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente de 46 años de edad, es un pequeño comerciante de mariscos quien vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos. Su nivel académico es de 2º grado de educación básica; debido al problema económico que su familia pasaba por tal razón no pudo seguir estudiando.

Desde muy pequeño se involucro en el negocio de compra y venta de mariscos, junto con el apoyo de su esposa y su hijo mayor. Hoy en día  Vicente decidió también vender pescado, él comenta que es un producto que es muy fácil de vender; ademas de eso es muy factible para él, pues vive cerca de la zona costera. Él tiene otro oficio que le genera muy buenas ganancias, la siembra de maíz una parte la vende y la otra es para el consumo familiar.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar, camarones, ostras, conchas, pescado, para venderlo.  Al tener producto que comercializar sus ingresos incrementaran y su capacidad de pago sera mucho mas fácil.

 A Futuro Vicente tiene como meta mejorar la vivienda (piso y techo)y ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Para un mejor futuro!
texts.en:
Vicente, 46, is a small merchant of shellfish. He lives with his wife and three children. He attended school until 2nd grade, but due to financial difficulties in his family he was not able to continue studying. Since he was very little he has been involved in the business of buying and selling shellfish. His wife and oldest son help him out.

Vicente has now decided to also sell fish, because he says that it is a very easy product to sell, as well as being very easy for him since he lives close to the coast. He has another job that generates good income - planting corn, part of which he sells and part of which he keeps for his family's consumption.

He asks for a loan to buy shrimp, oysters, conch and fish to resell. Having more product to sell will increase his income and make it easier for him to pay. In the future, Vicente's goal is to improve the floor and roof of his home in order to give his family better living conditions and a better future.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, oysters, conch and fish to sell.

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dina de 36 años de edad,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar mas que primer grado, ya que en su familia solo eran mujeres y su papá las tenia que llevar a trabajar al campo por el nivel de pobreza que había en su familia. 

Ella esta acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y son padres de 3 hijos. 
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono para la milpa que ya esta nacida y no cuenta con los recursos para poder comprar este insumo. 

El préstamo lo utilizara también para el pago de mano de obra para preparar la tierra para sembrar fríjol. A ella le gustaría que sus hijos estudiaran, pero si no les gusta o no quieren estudiar, que el hijo que tiene sea albañil y que las niñas también aprendan un oficio.
texts.en:
Dina, 36 years old, did not have the opportunity to study past the first grade, since in her family they were only women and her father had to take them to work in the field due to the level of poverty there was in her family.

She is married and her husband works in agriculture and they are parents of three children. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of manure for the field that is already sprouted and she does not have the resources to be able to buy this supply.

She will also use the loan for the payment of labor to prepare the land for planting beans. She would like her children to study, but if they do not like it or do not want to study, she hopes her son becomes a builder and that the girls also learn a trade.

loans.use: to buy manure for the field that is already sprouted and for the payment of labor to prepare the land for planting beans.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
Guadalupe de 48 años de edad, es un hombre de trabajo quien trata con entusiasmo de salir adelante junto a su familia. 
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde muy niño, ya que siempre colaboraba a su padre con las siembras para poder obtener cosechas que eran y son el sustento de su familia.   siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo y  en cierta época también cosecha ayote para vender en la época de octubre, fruto que se utiliza para hacer conserva de calabaza y las semillas de este para hacer el conocido alguashte.

Hoy en día estos productos agrícolas están valorados con un precio alto en el mercado, por eso Guadalupe prefiere trabajar con esfuerzo día con día, para que el alimento no falte en su hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar algunos insumos agrícolas que le hacen falta para sembrar maicillo como: semilla, herbicidas, abono. Ademas esta sacando el frijol fresco y tiene que pagarle a las personas que le colaboran en la milpa.
Guadalupe se siente feliz de que Credicampo le extiende ayuda financiera, para sacar sus cultivos adelante y él desea que siempre se le siga apoyando.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 48 years old, is a man of work who tries with enthusiasm to get ahead together with his family. He has worked in agriculture since he was a very young boy, as he always used to work with his father with the planting in order to obtain harvests that were and are the sustenance of his family. 

He plants basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum and in certain periods he also harvests pumpkin to sell in the period of October, a fruit that is used to make pumpkin preserves and the seeds to make the known alguashte (a typical seasoning).

Today these agricultural products are valued at a high price in the market. For this reason, Guadalupe prefers to work with effort day after day so that food does not lack in his home.

He needs the loan to buy some agricultural supplies that he lacks to plant sorghum like: seed, herbicide, and manure. He is also harvesting fresh beans and needs to pay the people who work with him in the field. Guadalupe feels happy that Credicampo is extending him financial help to get his crops ahead and he wishes that they always continue supporting him.

loans.use: to buy seed, herbicide, and manure to plant sorghum and to pay the people who work with him in the field.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 26-year-old married man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a taxi driver, and that's his source of income. Richard's major challenge is driving long distances. He has hopes of owning a car. Richard is accessing credit to buy a car for use in a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a car for use in a transportation business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children from Dulag, Leyte. Merlinda is engaged in a farming business. She also operates a small sari-sari store. Unfortunately, Merlinda had to stop after typhoon Haiyan destroyed her business. As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, cooking ingredients and seasonings. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store. Merlinda hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Vilma Yaneth

texts.es:
Vilma de 21 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta el cuarto grado de primaria en la escuela debido a que tenía que ayudar a su mamá en los quehaceres de su casa; porque ella trabajaba y fue así que no pudo continuar sus estudios.

Vilma está acompañada su esposo es agricultor en pequeño no tienen hijos.


Vilma se dedica a los oficios domésticos, comenta que desde que era pequeña se dedica a este oficio debido a que tenía que ayudar a su madre porque ella trabajaba en otras casas ayudando con los oficios del hogar, cuenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda, porque ahora ella tiene su propio hogar y puede atender a su familia sin dificultad alguna, ella realiza su trabajo en su casa no tiene horario porque siempre tiene que estar pendiente de todo los quehaceres de su casa. 

Vilma utilizará el préstamo para que su esposo siembre frijoles comprara semilla, herbicidas y pesticidas. Debido a la situación económica, porque solo no puede realizar sus cultivos y gracias al otorgamiento del crédito podrá hacer su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos gracias a las cosechas y poder vender el frijol y obtener ganancias, también lo utilizara para poder arreglar su casa y poder ampliarla tener más espacio para estar más cómodamente.

Vilma planea para un futuro poder tener un terreno más amplio donde poder hacer sus siembras y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos, también desea poder construir su propia casa debido a que la que tienen no es propia y así para cuando tengan un hijo ellos poder brindarles un lugar amplio y seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 21, only attended school through the fourth grade because she had to go and help her mother with household chores. Her mother had to be working, and so Vilma couldn't continue her studies.  Vilma's husband is a small-time farmer, and they do not have children.

Vilma's primary work is taking care of the home. She's been doing it ever since she was little and helping her mother, while her mother worked in other people's homes. She said that experience has helped a lot, as she can now run her own home without any trouble. Her job keeps no schedule since she always has to be available to whatever needs doing around the house.

Vilma will use the loan so that her husband can plant beans. He will purchase seed, herbicides, and pesticides. In their current economic situation, they can't continue planting, but with the loan, he'll be able to do his work and increase his income from the harvest. He will be able to sell his beans and earn money. She will also use the money to fix up their house and expand it to live more comfortably.

Vilma is planning for a future where they have more land for planting so that they can earn greater income. She also wants to build her own home since the house they're living in now isn't their own. That way, when they have a child, they will be able to give her a larger, safer place to live.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and expand her home

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Gorreti is a married woman who has seven children, and four are still attending school. She lives in a rural setting with her family and takes care of another eight children who have lost their parents.

She is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically growing fruit (watermelon, passionfruit and pineapple) and coffee. She works six days a week and each day she works for eight hours.

She started farming with the aim of improving on the family's earnings. She has acquired this loan in order to buy herbicides and fertilizers.

She sells her products to fruit traders from neighbouring communities. Her dreams are to educate her children and modernize her farms. However, like any business she faces the challenges of lack of enough capital, diseases and lack of market. She describes herself as a hard working and honest person.

She appreciates the good service offered by UGAFODE Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and manure

loans.name: Sonia Claribel

texts.es:
Sonia, posee un atienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes ropa y productos de la canasta básica, ella aprendió a administrar un  negocio en su familia, lo atiende se seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, está funcionando desde hace 15 años y nació por la necesidad de tener ingresos para aportar en los gastos familiares, hasta la fecha no presenta dificultades. Ella es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos.
Utilizará el financiamiento para comprar variedad de ropa, granos básicos, bebidas, azúcar, sal, etc., así surtirá su negocio con productos necesarios para satisfacer a sus clientes, espera tener nuevos clientes, dar un mejor servicio, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
Sus objetivos son tener los recursos necesarios para remodelar su vivienda e incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia owns a store which offers clothing and basic staples to her customers. She learned to run a business from her family. She is open from 6 in the morning until 7 in the evening, and it has been operative for 15 years, being born through the necessity of having earnings to support the household expenses. To date she has had no difficulties. 

She is in a relationship and lives with her life partner and her 4 children.

She will use the loan to buy a variety of clothing, basic grains, drinks, sugar, salt, etc., thus supplying her business with the necessary products to satisfy her customers. 

She hopes to have new customers, offer better service, increase her sales and have higher earnings. Her objectives are to have the necessary resources to remodel her home and increase her business merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, basic grains, drinks, sugar, salt, etc., thus supplying her business with the necessary products to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 54 years of age and married to Norbert. They have been blessed with six children between the ages of 29 and 13. She has been selling clothes and clothing materials for the past 20 years and earns an income of 30,000 KES.

She has applied for her sixth loan of 65,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to purchase more clothes and clothing materials for resale.
 
Esther will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees, build a house for her family, and provide for her family's basic needs. In the future she plans to grow her business and open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and clothing materials

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 46 years old. He is married and has eight children between the ages of 23 and 1. Five of them go to school. He has a shop and has been working in this business for the past six years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products such as sugar, butter, rice, beans and soda to keep her business stocked and to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Alberto David

texts.es:
Alberto es un joven muy trabajador de 21 años de edad, que estudio solo hasta quinto grado, por ser el hermano mayor de 4 le toco trabajar para sacar a sus hermanos adelante económicamente, él está acompañado padre de un hijo de tres años de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y cuidar de su hijo en casa. Alberto, su esposa e hijo viven junto a sus 3 hermanos y su mamá.  
		 
Alberto sabe realizar todo tipo de trabajo todo gracias a que desde pequeño ha realizado diferentes trabajos y ha aprendido mucho de ellos, actualmente trabaja en una construcción donde obtiene sus ingresos económicos, la idea de él es aprender mucho la albañilería para ser albañil. Otra actividad que también realiza desde pequeño junto a su madre es la crianza de pollos de engorde, pues comenta que es una actividad que genera buenos ingresos, con el apoyo de su esposa realiza los trabajos en la granja y gracias a ello han logrado aumentar su producción de pollos. 

Por la mañana se levanta muy temprano para irse a trabajar a la construcción y a una distancia de 1 kilómetro del trabajo a su casa.

El financiamiento del préstamo es para comprar 200 pollos de engorde, concentrado, vitamina, reparar la granja y pago de mano de obra, gracias a este préstamo Alberto podrá aumentar más su producción, obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para el futuro Alberto desea en primer lugar seguir estudiando terminar sus estudios, construir su propia casa, ya que vive junto a su madre y demás hermanos, aumentar más la producción gracias al préstamo.
texts.en:
Alberto is a very hard-working young man of 21 years, who only studied to the fifth grade because he is the oldest of 4 children and it fell to him to work and help his siblings get by financially. He has a partner and is the father of a three-year-old son. His wife works in the home, taking care of the domestic tasks and her son. Alberto, his wife and their son live with his 3 siblings and his mother. 

Alberto knows how to do all kinds of work, because he has had many different jobs since he was little and has learned a lot from them. Currently, he is working on a construction site, where he earns his income, and his idea is to learn a lot about bricklaying to become a mason. Another job that he has done since he was little alongside his mother is raising chickens to sell for meat, because he says this activity provides good earnings. With his wife’s help he works in the barn and thanks to this has succeeded in increasing his production of chickens.

He gets up very early in the morning to go and work on the construction site that is one kilometer away from his house.

His loan will be used to finance buying 200 broiler chickens to be fattened, concentrate food and vitamins, repair his barn and pay for labor. Thanks to this loan Alberto will be able to increase his production even more, to generate more income and improve his quality of life. 

For the future Alberto wants first to continue studying and finish school, to build his own house, because he now lives with his mother and other siblings, and increase production using this loan.

loans.use: to buy 200 broiler chickens for fattening, concentrate food and vitamins, repair the barn and pay for labor.

loans.name: Muhammad Fakhturozidi

texts.en:
Fakhturozidi is a single man who lives in Kudus in Central Java, with his three family members. By history, Kudus was an important holy city in the sixteenth century in Indonesia. To increase his family’s income, he runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime. 

Fakhturozidi joined Ruma a month ago because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business and to expand his network. As the business continues, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide access to mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Felinas Group

texts.es:
Felinas es el nombre que decidieron darle al grupo los 7 integrantes pues dicen que con el nombre se marca la diferencia. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad cerca de un ingenio, fábrica importante en la economía y la identidad del lugar. La zona es productora de caña de azúcar y al iniciar la zafra (periodo de corte) el ingenio reinicia actividades para obtener el endulzante más común.

En la comunidad también hay una capilla en la cual el 12 de diciembre de cada año se espera la llegada de las antorchitas (peregrinos que desde una semana antes viajan a la Ciudad de México para encender su antorcha y traerla de regreso a la comunidad) a pie, en moto, a caballo para celebrar a la Virgen de Guadalupe con misa, mañanitas, fuegos artificiales y comida que los organizadores reparten a los asistentes.

Cada uno de los integrantes del grupo tiene una actividad:
María-Servicio De Enfermería
Ma. Victoria-Venta De Cosméticos
Trinidad-Venta De Ropa Y Perfumes
Jessica-Venta De Dulces
Amada-Venta De Ropa De Catalogo
Alexis-Venta De Tamales Y Chiles Rellenos
Claudio-Cría y Venta de Puercos

Claudio es el integrante más joven del grupo, tiene 23 años de edad y está casado con Karina con quien tiene una pequeña de 4 años. Claudio es trabajador, honesto y desde pequeño apoyaba a su madre a trabajar en el campo es por eso que hoy en día no se le dificulta. Comenta que lo que más recuerda es cuando pastoreaba los borregos, lavaba los chiqueros y daba de comer a los cochinos, gracias a su madre quien lo enseño a trabajar el decidió desde hace 2 años iniciar con la cría y venta de puercos. Con las ganancias obtenidas y el sueldo que percibe como trabajador en el campo sustenta los gastos del hogar; su mayor motivación son su hija y esposa. El préstamo de VisionFund México le ayudará a comprar alimento y vacunas para mantener a sus animales en buen estado.
texts.en:
Felinas is the name that the 7 members chose for the group, since they say the name sets them apart. The group is located in a community close to a sugar factory that's an important part of the area's economy and identity. The area produces sugar cane and once the cane cutting begins the factory resumes operation to produce the most common type of sweetener.

The community also has a chapel that every December 12th awaits the arrival of torch bearers (pilgrims that travel to Mexico City a week before to light their torches and bring it back to the community) on foot, on motorcycle, and on horseback to celebrate the Virgin of Guadalupe with mass, songs, fireworks and food distributed by organizers to those in attendance.

Each member of the group has an activity:
Maria-Nursing services
Ma. Victoria-Cosmetics sales
Trinidad-Clothing and perfume sales
Jessica-Candy sales
Amada-Clothing catalogue sales
Alexis-Tamales and Chiles Rellenos sales
Claudio-Pig raising and selling

Claudio is the youngest member of the group, at 23 years of age, and has a four year old child with Karina. Claudio is hardworking, honest and since he was a boy helped his mother work in the field so now he doesn't have any trouble doing the job. He says what he most remembers is shepherding the sheep, cleaning the pigpens, and feeding the piglets. Thanks to his mother, who taught him this line of work, he decided to start raising and selling pigs two years ago. With the profits obtained and the income he earns as a farmworker he pays the household expenses. His wife and daughter are his biggest motivation. The VisionFund Mexico loan will help him purchase food and vaccines to keep his animals in good health.

loans.use: To purchase food for growth, fattening, and vaccines

loans.name: Yesli Madelin

texts.es:
Yesli, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, es una joven soltera; su fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de maíz y pipián, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre, su negocio funciona desde hace 5 años y lo desempeña con ayuda de un hermano, tiene un horario de trabajo de cinco de la mañana  a una de la tarde, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y tiene clientes establecidos para distribuir el producto. 
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas con los que preparará el terreno para sembrar y con el resto pagara el transporte de la cosecha, le será de ayuda para mantener su negocio funcionando y a no quedar mal con sus clientes, espera tener una mayor productividad y mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio, los riesgos son desastres naturales o un mal invierno.
Sus aspiraciones son culminar sus estudios universitarios, comprar un vehículo para el trabajo, equipar su negocio para mantenerlo funcionando y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Yesli lives with her parents and her siblings. She is a single young woman. Here source of income is the cultivation of corn and pumpkin. She learned the trade from her father. Her business has operated for 5 years and she carries it out with the help of a brother. She has a work schedule of five in the morning until one in the afternoon. She already has a lot of experience and she has established customers to distribute the product.

She will invest in agricultural supplies with which she will prepare the land to sow and with the rest she will pay to transport the harvest. It will help her to keep her business running and to not look bad to her customers. She hopes to have a higher productivity and to improve the profitability of her business. The risks are natural disasters or a bad winter.

Her aspirations are to complete her university studies, purchase a vehicle for work, equip her business to keep it running, and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies with which she will prepare the land to sow and with the rest to pay for transporting the harvest.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 6 and 2 years; one of them goes to school. She has a bar and has been running this business for the past 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more chairs, beer and soda for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, beer and soda for sale.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en: Frida is 54 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 30 and 14 years; one of them goes to school. She has a supermarket and has been running this business for the past 14 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk, bread, snacks and yoghurt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more milk, bread, snacks and yoghurt for sale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 33 years old. She is widowed and takes care of 2 children ages 15 and 4 years old. Pamela runs a retail store where she sells bottled sodas, a business she has run for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 30,000.

Pamela has requested a loan of Kshs. 50,000, which she will use to add stock of sodas for sale. This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Pamela will be able to add more stock of sodas as well as pay school fees for her children.

Pamela's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business.

loans.use: to add stock of sodas for sale

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Meet Faisal. Faisal is single, and he lives with his family in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Faisal runs a small stall, which sells mobile phone SIM cards and mobile phone airtime for his customers. 

Faisal was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community because he wants to increase his income. As the business grows, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Faisal is standing in his small stall. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en: Gulnazi is a 65-year-old pensioner from the Senaki district. The only source of her income is her monthly pension of 150 GEL. She wants to begin a business selling food products and home products. Gulnazi requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,600 USD to begin her trading business. With the credit she will purchase all the products and food, which she will resell to villagers. Gulnazi will place all these products in her house and will resell them from home. She will have a stable income and will be able to increase the turnover of products with the increased income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase food and home products to resell

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine is an experienced agronomist from Zovasar Village. She lives with her husband, two sons, and daughter. For many years, Narine and her husband have been engaged in the cultivation of potatoes and in keeping livestock, including cows, sheep, calves, piglets, and hens. They sell their agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. As autumn is progressing, Narine needs to make some investments in her agribusiness for it to be ready for the cold season. A loan of 1500 USD will help this hardworking woman and her family a lot, enabling her to purchase feed. Narine and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the amount needed for the loan to maintain and to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: make tortillas and stock her store

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertir en el cultivo de maíz y pepino, se limitara a comprar abono y fertilizantes, para acondicionar el terreno y tener una mejor productividad, así cubrirá la demanda de sus clientes y seguirá teniendo los ingresos económicos para salir adelante con su familia.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio con lo que su rentabilidad es mayor, don Víctor ha invertido las  nuevas ganancias en cancelar su deuda y apoyar a su familia para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Victor decided to ask for a new loan in order to invest in growing corn and cucumbers. He is limiting himself to buying compost and fertilizer to condition the soil in order to have a better yield. This is the way he will meet customer demand and he will continue having income to support his family well. 

The previous loan helped him strengthen his business giving him better profit and Victor has invested the new earnings into paying off his loan and supporting his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to condition the soil in order to have a better harvest

loans.name: Jeovanny Omar

texts.es:
Jeovanny, necesita capital para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla, para continuar cultivando maíz y frijol, con los materiales dará mejor trato a sus cultivos y los protegerá de las plagas.
Con ayuda del crédito anterior su negocio ha sido fortalecido generándole nuevas ganancias que le han sido de utilidad para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar y mantener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en: Jeovanny needs capital to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and seeds to continue growing corn and beans. With these supplies he'll give his crops a boost and protect them from pests. With the aid of the prior loan his business has strengthened, generating new profits that have been useful for changing his family's quality of life and keeping a good credit record.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and seeds to continue growing corn and beans.

loans.name: G.s. Los Luchadores 01 Group

texts.es: Don Miguel, tiene 65 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando cacao, maíz y frijol. Lleva 10 años de realizar cultivo de café como su mayor fuente de ingresos. Esta producción la vende en la zona donde vive. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 5,000 Lempiras en forma grupal, es su segundo ciclo en la Institución y lo va invertir en limpieza y fertilización de la finca de café, para mejorar la cosecha. Su plan es seguir incrementando el cultivo para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. El grupo se llama los Luchadores 01, integrado por cinco miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y viven en la misma comunidad. El monto de préstamo es por 27,000 Lempiras para limpieza y fertilización del cultivo de café. En la foto esta don Miguel Ángel el coordinador del grupo a la derecha, sigue José Mauricio, José Santos, Félix y Miguel Ángel a la Izquierda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 65 years old, has 5 children, and lives with his wife and kids in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has always worked in agriculture, cultivating cocoa, corn, and beans. For the past 10 years, cultivating coffee has been his main source of income. He sells his products in the area where he lives.

He has requested a loan of 5,000 Lempiras as part of a group. This is his second cycle with the institution. He is going to use the loan to clean and fertilize his coffee farm in order to improve the harvest. His plan is to continue increasing his crops in order to better the conditions of his family. 

The group is called Los Luchadores 01 (The Fighters 01). It is composed of 5 members, who work in agriculture and live in the same community. The total loan amount is 27,000 Lempiras for the cleaning and fertilization of coffee crops. In the picture, Miguel Angel, the coordinator of the group, is on the right followed by Jose Mauricio, Jose Santos, Felix, and Miguel Angel on the left.

loans.use: to clean and fertilize his coffee farm.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en: Bela is 24 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two infant children in Kvareli district. Her children go to the local kindergarten. Bela and her husband are actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and watermelons. Bela works hard and does her best to insure a good harvest, which is sold locally at a good price. Bela decided to purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1000 Gel. With the received credit she will purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies and will start producing honey. Bela will be able to increase family's income and to improve the living conditions of her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives with bee-colonies

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un señor de 36 años, es jornalero, su nivel de estudio fue hasta el primer grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la pobreza de sus padres que no tenia recursos suficiente para que siguiera estudiando, entonces decidio trabajar para ayudar en los gastos. 

Esta acompañado y es padre de 4 hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 9 años de edad de los cuales tres se encuentran estudiando.

Alberto se dedica a la agricultura siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maiz desde hace 20 años, trabajo que lo aprendio de su padre; para llegar a su trabajo Alberto camina 2 cuadras, trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 12:00 del mediodia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institucion, es para invertir en la preparacion de la tierra, comprara semilla y veneno, pagara mano de obra para cultivar maíz, asi lograra tener una cocecha bonita donde espera poder obtener mas ingresos para el bienestar de su grupo familiar y para pagar el crédito obtenido.
El sueño de Alberto es tener 15 animales, que sus hijos sean profecionales  y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alberto, age 36, is a day laborer. He stayed in school through the first grade, but was unable to keep up with his studies as his parents were too poor to keep him in school. He decided to start working to help with expenses.

He has a partner, and is the father of four children, ages 17, 15, 13, and 9 years. Three of them are in school.

Alberto's main work is farming, and he has 14,000 square meters planted in corn. He's been in the business for 20 years, having learned the work from his father. To get to work, Alberta walks two blocks. He works from 6:00am until noon.

The loan that he is requesting from the institution will be used to prepare the land, buy seed and poison, and pay for labor to plant the corn. That way, he'll have a good harvest, earn more income, ensure his family's well being, and be able to repay the loan.

Alberto dreams of having fifteen animals, seeing his children become professionals, and improving his home.

loans.use: prepare the land to plant corn

loans.name: Gian

texts.en:
Meet Gian. Gian is single, and he lives with his family in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support his family, Gian runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime for his customers.

Gian was introduced to Ruma by one of his friends, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to increase his income and expand his network. He is excited about his new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to his community. As the business grows, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for his community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Gian is in his stall. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
Tuti lives with her husband and their only child in Garut, the capital city of Garut regency located in West Java. Tuti runs a small stall that sells drinks called Es Kelapa Muda, a famous refreshing Indonesian drink which is made from coconut and coconut water. She was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited her stall and became a Ruma agent about a month ago. Tuti is excited to sell mobile airtime especially because mobile airtime is quite in high demand in her community. As the business grows, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Tuti is standing in her small stall. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri is married, and she lives with her husband and their only child in Sukabumi, a city surrounded by the regency of the same name in the southern foothills of Mount Gede, in West Java, Indonesia. Sri runs a small stall that sells mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, mobile phone airtime, mineral waters and LPG gases.

Sri was introduced to Ruma by one of her friends, and she quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. 

She is excited about her new business as she can increase her family’s income. She also believes that using technology will make her business easier to run. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Sri is in her small stall. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Iris Milagros

texts.es: Iris, tiene 36 años de edad,tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo, una amiga y sus hijos en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Ella tiene su propio negocio, se dedica a la venta de artículos electrónicos como ollas, cortinas, toallas, productos plásticos, sandalias, también DVD, CD, controles, cargadores, películas etc. El préstamo es de 10,000 lempiras para la compra de mas producto para capitalizar el negocio y obtener mejores ventas. Comprara productos plásticos, sandalias y accesorios como cargadores, controles y otros. Su idea es  poner un minisúper y una tienda de electrónicos y achinería en general.
texts.en:
Iris is 36 years old and has three kids. She lives with her husband, a friend and her kids in the city of Tocoa, Colon. She has her own business selling electronics such as DVDs, CDs, remotes, chargers and movies, as well as pots, curtains, towels, plastic products, sandals, etc. 

The loan of 10,000 lempiras will be used to buy more products for her business and to sell more. She's going to buy plastic products, sandals and accessories such as chargers and remotes, among other things. Her idea is to start a convenience store and electronics store.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, sandals and accessories such as chargers and remotes, among other things.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Meet Dewi. Dewi is married, and she lives with her husband in Sukabumi, a city surrounded by the regency of the same name in the southern foothills of Mount Gede, in West Java, Indonesia. Dewi runs a console game rental business. She also runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone SIM cards, phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime.

Dewi was introduced to Ruma by one of her friends, and she quickly became interested in joining Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. In the photo, Dewi is in her small stall. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a 51-year-old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a produce business and a hotel in a busy location. He faces the challenges of low income and bad weather, which affect the transportation of produce and cause price fluctuation. However, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Jonathan needs a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en: Tausi used the previous loan to buy oils and hair extensions for her salon. She started as an employee but now has her own business, and her ambition is to turn it into a modern beauty parlour and construct her own fully furnished house. One of the challenges she faces is that she has limited capital to meet the high demand and increased competition. Tausi intends to use the loan to buy oils and braids (hair extensions), relaxers and a small generator for her salon.

loans.use: to buy oils and braids (hair extensions), relaxers and a small generator for her salon.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle, which he intends to hire out. He rides a motorcycle to earn a living. He started the business after dropping out of school. High fuel costs and poor road networks affect his business. His dreams are to own at least five motorcycles and build a good house as a residence. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle, which he intends to hire out.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle which he intends to hire out.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in Masindi-Uganda. She does farming where she grows maize, sweet potatoes, and beans. She has hopes of constructing a permanent house and educating her offspring and merchandising her farm. Rosemary is faced with the challenges of weather changes, pests and price fluctuations. She wants a loan to prepare her gardens.

She is a member of Twehaireyo Group where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

She wants a loan to prepare her garden by slashing, weeding, and ploughing.

loans.use: to prepare her garden by slashing, weeding, and ploughing.

loans.name: Zebra Ii Group

texts.en:
Joseph wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, soap and rice to sell. He lives in Masindi-Uganda. He has a motorcycle transport business and has hopes of expanding and modernizing his business and constructing a permanent house.

He is a member of Zebra group where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar, soap and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase home appliances for the house.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Doña Sandra, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de Tocoa Colon. Hace dos años inicio su propio negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica como ser, granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, golosinas, productos de uso personal, lácteos, jugos, pollo, etc. y lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 12,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mas producto de granos básicos y refrescos para mejorar sus ingresos y en hacer más grande el negocio. Sus metas a futuro son comprar un vehículo, vender comida, que sus hijos se independicen y tener un nieto.
texts.en:
Sandra is 45 years old, married and she has three children.  She lives with her family in the town of Tocoa Colon.  She started her own business two years ago selling staple products like basic grains, meats, soft drinks, snacks, personal use products, dairy products, juices, chicken, etc. and she has the business in her home. 

She has requested a loan for 12,000 lempiras (HNL) which she will invest in the purchase of more basic staple products and soft drinks in order to improve her income and make her business larger.  Her goals for the future are to purchase a vehicle, sell food, that her children become independent and that she has a grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Maribel

texts.es: Reyna, tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo e hijos en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Ella se dedica a su propio negocio de sastrería en general. Este taller lo tiene hace 2 años en su casa y confecciona prendas de vestir para mujer, como blusas, faldas, vestidos y reparación de ropa. Solicita un préstamo por 7,000 lempiras, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de telas para la confección de ropa y la compra de una máquina electrica, con el fin de producir más ropa y mejorar sus ventas. Su idea es tener una sastrería grande con empleados para elaborar mas prendas y aumentar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Reyna is 25 years old and has three kids. She lives with her husband and kids in the city of Tocoa, Colon. She has her own tailoring business. She's had a workshop in her house for two years, and makes clothing for women, such as blouses, skirts and dresses, and she also repairs clothing. 

She's asking for a loan of 7,000 lempiras, which she will invest in the purchase of fabrics to make clothing and to buy an electric sewing machine. With this she'll be able to make more clothes and sell more. Her idea is to have a large tailoring business with employees to make more clothes and to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing and to buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teresa, tiene 76 años de edad, esta viuda, tiene 6 hijos y dos nietos,  vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace mas de 30 años que tiene una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios y abarrotes como ser, arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, café, pan, churros, refrescos, harina, jabón etc. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para mantener activo su negocio y actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual invertirá, en la compra de productos para su negocio como granos básicos, refrescos, azúcar, jabón, manteca, churros, pan, huevos, dulces, y otros abarrotes y  tener más variedad para satisfacer sus clientes. Tiene planes de mantener surtido su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y tener mejor vida.
texts.en:
Teresa  is 76 years old. She is a widow, with six children and two grandchildren. She lives with her family in a village in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. She has had a small grocery store for more than 30 years where she sells food and grocery products such as  rice, beans, corn, sugar, coffee, bread, snacks, soft drinks, flour, soap, etc.

She  has obtained several loans for keeping her business going, and currently is requesting another for 15,000 lempiras. She will invest this in the purchase of products for her business such as basic staples, soft drinks, sugar, soap, lard, snacks, bread, eggs, candy, and other groceries, and to have more variety for satisfying her customers. She plans to keep her business supplied, so that she can obtain better earnings and have a better life.

loans.use: To buy products for her business such as basic staples, soft drinks, sugar, soap, lard, snacks, bread, eggs, candy and other supplies.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal applied for his first loan, which was given by Kiva lenders to purchase new mobile phones and special accessories to add to his merchandise. In reality, that loan helped Jamal very much in providing his store with all new accessories and mobile phones, and with that new merchandise he was able to attract more customers. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for his first loan. After Jamal finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan, Jamal applied for a second Youth loan of 160,000 YER from Kiva lenders to enlarge and expand his business more through purchasing additional amounts of new and stylish phones accessories for his store to be able to meet all of the demands of his customers. He hopes that this loan will be financed.

loans.use: To purchase additional amounts of new and stylish phones accessories for his store to be able to meet all of the demands of his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as fabric, felt, ribbons, thread, and other things to make more decorations to sell.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 29-year-old married father of two children. Twelve years ago, he started working as a baker to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Abbass is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate his business and transportation, especially for buying the necessary raw materials. 

Abbass hopes to expand his bakery in the future to increase his income and provide his beloved family with better living situations.

loans.use: To buy a car, which will facilitate his business and transportation, especially for buying the necessary raw materials.

loans.name: Anivar

texts.es:
Anivar de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 2 hijas que estudian, una va a 5  año de la Universidad y la menor a 5° grado, del señor depende toda su familia. 

Desde hace 15 años es albañil, y aprendió trabajando de ayudante de otras personas, además es armador, trabaja armando columnas de hierro cuando construyen las casas, su horario de trabajo es variado más que todo depende del trabajo que le salga.

El crédito lo necesita para fabricar un portón con maya para su vivienda, ya que el de uso actual está deteriorado y no cierra bien lo deja sin candado por las noches. 

El sueño primordial es que su hija se gradué de la carrera universitaria y en un futuro la menor, además desea gozar de buena salud para seguir trabajando y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Anivar is 51 and studied up until the fourth grade. He's married and his wife is a homemaker. They have two daughters who are in school. One is in her fifth year of university and the younger one is in fifth grade. His whole family depends on him. He's been a bricklayer for 15 years- he learned this as a helper for other people. He's also a welder and works welding iron columns when they build houses. His work schedule varies and depends more than anything on what kind of work comes up for him. 

He needs this loan to make a gate for his house, as the one he currently has is falling apart and doesn't close well, so he has to leave it unlocked at night. His ultimate dream is to have his daughters graduate from university. He also hopes for good health to continue working and to take care of his family.

loans.use: to make a gate for his house, as the one he currently has is falling apart and doesn't close well, so he has to leave it unlocked at night.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik, a teacher by profession, is involved in farming. She lives with her husband, 1-year-old daughter and parents-in-laws in Irind village of Aragatsotn region. 

Shushanik's family members help her with farming activities. They keep livestock consisting of cows, calves, sheep, piglets and hens. The requested loan of USD 1500 is very important for Shushanik to purchase forage for feeding the livestock (barley and grass). The whole family will be very grateful for your support in collecting the amount needed for the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock (barley and grass)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement in order to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Martha Lili

texts.es:
Martha Lili tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia junto a hijo; en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Martha Lili se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas y de cerdos en puesto de mercado de Cayaltí desde hace 15 años. Ella necesita del préstamo para la compra de ganado en pie(cerdo y ganado vacuno) para engordarlo y después realizar la venta de las carnes de estos animales al público en puesto de mercado. Con ello tendrá mayores ventas y una mejor atención a clientes satisfaciendo todos los gustos de su público consumidor y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Lili is 50 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her son in a community that works in commerce, agriculture, and livestock. It is located in the Cayalti district, which is in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

For the past 15 years, Martha Lili has been making a living selling pork and beef at a stall in the Cayalti market. She needs a loan to buy cattle (pork and beef) to fatten; she will later sell the meat of these animals to the public at her market stall. With this, she will have greater sales and better customer service, satisfying every taste of the consumer public. In this way, she will generate income to improve her quality of life.
