loans.use: to buy cattle (pork and beef) to fatten; she will later sell the meat of these animals to the public at her market stall.

loans.name: Krobor Bukom Group

texts.en:
Mercy O. is the featured borrower and a member of Krobor-Bukom Group. She is forty-two years old and married with two children. She joined ID-Ghana in 2011 where she went through training on enterprise creation and financial management. This enriched her business management skills.

Mercy runs a kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish business on the pavement in her area. She is borrowing a loan to expand her kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish business by buying more corn, firewood, fish, to prepare kenkey and sell to customers. This will help her deal with the rising demand for her commodities. Mercy O. believes that the business will flourish and bring her more income. This will enable her to meet her family's needs such as education, food and clothing without much struggle.

She is very grateful to Kiva for the financial support, and she promises to repay the loan on time. The group will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more corn, firewood, fish to prepare kenkey and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en: Hajiran is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns 1 buffalo. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She is in her 5th loan cycle. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that an increase in milk production will help her in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito, a father of five children, provides repair services in their village to make a living. He provides for his family with the income he earns from the services in his shop. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for buying spare parts and accessories for his shop. He took a new loan recently to purchase tools for his vulcanizing shop. In the future, he wants to improve his repair shop for the expansion of his services.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 57-year-old woman, married to Francis, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with five children. Jane has been a farmer, alongside dairy farming as a secondary business, for a period of ten years. She earns an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.
 
Jane is now servicing her second loan of KES 47,000 and intends to use this amount to cultivate her land, and buy seedlings and fertilizers.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to buy a dairy cow, and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to cultivate the land, and buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Guillermo César

texts.es:
Guillermo de 69 años de edad, es agricultor de la zona, estudio hasta bachillerato, luego se dedicó a la agricultura que es lo que más le ha gustado en su vida, actualmente está casado y de dicho matrimonio procrearon junto a su esposa dos hijos de las cuales ya son independientes y ya no viven junto a él.

Guillermo es un agricultor desde hace muchos años, esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre quien también era agricultor. Él está cultivando cuatro hectáreas de jícama, ya lleva ocho años consecutivos de realizar dichos cultivos.

El dinero de este préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para terminar sus cultivos de jícama, ya que les aplicara la última abonada ya están a punto de dar los frutos para la cosecha.

El anhelo que tiene es poder realizar un excelente cultivo, ya que son varias las hectáreas que está cultivando y es de vital importancia aplicarle una última abonada y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 69 years old. He is a farmer in his area. He went to school up to high school, and later started working in agriculture because that is what he has liked most in life. Now he is married and from his marriage he and his wife have two children who are on their own and don't live with him any more. 

Guillermo has been a farmer for many years. He learned this activity from his father who was also a farmer. He is growing four hectares of jicama and has been raising that type of crop for 8 consecutive years.
 
The money from this loan will be invested in buying materials and fertilizers for his jicama crops. He will apply the last fertilizer because they are about to produce fruit for harvest. 

What he wishes for is to have an excellent crop, because he has planted various hectares and it is very important to apply the last fertilizer and he knows he can do this with the help of his loan.

loans.use: to buy materials and fertilizer to finish his jicama crops. He will apply the last fertilizer because it is about to produce the fruit for harvest.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida, age 49, is a happily married woman. A year ago, she decided to support her family by starting stitching in her home. Sajida is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching clothes. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting the daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth. She is in her 6th loan cycle. Sajida hopes that her stitching business will be very successful and will generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a married woman and a mother of 5 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns 5 calves and 2 cows for milk. However, the income generated is not enough to provide for her children. Therefore she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She is in her 6th loan cycle. She is hopeful that increases in milk production will help her in generating a greater income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a uniform and shoes for school, among other expenses.

loans.name: Jorge Hilario

texts.es:
Jorge Hilario tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero, y es muy conocido en el medio por prestar el servicio de mototaxi. Vive en casa propia; cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; en la cual viven gente respetuosa y trabajadora, dedicadas al comercio y ganadería.

Jorge Hilario se dedica a prestar el servicio de transporte en mototaxi, desde hace más 02 años; adicionalmente trabaja como jornalero agrícola por zona de residencia, desde hace más de 03 años. Él necesita préstamo para mantenimiento de mototaxi, pues desea realizar la compra de piezas que necesitan cambio, para poder asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo mientras continue operando correctamente le seguirá generando ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge Hilario is 19 years old, single, and is well known for offering motorcycle taxi service. He lives in his own home and has good personal and business references. 

He lives in a community located in the district of Saña [Zaña], province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. People who live there are respectful and hardworking, dedicated to commerce and livestock.

Jorge Hilario has been working offering motorcycle taxi service for more than 2 years. He has also been working as an agricultural laborer in the area where he lives for more than 3 years. He needs a loan in order to maintain his motorcycle taxi. He wants to buy the parts that need changing in order to be certain his work-tool functions properly and continues operating suitably so he will continue to generate income.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle taxi that need to be changed

loans.name: Amigas Trabajadoras  (Rocafuerte) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Amigas Trabajadoras se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Rocafuerte conocido por la gran variedad de dulces que se preparan en este lugar y que son reconocidos  a nivel nacional por su delicioso sabor.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les va a  servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos podrán  mejorar  sus pequeños negocios y su vida. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Dolores, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 8  y 1 años, los  mayores estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en metalmecánica.
Doña Dolores en con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto darles lo mejor a sus hijos desde hace seis años atrás con lo que tenia y con la ayuda de su marido surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en la casa en la cual viven, allí vende además de víveres ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, ella espera que ahora con la ayuda de los créditos su negocio prospere aun mas, su marido le ayuda cuando él puede aunque es ella la que siempre está atenta a brindar la mejor atención ya que es por eso que su clientela la prefiere. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Este es su primer ciclo  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
La foto pequeña es de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Amigas Trabajadoras credit group meets every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton, known for the wide variety of candies made there, known nationwide for their delicious flavor. This is a group of persons who decided to get together and make this credit group. It will be very useful for them because with the loans, they will be able to improve their small businesses and their lives. They work in different activities, such as farming, general commerce, services and other activities. 

One of the members of this group is Dolores. She is 31 years old and is in a common law marriage with three children, aged 11, 8 and 1. Her husband works as a metal worker.  

In order to earn something for her account and give her children a better life, six years ago Dolores opened a small grocery store in their house with what she had and with her husband's help. They also sell certain miscellaneous items and paper goods. She hopes that with the help of the loans, she will prosper even more. Her husband helps her how every he can, but it is she who is always attentive to giving the best service, and that is why her clientele prefers her.
 
This loan is to buy groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan with the credit group and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to keep going forward and give her little ones the best. 

The small photo is of two members who weren't able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Sheyla Yuvisa

texts.es:
Sheyla Yuvisa tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Sheyla Yuvisa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, hace 3 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para ser usado en capital de trabajo; pues desea realizar la compra de patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes; esto el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad y aumentar su stock de animales, con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes; para poder aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sheyla Yuvisa is 28 years old. She is a single mother with two children in her care. She lives in a family home in a rural area of the Oyotun district in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

For three years Sheyla Yuvisa has worked raising and selling farm animals. Her business is located in the back part of her home. She is seeking a loan to use as working capital because she wants to complete the purchase of ducks, chickens, turkeys and guinea pigs. This loan will help her obtain greater diversity and increase the size of the stock of her animals. Her goals are to increase her business and satisfy the needs of her customers, to increase her sales, increase her earnings and thus her quality of life.

loans.use: to use it for working capital because she wants to complete the purchase of ducks, chickens, turkeys and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en:
Artavazd lives in Vanadzor, a city in the region of Lori. He has no higher education but has learned the craft of shoe making, with all of the details and secrets that it entails, and he has become a master shoemaker. 

For 15 years he repaired shoes in a small booth that he built near his house, and for the past 5 years he has also taken orders for hand-made shoes. As he says, he works with an artisanal flair and with high quality materials; the proof of his success is in the large number of customers who come to him from all over the city.

Artavaz is married and he has two school-aged children. His work is the sole source of income for his family, for whom he would like provide better conditions.

He asks for this loan in order to enlarge his business: to buy shoe soles, leather and fur, since with the change of seasons, he will surely have many orders for making boots.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles, leather and fur for his shoe making business

loans.name: Monserrate Lidia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Lidia, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Lidia con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y cosas de bazar, tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días, ella también vende puerta a puerta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, zapatos y cosas de bazar. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  10 años y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños tener un gran bazar
texts.en:
The Crédito Jaramijo group meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo area, which is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of the people who live there are very hardworking and work in jobs related to the sea. This is where Lidia lives. She is 49 years old, married and has five grown children from this marriage. Two of them still live with her. Her husband is a fisherman.

Lidia would like to earn money of her own in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing of all kinds- shoes and bazaar items. She has a small bazaar in her house where she works every day. She also sells door-to-door, letting her customers pay with credit and charging them every fifteen days. She's done this for over ten years and it's going well for her.

She's going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, tshirts, shoes and bazaar items. She's been part of this credit group for ten years and she likes it because she's able to finance her business with the loans. Her dream is to have a large bazaar.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, tshirts, shoes and bazaar items.

loans.name: Francisco David

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Francisco, tiene 34 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 7 y 4 años, los  dos menores estudian en escuela y jardín de infantes. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
El señor Francisco es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la dura tarea de recoger los frutos del mar, el tiene una pequeña embarcación en la cual junto a tres personas se van a alta mar  a realizar sus faenas de pesca, ellos salen en la tarde y no llegan sino hasta después de tres a cuatro días con los productos, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Llevan más de 10  años  dedicados a esta dura labor con la cual el saca a su familia adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar.  Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para realizar sus faenas de pesca.
texts.en:
The credit group Jaramijo meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo, known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are hard workers and work in industries related to the ocean. This is where Don Francisco lives. He is 34 years old, and married with three children who are 15, 7, and 4. The youngest are in school and kindergarten. His wife is a housewife. Francisco is a very hardworking man who makes a living in the tough job of fishing at sea. He has a small boat which takes three people to the high seas to fish. They leave in the afternoon and do not come back for three or four days with their catches. When they return they deliver the products to wholesalers to distribute throughout the province. They have been doing this hard work for over 10 years, which supports his family. 

This loan is to buy nets, lanyards, fuel, and food for the days when Francisco and his crew are at sea. He has been a member of the credit group for four cycles, and likes it for the support that the loans give him. His dream is to have a big boat to go fishing.

loans.use: to buy nets, lanyards, fuel, and food for fishing trips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school uniforms and shoes for her two daughters.

loans.name: Ulbash

texts.ru: Улбаш, так зовут эту скромную, но трудолюбивую женщину из района Кубадиён. Ей 57 лет. Она занимается фермерством, Улбаш арендует государственный участок земли и занимается там со своей семьей растениеводством. Сейчас Улбаш хочет улучшить финансовые условия семьи и решила начать еще один бизнес, приносящий стабильный доход. Ее интересует купля-продажа крунорогатого скота. Улбаш имеет место для содержания скотов, а также к их дому близко расположены несколько пастбищ и еще корм для скотов она будет брать со своих земель. Ей осталось только закупить пару скотин и начать бизнес. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Улбаш надеется, что ей помогут в начинании нового бизнеса.
texts.en: Meet Ulbash, a modest but hardworking woman from the district of Qubadiyon.  Ulbash is 57 years old and works as a farmer.  She and her family grow crops on a piece of state land that they lease.  As she wants to improve her family's financial situation, she has decided to get involved in an additional activity, which will bring her a stable source of income.  She is planning to start buying and selling cattle.  Ulbash already has a barn where she will keep her cattle, and there are several pastures close to her home.  She will also use her own crops to make feed for her animals.  The only thing that she still needs to do is to buy two head of cattle and start her business.  For this reason she is taking a loan.  Ulbash hopes to receive the support she needs to start her new business.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to start her new business.

loans.name: Karina Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 14 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Karina es una ama de casa que para obtener ingresos propios y con esto ayudar a su marido con los con los gastos del hogar se dedica  a la venta de ropa, zapatos, útiles escolares, entre otras cosas, ella siempre vende los productos que estén de temporada ya que así vende más rápido y sus ganancias siempre son  muy buenas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque también vende en su casa donde sus clientes llegan cuando necesitan algún producto, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 16 años dedicada a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, útiles escolares y todo lo que ella vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 16 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: The financing group Jaramijo meets every two weeks in the canton of Jaramjio, which is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of inhabitants are hardworking and employed in ocean-related activities. Karina lives in this area, and she's a 40 year old married woman with two children ages 20 and 14 who are students in college and high school. Her husband works in fishing. Ms. Karina is a housewife who earns her own income and helps her husband with household expenses by selling clothes, shoes, and school supplies among other things. She sells items door to door although she also sometimes sells from her home when customers arrive in need of a product. She sells on installment plans and collects payments every week. For over 16 years she has been in this line of work. This loan is for purchasing clothing, shoes, school supplies and everything she sells. She's been in the financing group for 16 years and she enjoys it because she used the first loan to start her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 19 años de edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Yesenia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para compra de mercadería(talcos, perfumes, colonias, joyas, entre otros), dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad de productos, y así poder atender los diferentes gustos de los clientes de la zona, poder aumentar sus ventas y asi mejroar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 19, is married and has one child.  She lives with her family in a rural area of the Oyotún district in the province of Chiclayo and department of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Yesenia earns a living selling cosmetics and beauty products.  She has more than two years of experience in her business, which is located in her home.

She's requesting a loan to buy talcum powder, perfume, cologne, jewelry, and other merchandise.

This investment will help her have a greater variety of products and she'll be able to tend to the different tastes of her customers in the area; increase her sales; and improve her earnings and, as a result, her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy talcum powder, perfume, cologne, jewelry, and other merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bails of a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Janeth Rosanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 14 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Janeth es una mujer muy emprendedora que además de ser maestra en una institución educativa también se dedica al comercio con la finalidad de ganar algo extra que les sirva para el futuro de su familia, ella tiene tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí venden productos de primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y papelería, gaseosas, entre otros productos, ella está impartiendo sus conocimientos en la escuela donde trabaja sus hijos son los encargados de atender su negocio pero ya que ella llega a su casa es ella la que está al tanto de lo que necesiten sus clientes, lleva 12 años con su negocio el cual le da muchos beneficios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres que aún le faltan para brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva más de 15 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The loan group Jaramijo meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo, known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of its inhabitants are very hard workers and work in industries related to the ocean. This is where Janeth works. She is 43 years old, and married with two children who are 14 and 12, and are in high school. Her husband is a driver. 

Janeth is an entrepreneurial woman who, in addition to being a teacher, also works in sales so she can make some extra income to provide for her family's future. She has a convenience store in her home, where she sells products such as stationary, supplies, and soft drinks, among other things. While she teaches, her children run the store, although she is the one who manages client demands. She has had the store for 12 years, and it has brought her many benefits. 

This loan will be used to increase merchandise in the shop; she will buy supplies that she currently lacks, so that she can provide a better service. She has been a member of the loan group for over 15 years and likes it because the loans help her immensely. Her goal is to continue to grow her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guadalupe de 35 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su nivel académico fue hasta el 2° grado, no pudo continuar con sus estudios ya que su madre la abandono cuando ella era una niña, por lo tanto se dedico a trabajar para los gastos del hogar.

 Esta soltera y es madre de 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, los cuales aun se encuentran estudiando.

Guadalupe trabaja como ama de casa desde hace 3 meses, trabajo que lo desempeña para ayudar en los gastos del hogar, ya que su compañero de vida falleció, para llegar a su trabajo Guadalupe viaja en bicicleta medio kilometro todos los días trabajando en el horario de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm.

El crédito que Guadalupe esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una motocicleta para transportarse a su lugar de trabajo.

Los sueños de Guadalupe son poder tener su propia casa, que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria y también poder llegar a tener 10 animales.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 35 years old and she is devoted to tending her home. She has a second grade education; she couldn't continue her studies because her mother abandoned her when she was a child and she had to start working to help meet household expenses.

She is a single mother of three children, ages 13, 11, and 8 years, who are all still in school.

Guadalupe started working as a housekeeper three months ago. This work helps her to meet her household expenses, now that her partner is dead. To get to work, Guadalupe rides her bicycle half a kilometer every day. She works from 6:00am until 4:00pm.  The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to purchase a motorcycle, which she will use to get to work.

Guadalupe dreams of having her own home, of her children studying for a university degree, and of coming to have ten animals.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to get to work

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is 50 years of age. Her great skill in hand embroidery and 10 years' experience in this field has given her a very good reputation in her community. Over the years, the demand for her hand-embroidered cloth has grown and she uses the income generated to pay for the expenses of her four children. Khalida is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR with which she wants to purchase spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper. She hopes that her skill will help in providing for her family’s everyday expenses.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, measuring tape, embroidery scissors, frames and tracing paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dozens of school bags, jeans, polos, shirts, crepe and shoes.

loans.name: Havasmo

texts.ru: Хавасмо 46-летняя жительница района Гиссар. Она стойкая, трудолюбивая и гостеприимная женщина. На протяжении 10 лет Хавасмо занимается разведением коров, бычков, овец и козлят. Вся семья помогает ей в этом. Хавасмо живет в селе района вместе с мужем и двумя взрослыми детьми. Сейчас она хотела бы увеличить поголовье мелкорогатого скота. На сумму кредита Хавасмо планирует купить одного маленького барашка. Она надеется на вашу финансовую помощь, так как собственного сбережения не хватает.
texts.en: Havasmo is 46 years old and she lives in the Gissar district of Tajikistan.  She is a strong, hardworking and hospitable woman.  She has been raising livestock (cows, young bulls, sheep and goats) for the past ten years.  Her entire family helps her with this business.  Havasmo lives in a village with her husband and two adult children and she would like to increase her small livestock headcount.  With her loan amount, she is planning to buy a lamb.  She hopes that you will support her financially, as her personal savings are not sufficient for this purchase.

loans.use: to buy a lamb.

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Ofelia, mantiene la venta de frutas, jugos naturales y bebidas refrescantes con actividad constante, el financiamiento anterior le ayudo a tener los insumos necesarios para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y seguir teniendo ingresos económicos para subsistir con su familia.
Requiere un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de sodas, jugos, pepinos, mangos, naranjas, sandías, etc., de esta manera surtirá el inventario del negocio, atraerá nuevos clientes, podrá aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Ofelia runs her business selling fruits, natural fruit juices, and cool drinks through constant hard work. Her previous loan helped her to buy the supplies she needed to meet her customers' need and earn the income she needs to sustain her family.

Now she needs a new loan which she will invest in buying sodas, juices, cucumber, mango, oranges, watermelons, and more. This will help her stock her business, attract new customers, and expand her sales and earnings.

loans.use: purchase sodas, juices and produce to supply her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine, to complete medical exams and to obtain an encephalogram.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a married woman and has been running a business of milk selling with her husband for the past three years. She has two buffaloes for milking purposes. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. It’s her 8th year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for milking. She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Donara

texts.en:
Donara lives in Eghegnadzor town with her husband, mother-in-law and two school-aged children. Donara, together with her husband, started pasta production two years ago. She and her mother-in-law produce different types of pasta and her husband distributes and sells it. As they are the only producers of pasta in the whole Eghegnadzor town, Donara would like to enlarge and improve their business. She has applied for this loan of USD 1800 to purchase materials and tools for pasta production and to pay for renovation of the machinery of production. 
Donara has already taken a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Donara has been able to run her production in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Donara and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their business.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools for pasta production and renovation of the machinery

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 37 year-old Abu.  He is married, and has 3 children aged 13, 9, and 2 years, two of whom attend school.  Abu owns a business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 3,850,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Abu has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cartons of A4 papers, dozens of notepads, renovators, school registers, packet of markers and dozens of folders. In the future, Abu is still planning to open another outlet; buy a piece of land and provide quality education for his children.  From the past loan he was able to buy new photocopier machines and also changed his business location to a more strategic position. This loan has help to improve the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of A4 paper, dozens of notepads, renovators, school registers, packet of markers and dozens of folders.

loans.name: Ángela Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora  que para lograr sus propios recursos y con estos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar  se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende aguas, jugos, energizantes, gaseosas y varios bocaditos de picar y golosinas,  de esta forma ella logra ganarse algo por su cuenta y se entretiene en su negocio mucho más cuando su marido está en sus faenas de pesca. Lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar colas, jugos, aguas entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con la ayuda de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Jaramijo communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches. Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and make a living through the labors of the sea.

Señora Ángela lives here. She is 49 years old, married, and from this relationship has six children; all of whom are older and independent. Her husband makes a living fishing.  

Doña Ángela is a very hard-working woman who, in order to get her own resources and use them to help her husband with the household costs, makes a living in commerce. She has a place in her house where she sells water, juice, energy drinks, sodas, and little bites like snacks and candy. In this way she manages to earn something on her own, and she is engaged in her business much more when her husband is out fishing. She has more than 10 years of experience in this job, with which she gets ahead in life.

She is going to use this loan to buy sodas, juices, and water, among other items that she sells.  She has more than 10 years with the communal bank and she likes it because with the help from the loans she started her business.  Her dreams are to have a large place of business.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, water, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of assorted soft drinks, dozens of video plates, and cartons of torchlight batteries.

loans.name: Marie Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Marie Mohamed. She is married and has 4 children aged 20, 16, 13 and 8 years, and all are in school. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her to be fostered and also to assist with her business.  

In 2013, Marie Mohamed established her business selling toilet soap, flashlights, batteries, fresh milk, biscuits, sweets, etc. She started business after she got married; her husband provided the initial capital, which allowed her to begin selling charcoal, and the profit she gathered was used to open this shop.  

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Marie Mohamed earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Marie Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy crates of assorted soft drinks, cartons of soda, toilet soap, Ovaltine and butter. In the future, Marie Mohamed plans to develop their piece of land, educate her children and expand the business. This loan will help to increase supplies and generate more income. Frequent change in prices is her major business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of assorted soft drinks, cartons of soda, toilet soap, Ovaltine and butter.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old David. He is married and has six children, ages 18, 15, 12, 10, 7 and 4 years. Five of his children go to school. He has one additional dependent who lives with him. In 1999, David established his business selling biscuits, Maggi cubes, torchlights, batteries, sweets, soap, plastic products, black mint, etc. 

He had a groundnut plantation and used the proceeds to start a patent medicine business. That business collapsed during the civil war, and he changed the business to a grocery. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,100,000 SLL  every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. David requires a loan in order to buy cartons of Maggi cubes, torchlight batteries, black mint, biscuits, and bundles of pure water. 

In the future, David plans to continue with his building project and educating his children. The loan will help to increase his inventory, as he does not have enough capital to buy most of the items. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of Maggi cubes, torchlight batteries, black mint, biscuits, and bundles of pure water.

loans.name: Tufaniso

texts.ru: 49-летняя Туфанисо является предпринимателем из района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Она предприимчивая и усердная женщина. Туфанисо в 2008 году совместно с мужем и собственным капиталом начала торговый бизнес. Вот уже 6 лет как они продолжают свой бизнес. Туфанисо занимается продажей детской одежды и хлопчатобумажных женских галошей. Сейчас она хочет увеличить ассортимент товара для привлечения большего количества клиентов. За счет суммы кредита она собирается привезти сезонную детскую одежду и партию хлопчатобумажных женских галошей. Этот вид обуви особо востребован в сельских местностях, так как является очень удобной. Туфанисо ожидает поддержки, которая необходима ей для развития торговли.
texts.en: Tufaniso, age 49, is an entrepreneur from the B. Gafurov district of the city of Khujand.  She is a resourceful and hardworking woman.  In 2008, she and her husband started a retail business using their own capital.  They have been involved in this business for the past six years.  Tufaniso sells children's clothes as well as women's cotton "galoshes", and she wants to increase her inventory in order to attract more customers.  With her loan amount, she is planning to get some seasonal children's clothes as well as a bunch of cotton galoshes.  Those shoes are in high demand in the rural areas because they are extremely comfortable.  Tufaniso is waiting for your support, as she can't develop her business without it.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's clothes and some cotton "galoshes" for women.

loans.name: Subainatu

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Subainatu. She is married and has a 3-year-old child. Subainatu owns a business. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Subainatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of baby food, body cream, blood syrup, pain tablets and cough syrup. In the future, Subainatu hopes to both diversify and grow her business. She is now selling drinks and hair products. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of baby food, body cream, blood syrup, pain tablets and cough syrup.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of powdered milk, crates of drinks, cartons of Ovaltine, and packets of candy.

loans.name: Mohamed System

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Mohamed System. He is married and has 4 children ages 25, 7, 5, and 3 years, 2 of whom are in school. Mohamed System also has 2 additional dependents: his mother and nephew who live with him.  

In 2004, Mohamed System established his business selling pure water, soft drinks, hard and soft drinks, milk, biscuits, etc. He started his business after many years working extremely hard at selling charcoal. Now, working 7 days a week and 16 hours a day, he earns about Le 740,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mohamed System requires a loan in order to buy crates of assorted drinks, bundles of sachet milk, pure water and cartons of flashlight batteries. In the future, Mohamed System plans to expand the business and provide quality education for his children.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of assorted drinks, bundles of sachet milk, pure water, and cartons of flashlight batteries.

loans.name: Mussrat

texts.en: Mussrat is a 55 year old married woman who has spent 20 years of her life running a school. Her two children started helping out with the school at a young age and are now fully involved in the management of the school. Mussrat and her daughter also teach in the school. From its modest beginnings in Mussrat's own house, the school has grown over the years and currently educates more than 750 students, of which over 400 are girls. Mussarat's dream is to improve the education level of her community—which she describes as "a deserving area"—and her focus is on providing quality education to her students. She has been working hard to achieve this dream for two decades, and it is this work ethic that she has passed on to her children. Mussarat needs a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy furniture for the younger children in her school.

loans.use: to buy school furniture.

loans.name: Mauro Francisco

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vivre don Mauro, tiene 51 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 6 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
El señor Mauro es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir, el tiene una pequeña embarcación en la cual junto a tres personas se van a alta mar  a realizar sus faenas de pesca,  se van a alta mar por  tres a cuatro días y luego de obtener una buena pesca regresan a tierra firme, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Llevan más de 30  años  dedicado a esta actividad que aunque dura le da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar.  Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos son de mucha ayuda para él y su familia. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Jaramijo communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches.  Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and make a living through the labors of the sea.

Don Mauro lives here.  He is 51 years old, in a common-law marriage, and from this relationship has a 6-year-old son who is in school.  His spouse is a housewife.

Señor Mauro is a very hard-working man who does everything possible so that his family does not lack anything necessary to live.  He has a small vessel in which he and three other people go out to high seas to fish.  They go out to sea for three to four days and after getting a good catch they return to land.  Once on the beach, they deliver their products to the wholesalers so they can distribute them throughout the province.  He has spent more than 30 years in this job, which, although it is hard, gives him everything that is necessary to get ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy nets, rope, fuel, and food for the days that he has to be out at sea.  He has had three cycles with this communal bank and he likes it because the loans are of great help to him and his family.  His dream is to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy nets, ropes, fuel, and food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Khairiyah

texts.en:
Khairiyah is a 55-year-old widowed mother of four children, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. 22 years ago she started working in a coffee shop to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved children. In 2008, she started her own business to improve her family’s standard of living. She has a special espresso machine located by the sidewalk of the street in the camp, where she provides tasty coffee and special hot drinks.

Khairiyah worked hard and sacrificed a lot to provide her children with better living conditions, especially after her husband passed away. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house in an attempt to make it a healthier place for her children. She always hopes to expand her business and increase her profit to guarantee the future of her family.

loans.use: To renovate her house in an attempt to make it healthier place for her children

loans.name: Qurbonjon

texts.ru: Эту 37-летнюю портниху зовут Курбончон. Она замужем за мастера-отделочника и у них трое детей. Дочери учатся в школе, а сыну всего два года. Ее муж предоставляет свои услуги в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд, где они и живут. Курбончон тоже работает. Она умная трудоспособная женщина. Вот уже 8 лет как Курбончон берет заказ на пошив женских национальных и европейских платьев. Она работает в ателье. Сейчас Курбончон хочет расширить свою деятельность. Она просит кредит в размере 1000 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки модели Janome. С помощью такой машинки она будет не только шить, но и делать красивые вышивки на платьях и ее сфера услуг расширится. Поэтому Курбончон очень важен этот кредит.
texts.en: Meet Qurbonjon, a 37-year-old seamstress.  She is married to a master handyman with whom she has three children (two school-age daughters and a son who is just 2 years old).  Her husband works in the B. Gafurov district of the city of Khujand, where they live.  Qurbonjon is also working.  She is an intelligent and hardworking woman.  For the past eight years, she has been taking orders and sewing women's traditional Tajik dresses as well as "European style" dresses.  She works in a shop and wants to increase her activity.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a Janome sewing machine.  This new machine will allow her not only to sew, but also to create beautiful embroidery patterns, which will expand her range of services.  This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy a "Janome" sewing machine.

loans.name: María Modesta

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos 23, 21, 15 y 5 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y  joyas de plata, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. Ella trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días.  Lo que más vende son los perfumes. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a las ventas con la cual ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar sobretodo en los gastos que generan los estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y joyas de plata. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Jaramijo communal bank meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo canton, which is known for its beautiful beaches.  Here the majority of the inhabitants are very hard-working and make a living through the labors of the sea.

Señora María lives here.  She is 41 years old, is married, and from this relationship has four children who are 23, 21, 15, and 5 years old.  The two younger ones are in high school and primary school.  Her husband makes a living fishing.

Doña María is a very good wife who, in order to get her own resources, makes a living selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women) and silver jewelry.  Her sales method is door-to-door.  She works four days a week, sells her products via credit, and collects every eight days.  She sells perfume the most.  For more than five years she has dedicated herself to sales, with which she has helped her husband get ahead at home, particularly with the costs generated from her children's studies.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and silver jewelry.  She has spent more than 10 years in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she receives from the loans.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business sewing gloves for the last 6 years with the support of her husband. She purchases raw material from the market, and, after sewing gloves in different sizes and colors, she sells them to the people of her community and in the local market. Through her business she earns a good amount of income. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide support to her family. She is requesting her fourth loan. She wants to take a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, wool, and cloth, along with packs of needles. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, wool, and cloth, along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Bertha Elvira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Bertha, tiene 56 años, hace varios años quedo viuda y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun vive con ella. 
Doña Bertha es una mujer muy trabajadora  que para lograr sus propios recursos y con estos salir adelante se dedica al comercio, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende  aguas, jugos, energizantes, cervezas, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otras cosas de picar, de esta forma ella logra ganarse algo por su cuenta que le sirve para el sustento diario. Lleva más de 20 años con esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar colas, jugos, aguas entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos puede mejorar su negocio. Sus sueños son salir adelante.
texts.en:
The credit group Jaramijo meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo area, which is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of those living there are very hardworking and work in jobs related to the sea. This is where Bertha lives. She's 56 years old and she became a widow several years ago. She had six children with her husband, who are all grown now. One of them still lives with her.

Bertha is a very hardworking woman who earns a living in trade. She has a store in her house where she sells water, juice, energy drinks, beer, soda and candy, among other snack items. This is how she is able to earn money to provide for her daily needs. She's done this for more than 20 years, and it allows her to keep moving forward.

She's going to use this loan to buy soda, juice and water, as well as other things to sell. She's been with the credit group since they began and she likes it because she's able to improve her business with the loans. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, water, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, está cursando el tercer año de la carrera Administración de Empresas y comenta que su meta futura es tener su propia empresa y poder aplicar todo lo que pudo aprender por medio de sus estudios.
Ella es una persona muy estudiosa que quiere salir adelante, y sabe que la única forma de poder lograrlo es por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Maria is a responsible and hard-working person. She is in her third year of studies for a Business Administration degree. She states that her future goal is to have her own business and be able to apply all that she was able to learn through her studies.

Maria is a studious person that wants to get ahead, and she knows that the only way to achieve that is through her studies. She is requesting a loan to pay for university tuition. This way she can continue with her studies, and keep striving towards her goals.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 46-year-old, hardworking woman who has two children.  For the last 8 years, she has been stitching clothes in her locality.  She is quite popular for her skills. 

Kalsoom’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing.  Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

In her 5th loan cycle, Kalsoom has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR.  She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and lace. 

She is very thankful for her previous loans, and hopes that this loan will support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and lace.

loans.name: Maritza Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jaramijo se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo que es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos 23, 20, 16, 13 y 5 años, los menores estudian en colegio y escuela la menor es especial por lo cual requiere de muchos cuidados. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y es chofer.
Doña Maritza es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene una lancha en la cual se dedica a la pesca, el junto a dos personas se van a alta mar a realizar sus faenas de pesca, se van por tres a cuatro días a realizar sus labores, una vez transcurrido estos días ellos regresan a la playa donde entregan los peces a comerciantes que llegan hasta a este lugar a comprar sus productos, el en los días que no se dedica a la pesca también hace fletes en una moto taxi que tiene y con lo cual también se gana la vida cuando no hay pesca. 
Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y repuestos para la moto taxi para brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva más de 6 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The credit group Jaramijo meets every 15 days in the Jaramijo area, which is known for its beautiful beaches. The majority of the people there are very hard-working and work in jobs related to the sea. This is where Maritza lives. She's 43 years old, married and has five kids from this marriage. They are 23, 20, 16, 13 and 5. The youngest ones are in high school and one has special needs, which requires a lot of care. Her husband is a fisherman and a driver.

Maritza is a great housewife. She's asking for the loan so that her husband can use it for work. He has a boat that he uses to fish, and together with two others, they go deep out into the ocean to fish. They go for three or four days to work and once they're done, they go back to shore where they bring the fish to vendors who come to buy their products. In the days that he's not fishing, he also carries cargo on his motortaxi, which is how he makes a living when he can't fish. 

This loan will be used to buy nets, string, fuel and spare parts for his motortaxi so that he can provide a better service. She's been a part of the credit group for over six years and she likes it because of the help that she always gets from the loans. Her dream is to have her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy nets, string, fuel and spare parts.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, esta cursando el 5to año, vive con sus padres y una hermana, está luchando pero aun no tiene un trabajo formal, se dedica a realizar trabajos por computadora  para los estudiantes de los colegios  que están cerca de su casa, su objetivo es terminar su estudio y de esa manera trabajar en su profesión. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Diego is a comercial engineering student in his fifth year. He lives with his parents and sister. He's working hard but doesn't have a formal job yet. He works from his computer for high school students close to his house. He goal is to finish his studies and work in his field.

He's asking for this loan to be able to pay his university tuition, which will allow him to continue with his studies and to keep fighting to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, oil, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, grains, oil, and beverages.

loans.name: Ahmady

texts.en:
Ahmady is a 51 year-old married woman who has sold milk for many years.  She has two buffaloes for milking.  Ahmady sells in her neighborhood. 

Her business is doing well enough to give her a decent life.  She is very motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and clothing.  

It’s her 5th year with Kashf Foundation.  Now, she has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase one more cow for milking. 

She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sugrah

texts.en:
Sugrah is a 46 year-old married mother of four children.  To support her family she began selling milk.  

Sugrah is known in her town for providing good quality milk.  In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers Sugrah requested a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. 

She is in her 4th loan cycle.  Sugrah is hopeful that increased milk production will help her generate greater income.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 58 year-old married woman.  She has successfully run a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. 

Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Naseem is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy salts, oil, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands from customers. 

Naseem is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salts, oil, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 38 year-old married woman with four children.  She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. 

Rubina can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands.  Her skill is known throughout he town. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle and has requested for a loan amount of 45000 PKR.  This loan will enable Rubina to purchase beads, threads, frames etc. 

This monetary help can take Rubina reach her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase beads, threads, frames etc.

loans.name: Sameera Group

texts.en:
This is the group Sameera, which consists of four women: Muna, Aisha, Fatima and Fatima. These members applied for a first loan which was given by Kiva lenders. The members of the group didn't complete the first loan and some of the members have since changed. They applied for a second loan of 120,000 YER.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 27-year-old single woman living with her family in Hodeidah City, Yemen. She is an uneducated woman but she is very active and a dynamic, youthful woman. Due to her family's miserable living conditions, she couldn't complete her studies. Fatima didn't surrender to her miserable conditions but instead decided to work. She sells women's and children's clothes and different kinds of accessories, perfumes, and incenses door-to-door. She has been in this business for only one year. Fatima found this business to be profitable for her and she earns good profits from it, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. In order to further expand her business, Fatima asked for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of stylish, ready-made women's and children's clothes and different kinds of incense, perfumes, and accessories and to resell them to customers.

Fatima looks forward to further expanding her business by opening a large shop for selling stylish clothes, perfumes, incense and other accessories.

loans.use: to purchase more stylish, ready-made women's and children's clothes and different kinds of incense, perfumes, and accessories to resell to customers

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Kotayq village with her husband and two daughters. 

Hasmik, a nurse by profession, is involved in agriculture. She grows fruit trees and her husband helps her to sell the gathered harvest and earn income for the family. 

Hasmik has applied for this loan of 3,000 to enlarge her farm. She plans to purchase an ox, wheat seeds, and fertilizer. She hopes for lenders' support of her loan and relies on their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, wheat seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen wants a loan to pay school fees for his children. He is in the business of poultry farming and he earns a salary to increase his income. He started the business to cater to his family's needs. He desires to educate his children in spite of the family's inadequate capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old married woman. For the past 3 years, she has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases fancy cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and then sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Shaheen is in her 5th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy greater varieties of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy greater varieties of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 50-year-old divorced woman. Twenty-nine years ago, she started to work in pasting and selling paper bags and their necessary straps to printing companies to cover the needs and expenses of her family which consists of four extra members.

Today, Najwa is acquiring a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to make necessary registration fee payments for her land.
Najwa is the sole earner of her family. She hopes to expand her business more in order to provide her beloved family with better living conditions.
This is Najwa's fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, through her previous loans she has developed her business significantly, and she has proven to be an upstanding borrower.

loans.use: To make necessary registration fee payments for her land

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli está estudiando para salir adelante, vive con sus padres, estudia para ser alguien en la vida, ayudar a su familia, ser útil a la sociedad y el orgullo de su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder salir adelante y ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Araceli is studying so she can get ahead. She lives with her parents. She studies so she can be someone in life, help her family, and contribute to society and the good name of her family.

She is studying the profession of Industrial Engineer, and through her studies she wants to be able to get ahead and be a useful professional in society. She is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition so that she can continue with her studies as she already has been.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 41-year-old single lady who has worked as an accountant for eight years to cover the needs and expenses of her family, which consists of two other members.

Abir is the sole earner in her family and she is trying hard to provide them with better living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house in an attempt to make it a healthier place for her family.

loans.use: To renovate her house in an attempt to make it a healthier place for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair one of her taxis which has mechanical problems.

loans.name: Esteri

texts.en: Esteri is a 35-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibigyo, Uganda. She started her business of buying and selling cocoa seven years ago. She has worked very hard to maintain her business, although seasonality affects her. Her customers are both men and women and she would like a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 38-year-old, hard-working woman who has 7 children. For the last four years, Kishwar has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. 

Kishwar’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele base. In her sixth loan cycle, Kishwar has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine plus some spools of threads and buttons. She hopes that this loan will further support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine plus some spools of threads and buttons.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married Ugandan male living in Masindi.

Patrick is in the business of cattle fattening and he also sells milk to increase his income. He started the business to cater for his family's needs. Patrick has a dream of educating his children to University level.

He wants a loan to buy cows to re-sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to re-sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está estudiando para independizarse económicamente de sus padres y asi también poder ayudarles a ellos por medio de sus estudios.
 Maria está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y por medio de esta carrera quiere poder salir adelante y ayudar a las demàs personas que necesiten atencion en algo tan importante como es su salud.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por su meta de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Maria is going to school in order to become economically independent of her parents, and thus to also be able to help them by means of her education.

Maria is studying in the nursing program, and through this career she wants to be able to get ahead and to help other people who need attention in something as important as their health.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees and in this way be able to continue with her studies, striving toward her goal of being a good professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 31 años de edad, estudia la carrera de ingeniería informática y ahora debe presentar su tesis, lo que le lleva muchos gastos extras, está acompañada y su pareja no tiene un ingreso fijo mensual, tiene una hija, por quienes ambos se están esforzando para poder darle una vida digna sin privaciones.
Gloria trabaja como secretaria en un centro de formación profesional, necesita poder terminar sus estudios, para de esa forma poder conseguir un trabajo acorde a sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en los gastos de su tesis, ya que implica un gran gasto que le gustaría poder cubrir.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old. She is studying computer engineering and now must present her thesis, which involves many extra costs.  She has a partner  who does not have a fixed monthly income.   Gloria also has a daughter,and they both make every effort to give their child a decent life without privations.

Gloria works as secretary in a center of professional formation.  She needs to complete her studies in order to get a better job in accordance with her school work.  She is asked for this loan to spend on the costs for her thesis, since that involves a considerable expense which she wants to cover.

loans.use: to pay the costs for her thesis

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es de la ciudad de Caaguzú, es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus estudios.
Está siguiendo la carrera de enfermería, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder dar a las personas que necesitan ayuda en su salud, una buena atención.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
Oscar is from the city of Caaguzú. He is a person who is striving to be able to advance and to help other people through his education.

He is continuing in the nursing program, and through his studies he wants to be able to give good attention to people who need help with their health.

He is requesting this loan to pay the fees for his program, so that in this way he can continue toward his goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anichka

texts.en:
Anichka lives in Arshaluys village in the Armavir region with her husband and two children (aged 8 and 6 years old). 

Anichka is an experienced farmer. To take care of the family's needs, both her and her husband are extensively engaged in agribusiness. They are involved in the cultivation of haricot, potatoes, cabbage, cucumber and greens. Anichka's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market; this is the main source of the family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anichka needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and glass for the greenhouse. The loan will help the family sustain their agribusiness. Anichka and her husband highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and glass for the greenhouse

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en: Ashkhen lives in Metsamor town with her son and daughter-in-law. Since 2006, Askhen has been selling fruits and vegetables in the local open market in Metsamor village. She is a very hardworking woman who does her best to sustain her family's living. As autumn is progressing and demand for fruits and vegetables is quite high, Askhen would like to enlarge her business. She has requested this loan to purchase new stock of supplies (fruits and vegetables). Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Ashkhen will be very grateful to lenders for their support and the opportunity to develop her business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies for her retail business (selling fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a 38-year-old married woman with six children. She deals in the business of buying and selling cocoa. She has stayed in this business for five years and she hopes to have a bigger business to enable her to attain more profits so that she may better look after her family. She would like the loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 37-year-old woman married to Jeremiah. They are blessed with five children. She adds additional income to support their family's welfare.  Grace has been operating a restaurant for a period of ten years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Grace is now servicing her second loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to use this entire amount to buy maize flour, cooking fat, and wheat flour to prepare food for her customers on a daily basis.

Grace plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a successful business woman in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking fat and wheat flour to prepare food for her customers.

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is 29 years old. She is single and supports two children of 10 and 7 years, respectively. Maurine makes cakes and other snacks for sale. She has conducted this business for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 60,000.

Maurine has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which she will use to buy bales of baking flour for making cakes.

With the anticipated profits, Maurine will be able to uplift her family's living standards. Her hopes and dreams are to enlarge her business and expand further.

loans.use: to buy bales of baking flour for making cakes

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush runs a small food market in the center of Alashkert town. She sells food as well as some home supplies. 

Haykanush lives with her husband and two sons. Her elder son is a student and the second one is of school age. 

Haykanush's husband greatly helps her with running the market and they both work hard to sustain the family's living. The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Haykanush to purchase a grill machine for the store, and dishes. The new purchase will give her an opportunity to increase her sales and she hopes for lenders' goodwill.

Haykanush has already taken a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, she has been able to run her market in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a grill machine for the store, and dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
Charllote is in her forties. She is married and has one school-going child. She supports her family with income from her business. She employed herself in a business where she sells pork, beef, cooking oil, rice and beans. Charllote has been in her business for 11 years now and is able to realize a good profit each month. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily.
